A climber on Mount McKinley suffered severe frostbite, likely compounded by AMS and dehydration, and faced prolonged evacuation delays due to bad weather, ultimately resulting in the probable loss of multiple fingers and toes.
A climber developed high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) at 4300 meters on the West Buttress route of Mount McKinley and was evacuated.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Northeast Fork of the Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber experienced hyperventilation-induced cerebellar ischemia (HICI) while ascending on a fixed line on Mount McKinley, causing ataxia and dizziness, but recovered after rest and medical attention.
A climber fell and fractured his ankle when the rappel anchor sling knot failed during a rappel on Mount Rundle.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Five Open Books area
description: A climber was stung multiple times by bees after disturbing their nest on a ledge while climbing in Yosemite Valley and required medical treatment.
A climber bouldering alone without a rope had a hold break, climbed too high to downclimb, and jumped, sustaining a bruised heel, strained knee, and minor lacerations.
A climber fell 20 meters when multiple pieces of protection failed, resulting in a broken femur; he and his partner completed the climb and he was later evacuated.
A party of three roped together fell 180 meters on Mount Joffre after the leader slipped on ice and snow; one climber suffered injuries to his left ankle and knee.

location_name: British Columbia, Coast Mountains, Mount Tantalus
description: A climber fell 35 meters into a bergschrund after a snow bridge collapsed, sustaining fatal head injuries.
A climber soloing Serenity Crack dropped his rope after reaching the top of the first pitch and became stranded. He was rescued by other climbers.
A lone, inexperienced scrambler became stranded on Cascade Mountain after failing to retrace his steps and falling into a gully, requiring a rescue.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Monument, Intersection Rock
description: A solo climber with little experience became stranded on "The Flake" (5.8) at Joshua Tree and was rescued by others.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A group of five inexperienced climbers attempted the North Face route on Longs Peak with inadequate equipment and became stranded, requiring rescue by park rangers and other climbers.
A three-man Japanese team attempting a winter ascent of Mount McKinley's West Buttress was caught in extreme winds near Denali Pass, resulting in a fall and their deaths.
Three climbers fell approximately 700 meters while descending the "Orient Express" ice couloir on Mount McKinley during poor weather conditions and died.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber was blown from his tent during a storm on Mount McKinley due to inadequate anchors and protection, resulting in a 180-meter slide down the slope but no injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress, near 5200 meters
description: On Mount McKinley, high winds blew a tent with three occupants off the West Buttress; two climbers fell to a ledge and were later evacuated, while the third was freed as the tent slid.
Climber fell from an artificial climbing wall after jumping off and stripping protection, resulting in bruising.

A snow bridge collapsed while descending Mount Rainier, causing two climbers to fall into a crevasse. Both climbers sustained injuries but were able to self-rescue and were later evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, East Face of Longs Peak
description: John Ashby fell approximately 45 meters while soloing unroped on thinly iced Alexander's Chimney without crampons, sustaining multiple injuries.
A climber with limited ice climbing experience fell approximately 300 meters on Mount Colden's Trap Dike and died from her injuries.

location_name: Sawtooth Mountains, unnamed mountain near Baron Peak
description: Louis Stur fell to his death while climbing alone and unroped on an unnamed mountain near Baron Peak in the Sawtooth Mountains. Falling rock may have been a factor.

location_name: Crab Orchard National Wildlife Refuge, Panthers Den
description: An instructor fell while attempting to rappel without a proper belay setup after miscommunication with the belayer and fatigue contributed to the accident.

A climber fell while following another party on a 5.8 variation of the Whitney-Gilman Ridge, sustaining a broken arm, lacerations, and a sprained ankle. He was not wearing a helmet and had inadequate protection.
A climber fell while traversing off route, pulling out protection and hitting their head, resulting in unconsciousness and injuries requiring hospitalization.
A climber leading Tricouni Nail fell after going off route, resulting in a broken fibula and dislocated ankle.
A climber fell after attempting a harder variation of the Sabre Route, pulling out protection and sustaining serious injuries including a compound fracture and head trauma.

location_name: Tetons, Lower Saddle headwall, Middle Teton Glacier
description: A roped team of four descending the Grand Teton fell on a snowfield when one member was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a slide and one ankle injury.

location_name: Chikamin Peak, Chikamin Peak, above the Cascade Crest Trail
description: Two climbers descending Chikamin Peak fell on a snow slope into a moat; one sustained serious injuries and required rescue.
A climber slipped on icy fourth class rock while scrambling off route near the summit of Mount Thompson, sustaining a compound fracture.
A climber fell 200 meters to her death after deviating from the planned route on Mount Thompson and encountering rotten rock; a falling rock was witnessed during the fall.
A climber was struck and killed by a watermelon-sized rock dislodged by another climber while descending Mount Warren in the Wind River Range due to approaching bad weather.
A climber dislodged two large rocks while traversing, which fell and crushed him, resulting in his death.
Four climbers attempted Mount Rainier via Liberty Ridge; two separated from the group, one died of hypothermia and the other fell to his death after suffering blunt trauma.
Two climbers were injured while descending Mount Hood after jumping a crevasse while wearing crampons; their crampons locked in the snow upon landing, causing leg injuries.
A climber fell about 20 meters when the sling being used for a rappel anchor parted, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber fell 12 meters when his rappel ropes parted due to a knot failure, resulting in broken legs and a heel.
A climber with limited experience using Friends fell after a placement pulled out on a wet section of rock, sustaining scrapes and bruises.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore’s Wall
description: A climber was killed by lightning while seeking shelter under a ledge at Moore's Wall in Hanging Rock State Park.
A climber lost control while glissading, pulling his partner off their stance. They tumbled down the glacier approximately 500 vertical feet before being stopped by the rope snagging on a bulge.
Two climbers were overdue on the East Ridge of the Grand Teton due to inexperience and bad weather; one climber fell and was momentarily knocked unconscious before being rescued.
A 25-year-old man became stranded on Cathedral Ledge, unable to ascend or descend, and required rescue.
Two climbers separated after a disagreement; one reached the road, the other got lost due to poor visibility and spent an extra night out before being found.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Mixup Peak
description: Climbers ascended Mixup Peak in fog, got off route, and on the descent one climber fell and broke his ankle after downclimbing a waterfall. Rescue was delayed due to weather.
The leader placed a Friend as an anchor to lower off, but it pulled out, resulting in a three-meter fall and a broken ankle.
Two ice climbers were caught in an avalanche in the "Big Bowl" of Mount Andromeda; one was buried in a crevasse and rescued, suffering hypothermia and frostbite.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Southeast Fork of the Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber on Mount McKinley suffered from cerebral edema and was assisted down the mountain after being left by his partners during a summit attempt.
A climber fell after an old webbing sling on a piton broke when he weighted it, resulting in bruises and a broken ankle.
A climber fell into a crevasse while traveling unroped on the French Glacier. He was rescued and treated for bruises, cuts, scratches, and hypothermia.
A climber fell into a crevasse while unroped on Mount White Pyramid and sustained a head injury. He was rescued by his partners and the group returned to camp.
A 10-year-old boy fell into a crevasse on the Athabasca Glacier and died despite rescue attempts.
After ice climbing, Greg G. fell while descending Mount Rundle, sustaining a humerus fracture and a distal radius fracture.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Chimney
description: A climber fell 25 meters after ice tools pulled through melting ice, striking a chockstone, but sustained only minor injuries due to a helmet and a good belay.
Gary Wheeler fell 15 meters and slid another 30 meters after slipping while adjusting a rope for his partner who was attempting to climb a waterfall.
Two roped teams fell on hard ice on Mount Shasta's Hotlum Glacier, resulting in lower leg and ankle injuries, and one climber spending the night on the glacier with frostbite.
Two climbers roped together without protection fell 65 meters on the North Glacier route of Mount Aberdeen after one lost a crampon, resulting in ankle and wrist fractures.

A climber wearing Birkenstock sandals fell approximately eight meters while attempting to climb to the top of a granite bench after swimming at the top of lower Yosemite Falls, sustaining serious injuries.
Troy Johnson fell while solo climbing the route "Revised" in the Church Bowl area. He was intoxicated and not using ropes or protection, resulting in serious injuries.
Susan Green fell 15-24 meters while free soloing Comfortably Numb, a 5.10 climb, and sustained bilateral fractures of the tibia and fibula.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Five and Dime Cliff
description: Matthew Tomlinson fell while lead climbing Keystone Corner after placing inadequate protection, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber fell 10 meters after being lowered from an anchor where the rope was threaded through a tape sling, which melted through, resulting in a severe pelvic injury.
T.C. fell while leading Cadillac Jack, striking a ledge and severely injuring her right ankle, requiring helicopter evacuation.

location_name: British Columbia, Purcell Mountains, Vowell Group, Tamarack Glen above the north margin of the Vowell Glacier
description: A climber lost her balance while bouldering and fell approximately three meters, resulting in a chipped metatarsal bone in her left foot.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Grotto Creek, Grotto Slabs
description: W.M. fell while climbing on Grotto Slabs, sustaining cuts, scrapes, and bruises to his left hand, right thigh, and the right side of his rib cage.
Randy Joseph fell ten meters while leading Alexander's Chimney on Longs Peak, pulling out a stopper and sustaining a fractured fibula and displaced tibia.
A climber fell ten meters after protection pulled out, resulting in a broken wrist and ankle. The climber was inexperienced and the rock was loose.
A 20-year-old inexperienced rock climber fell approximately 50 meters while scrambling unroped on slabs on Mount Rundle and died.

route_name: Aemmer snow couloir variant to the East Ridge route
description: Two climbers descending Mount Temple fell after the first climber slipped on saturated snow; the second climber lost control while trying to hold the fall, resulting in a longer fall and ultimately the death of the first climber.
A climber slipped on a snow slope while descending Mount Blakiston, sliding 15 meters into rocks and sustaining a broken tibia and other injuries.

Two mountaineers were climbing Bold Peak when one was caught in two avalanches, resulting in serious injuries including a broken ankle and other trauma; inadequate equipment and unstable snow conditions contributed to the accident.
Two climbers descending the Hotlum glacier route on Mount Shasta went off-route, fell 50+ meters through an ice chute and over cliffs, resulting in two fatalities.
Five climbers on Eklutna Glacier fell 60 meters after one lost footing on a snow slide, dragging the others down; one was critically injured.
Richard Ferrell fell or was knocked down by debris on Sergeants Ridge, sliding 300 meters and suffering fatal head trauma.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Cassin Ridge to West Rib traverse
description: Two climbers fell roped together while attempting a traverse from the Cassin Ridge to the West Rib, likely due to a shortage of food and fuel and severe weather.

location_name: British Columbia, Rocky Mountains, Mount Robson
description: Two climbers fell approximately 75 meters while descending Mount Robson after not being belayed. They sustained injuries and were rescued after a storm complicated the situation.
A climber descending Mount Conness glacier slipped and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a spiral fracture of his right lower leg when his crampon caught.

location_name: British Columbia, Purcell Mountains, Vowell Group, Peak 9250 (north of Little Howser)
description: A climber descending unroped on snow and ice slipped on loose rock, fell about ten meters, and fractured his left ankle.
A climber was struck by a falling rock while descending Mount Shasta due to high winds and bare ridges, resulting in a laceration and headache.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed severe pulmonary edema (HAPE) at 4260 meters and was evacuated after receiving oxygen and descending.
A climber died from pulmonary edema on Mount McKinley after being left behind while the rest of the team summited; several others suffered severe frostbite and became lost due to poor visibility.

A climber on the Grand Sentinel pulled off a large rock, which fell on his hand, breaking two fingers; he was able to complete the pitch and was later treated at a hospital, eventually losing one finger.
A climber fell after a handhold broke while solo climbing unroped near Grassi Lakes, resulting in a compound fracture of the left tibia and fibula.
A climber fell after a Friend pulled out while downclimbing, resulting in a shattered jaw and broken wrist.

location_name: Purcell Mountains, Bugaboo Group, Conrad Kain Hut
description: A pot of boiling water was knocked off a stove, scalding C.F.'s ankles, resulting in second-degree burns.
A climber fell 700 meters to his death after slipping on loose rock while traversing unroped on the northeast ridge of Mount Assiniboine.
A lone climber descending Mount Temple's tourist route slipped on scree and bedrock, falling approximately 65 meters to their death.
A climber descending Mount Lefroy unroped while glissading with crampons lost control, caught a crampon, and fractured his ankle.

location_name: British Columbia, Coast Mountains, Pemberton Area, Soo Bluffs
description: An ice climber got stranded on a waterfall due to thin ice and inability to place a belay; he was rescued and treated for frostbite.
D.K. was stranded on a ledge after pulling a rock loose, sustaining minor injuries. M.S. and partner rescued him.
Climber dropped his rope after lowering his partner and was stranded on a ledge due to impending darkness.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers attempting Kiener's Route on Longs Peak were caught in a storm, lacked adequate gear, spent a night out, and were found in Glacier Gorge with minor cold injuries.
A solo ice climber on Cascade Mountain was stranded due to cold temperatures and incorrect information about the descent, resulting in frostbite.
A skier triggered a soft slab avalanche in Tuckerman Ravine, was tumbled and partially buried, but sustained only bruises and lost a ski.
Two climbers were hit by an avalanche while descending Dragontail Peak in freezing rain and snowfall; one climber fell approximately 300 meters and sustained serious injuries.
A climber fell approximately 25 meters after slipping on a slab covered with wet leaves and dirt while walking along the top of the cliff without crampons or an ice ax, resulting in a fatal injury.
A climber fell 4-5 meters after the top protection pulled out while downclimbing/being lowered, resulting in injuries including fractures and a brief loss of consciousness.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Spencer Hannah fell 60 meters on the icy North Face of Longs Peak after ignoring warnings and leading a group of beginners unroped on a technical route, resulting in serious injuries and a rescue operation.
A climber fell approximately 30 meters while descending unroped on mixed snow and rock conditions, sustaining serious injuries.

A climber fell approximately 180 meters on the Grand Teton after traversing off the Owen-Spalding route, sustaining fatal injuries; a possible contributing factor was thought process impairment due to previous head injuries.
TW fell while leading Stone King, fracturing his ankle after striking a pedestal. EO belayed him and helped him escape the canyon after retrieving ascenders from their car.
A climber fell after getting off route on more difficult terrain, pulling protection, and hitting ledges, resulting in severe contusions and requiring rescue.
A climber fell while climbing a wet chimney, was struck by falling rocks, and sustained a head injury. They were lowered and rappelled to safety with assistance from other climbers and a rescue team.
Cameron slipped on wet rock and fell, pulling the unanchored belayer, Joe, off balance. Both fell, resulting in minor injuries to Joe.
A climber fell while leading the Middle Crack on Flake Slab, sustaining a rib injury. The fall was likely due to inadequate equipment and fatigue.
Ulrich Moderl fell 15 meters from the 5.9 crux pitch of the South Ridge on Notchtop, sustaining a fractured right ankle and pain in his right knee and back.
Tim Herron fell five meters from Dire Straights, struck his head, and later died.
A climber fell from Cave Wall on Standard route, suffering a concussion and lower back pain.
Jim Ladd fell 12 meters after his hands slipped while mantling, resulting in a fractured hip and head injury; a nut pulled out during the fall.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, the Pear
description: Marcus Hall took a five meter leader fall while attempting to clip the first bolt on La Chaim, a 5.7 route on the Pear.
A climber fell 25 meters after a hex placement pulled out while attempting a crux move, resulting in serious injuries despite wearing a helmet.
Creth Edward Cupp fell 25 meters while leading the last pitch of the Southwest Face of The Tooth, pulling two pieces of protection and sustaining severe head injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Sundance Buttress
description: Richard Jakush fell six meters while climbing Bonzo on Sundance Buttress after a piece of protection pulled out, resulting in a fractured skull and brain contusion; he was not wearing a helmet and the weather was deteriorating.
A climber fell on a snowfield after losing a ski pole basket, which led to the loss of both ski poles and a period of starvation before being rescued.
A climber in a party of 11 fell 45 meters on icy snow while descending Silver Peak due to bad weather, inexperience, and inadequate equipment, but was rescued and walked out OK.
A climber was injured by rockfall on Union Jack on Cannon Cliff in May.
A climber fell after a handhold and rock anchor failed, resulting in a fractured ankle. The fall was arrested by chocked protection.

location_name: Baxter State Park, Mount Katahdin, Knife Edge near Pamola Peak
description: A 13-year-old boy was killed by lightning while hiking the Knife Edge near Pamola Peak with a Boy Scout troop; two others were injured during a brief, severe storm.
A climber fell into a crevasse while glissading on Mount Baker's Roman Wall due to soft snow and slick clothing, resulting in a fatal head injury.
A student lost control during a head-first glissade practice, resulting in cuts and a puncture wound from the ice ax.

location_name: Tetons, Lower Saddle, near the base of Middle Teton
description: Shawn Callahan lost control during a voluntary glissade, resulting in a broken leg and head laceration; a second hiker, John Schall, also slid and was injured at the same location later that day.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Andrews Glacier
description: A 17-year-old female broke her right fibula while glissading on Andrews Glacier during a class due to inadequate instruction and supervision.
A climber died after falling 18 meters when a rappel anchor failed; the anchor was improperly rigged with a single sling and non-locking carabiner.
Two climbers descending Mount Baker fell into a crevasse after one slipped on ice and pulled the other in; both were injured and evacuated.
A climber sat down unexpectedly and slid into a crevasse, knocking down another climber who died from a broken neck; the first climber sustained a dislocated shoulder.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded in the dark on the False Keyhole of Longs Peak after descending from the Diamond due to a lack of knowledge of the descent route.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Longs Peak due to icy conditions, poor route finding, and a winter storm, requiring rescue.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Paradise to Camp Muir area
description: A Special Forces unit encountered blizzard conditions on Mount Rainier, leading to hypothermia and frostbite in some members, disorientation, and a delayed return to Paradise.

location_name: Mount Hood, 3000 meter level on the south side
description: Cassandra Kelley experienced altitude sickness and hypothermia symptoms on Mount Hood and was transported to Timberline Lodge after her group encountered high winds and blizzard conditions near the summit.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Haston-Scott route on the south face
description: Two Japanese climbers called for rescue due to Acute Mountain Sickness, but communication issues delayed identification; they eventually summited and descended, reporting to the ranger camp.
A six-man Search and Rescue team was struck by an avalanche during a training exercise; one person was killed, one seriously injured, and one slightly injured.
A climber fell 400 meters to their death after breaking through a cornice on Saddle Mountain while unroped.

location_name: Selkirk Mountains, Asulkan Range, Mount Leda
description: A mountaineer fell after a cornice collapsed under him while approaching the edge of a ridge, triggering a small avalanche and causing serious injuries.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Mount McKinley, West Buttress route, near summit
description: A Polish climber became disoriented due to rapidly deteriorating weather near the summit of Mount McKinley, leading to exhaustion, dehydration, and severe frostbite requiring amputation of both feet.
Larry Sorenson experienced a recurrence of acute colitis at 14,000 feet and was evacuated by helicopter due to his inability to descend.
Climbers descending from Abbot's Pass hut jumped a bergschrund, but one climber skidded into the crevasse, pulling the others and their improperly placed anchor in as well, resulting in injuries.
Climber fell about eight feet to the pavement when a handhold and foothold broke off at the same time on an artificial climbing wall, resulting in a sprained ankle and broken heel bone.

A climber fell approximately 150 to 200 feet while descending the North Dome gully in Yosemite after completing the Royal Arches climb; the trail was wet and icy due to a recent storm, and the climber was not roped up.
A climber fell during descent after losing a crampon, pulling his partner into a crevasse; one climber sustained a laceration and hypothermia, while the other was uninjured.

location_name: Mount Foraker, Icy couloir on approach to the Infinite Spur on the south side of Mount Foraker
description: Two climbers fell while descending an icy couloir on Mount Foraker, sustaining multiple injuries including broken bones and abrasions, and self-rescued after being unable to signal for help.
Clarence fell approximately 100 meters while descending a gully near Castle Crags after hiking and scrambling, resulting in his death; inadequate equipment and inexperience were contributing factors.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Petit Grepon
description: A climber took a lead fall on the 5.8 crux of the South Face of Petit Grepon, sustaining an open fracture of his right ankle and required rescue.
Two climbers attempting the East Buttress Route on Mount Whitney fell to their deaths in deteriorating weather conditions; they were not prepared for the climb.
Griff Smith took a leader fall on Capital Peak, generating rockfall that caused a compound ankle fracture and head injury.
Bruce Parker fell 250 meters after a rockfall while scouting a descent route unroped on Clyde Minaret, resulting in his death.
A climber fell 100-150 feet while setting up a belay on the Prow route of Washington's Column, pulling three pieces of protection. Fatigue and rotten rock may have contributed to the fall.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, North's Cliffs
description: During a rescue practice, a team fell 25 feet after a prusik locked and the haul line was cut, resulting in contusions and abrasions for two rescuers.
Kent Jameson fell 100-150 feet from a ledge on Thunder Bolt Peak after failing to secure himself before releasing the rappelling rope, resulting in a punctured lung and death.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Cascade Mountain, Bankhead Buttress
description: A climber fell ten meters while trying to place protection on uncharted rock, resulting in a badly broken foot.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber took a 15 foot lead fall while leading the second pitch of Organ Pipes, impacting a ledge and sustaining an open tibia/fibula fracture.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, East End of Rundle
description: Two climbers fell to their deaths on the Mackay Route after the leader placed no protection and the belayer's anchor failed, pulling both climbers down the face.

A climber fell 15 meters on pitch four of Gooseberry after failing to place protection, resulting in unconsciousness and broken wrists; the belayer held the fall and the victim was rescued by helicopter.
A climber fell 15 meters when a small tree used for protection pulled out, resulting in spinal injury and lacerations.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Manure Pile Buttress
description: A climber fell while lead climbing when protection pulled out, resulting in a fractured and dislocated ankle and abrasions.

location_name: Pinnacle Peak, East Wall, Lizard Lip
description: A climber fell while leading a 5.8 route, and slack in the rope caused a broken ankle. The climber was lowered to the ground and evacuated by rescue services.
J.B. fell while down-climbing on the descent from Mount Edith Cavell after summitting the east ridge, resulting in a fatality.
A climber traversing a steep snow slope without a belay slipped, was unable to self-arrest, and fell into rocks and over a cliff, sustaining injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber fell approximately 1,500 feet to Mills Glacier while attempting Kiener’s Route on Longs Peak in adverse weather conditions, including heavy snowfall and extreme avalanche danger, while climbing solo and unroped.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Mark Horton slipped while traversing a snowfield at the base of the Cables Route, sustaining a dislocated left shoulder and abrasion.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Judy Swales and Randy Moss fell 300-400 feet on Lamb's Slide after Swales slipped on snow; Moss self-arrested, but Swales sustained a fractured wrist and sprained ankle.
A climber fell on crusty snow while descending after a climb, sliding 100 meters and sustaining back, leg, and neck injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Mount Rundle, Professors Gully
description: A climber soloing the second pitch of Professors Falls fell after his tools pulled, resulting in a broken leg.
A climber was struck in the back of the neck by a grapefruit-sized rock dislodged by another party while belaying on the East Buttress route of El Capitan, resulting in injuries.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Denali Pass, West Buttress route
description: Four members of an expedition became separated on their descent from Mount McKinley due to fatigue, AMS, and poor weather, resulting in falls and injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Eagle Cliff Mountain
description: A rescuer pinched fingers while descending a rope using Jumar ascenders during a training session due to confusion with hand placement.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A climber fell approximately ten meters when a handhold broke and protection pulled while leading the route “Arrow Float”, resulting in femur and head injuries.
Three climbers attempting El Capitan became wet and cold due to unexpected snow and ice, leading them to request a rescue after realizing they were not prepared for the conditions.

location_name: British Columbia, Selkirk Mountains, Mount Sir Donald
description: A climber was struck by lightning on Mount Sir Donald while descending due to threatening weather; she sustained a minor burn and was rescued by helicopter.
While rappelling the west ridge of Mount Fay, a boulder anchor failed, causing a climber to fall and tumble, resulting in dislocated and broken clavicles.
A climber injured their ankle while descending Terminal Peak due to a slip on scree and talus, possibly influenced by fatigue at the end of a week-long mountaineering course.
A climber slipped on a snow-covered slope while ascending Mount Niblock, sliding 200 meters and sustaining a fractured femur; the group was inadequately equipped and inexperienced.
Two climbers became stranded on Mount Abraham due to darkness, difficult terrain, and deteriorating weather conditions, requiring a rescue.

route_name: Human Fly Trap, Overexposure, or Neophyte
description: A climber became stranded one pitch up Lembert Dome due to feeling the climb was beyond his ability and lacking sufficient equipment to rappel; he was rescued by SAR.

route_name: Sea of Dreams, Tangerine Trip, Native Son
description: Four climbers were rescued from El Capitan due to a winter storm, hypothermia, and inadequate equipment; one climber suffered from frostbite.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Tyndall Glacier
description: A climber triggered an avalanche on Tyndall Glacier, was buried waist deep, sustained a fractured arm, and was able to self-rescue.
A climber was killed and his partner injured in a spindrift avalanche near the top of Odell Gully on Mount Washington.
Two climbers ascending Mount Rainier via the Ingraham Glacier fell into a crevasse after a snowbridge collapsed; one climber died, and the other was trapped but eventually self-rescued.
A climber fell while ice climbing on Mount Baker after failing to place protection and losing purchase on a crux move, resulting in chest, back, and pelvic injuries.
A climber fell on ice on Glacier Peak, was unable to self-arrest, and sustained a broken leg; he was rescued with the help of other climbers and ham radio operators.

location_name: Presidential Range, Mount Adams, Thunderstorm Junction
description: A climber fell and broke her leg due to high winds and ice-covered trails during a Presidential Range traverse on Mount Adams.
A climber fell to his death while attempting a solo ascent of the Black Ice Couloir after his partners decided to abort the climb due to routefinding difficulties and rockfall.
A climber fell 30-35 feet due to mistakenly clipping into a carabiner on her jeans instead of her harness, compounded by inexperience, alcohol consumption, and inadequate supervision.
Adam Gymrek slipped while descending a rock slab on Teewinot, twisting his knee and requiring rescue.

location_name: Icicle Creek, Icicle Creek Buttress, Eight Mile Buttress
description: Jeff Wright fell after a fixed nut pulled out while he was resting, resulting in fractured vertebrae and ankle.
Jon Thompson fell approximately two meters while bouldering in Converse All-Stars, sustaining a fractured carpal.
Climber fell while jumping down from a boulder problem, catching their toe and fracturing their ankle.
Niccy Code fell while climbing unroped on the second pitch of Saber at Castle Rock, resulting in fatal head injuries despite wearing a helmet.
A climber fell after placing inadequate protection and a webbing loop failed, pulling the belayer down as well. Both climbers sustained injuries and were rescued.
Nancy Czech fell about 45 feet from a rock climb when her protection pulled out, resulting in her death a week later.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Thor Peak
description: Forest McCarthy fell about 80 feet while climbing Thor Peak and sustained injuries including a possible broken left elbow, a contusion to the left cheek and a bruised back.

location_name: Wind Rivers, Cirque of the Towers
description: A climber fell about two meters while attempting a move, resulting in a fractured talus and soft tissue injuries. The party was able to manage the situation without outside rescue assistance.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Chaos Canyon
description: An unroped climber lost footing on a snowfield, slid 200-250 feet, struck rock, and sustained serious injuries due to a failure to self-arrest.
A solo climber fell approximately 800 feet after catching a crampon on his gaiter while descending Disappointment Cleaver and failed to self-arrest, resulting in a fatality.
Two climbers fell or were swept from their stance on Dragontail Peak, resulting in fatal injuries and hypothermia.
Robin Day slipped while descending Snoqualmie Mountain on snowshoes, was unable to self-arrest due to powder snow, and fell approximately 500 feet, sustaining serious injuries.
A climber fell 140 feet after a rock outcropping gave way, hitting him in the chest. He died from his injuries.
A climber was struck on the helmet by a rock while standing on a ledge below The Book of Solemnity on Cathedral Ledge; the helmet was split but the climber was unhurt.
A climber was hit in the head by a dislodged rock while descending Whitehorse Mountain and sustained a head injury because he was not wearing a helmet.
Two climbers attempting Liberty Ridge on Mount Rainier became dehydrated and hypothermic, requiring rescue. One climber suffered a broken rib and the other had frostbitten feet and hands.

location_name: North Cascade National Park, Mount Shuksan, Hanging Glacier
description: Two climbers were caught in an ice fall on Mount Shuksan; one was buried and killed, the other was injured.
A climber fell after an ice tool placement failed while climbing an overhanging section of glacier ice, resulting in a broken ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber was struck by lightning while climbing on Longs Peak and sustained minor burns; his partner experienced ground effect but was uninjured.
A climber lost control during a voluntary glissade on Mount Stewart, resulting in injuries due to misjudging the slope, improper self-arrest technique, a heavy pack, and lack of a helmet.
Two climbers attempting the North Ridge of Grand Teton became disoriented in poor weather, rappelled off route, and one suffered severe hypothermia requiring rescue.

While descending Mix Up Peak, climbers rappelled off a questionable anchor that failed, resulting in serious injuries to both climbers. The anchor was not adequately tested, and the climbers were tired and in the dark.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Mount Shuksan
description: A climber rappelling Mount Shuksan's summit pyramid fell 180 feet after a rappel anchor failed, sustaining minor injuries due to a fragmented rock horn.

location_name: Index Town Wall, Upper Town Wall
description: A climber rappelling the Upper Town Wall of Index failed to notice that one end of the rope was 40 feet shorter than the other, resulting in a fall and minor injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A climber slid on snow in a couloir, failed to self-arrest due to a dislocated shoulder, and fell approximately 500 feet, sustaining injuries requiring hospitalization.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber slipped on snow while descending the Southwest Couloir route of the Middle Teton, falling approximately 200 feet and sustaining multiple injuries.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Muir Snowfield, Nisqually Glacier canyon
description: A climber separated from his party to ski down Mt. Rainier, encountered a steep icy slope, fell over a cliff into Nisqually Glacier canyon, and died from a fractured skull.

location_name: Mount Washington, Huntington Ravine, Central Buttress
description: Two inexperienced students climbed 200 feet up Central Buttress in Huntington Ravine and became stranded, requiring rescue by MRS.
Martin Bordson lost control during a head first 70 foot rappel without a belay and hit the ground, breaking both wrists.
A climber fell about 70 feet after a climbing sling apparently broke while being lowered by his partner, resulting in several fractures and lacerations.
A group of climbers on El Pico de Orizaba were caught in an avalanche, resulting in four fatalities and two injuries.
Two climbing parties were hit by an avalanche while ice climbing; one climber died of suffocation and another sustained a cervical spine fracture and concussion.

location_name: Flattop Mountain, gully on Flattop Mountain
description: Four climbers were struck by an avalanche on Flattop Mountain; two were buried and died, one popped out, and one escaped. The survivors descended without attempting rescue.
Three climbers were ascending Mount Foraker when an avalanche struck, resulting in two fatalities and one injury; the injured climber descended and reported the incident.
A climber fell into a cornice on Mount Temple after summiting in blizzard conditions and going off route, resulting in a fatal fall.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Mount Dennis, Guinness Gully
description: A climber snagged a crampon and fell 150 meters down a steep slope, sustaining broken ribs and ankles; ice axes were not readily available for self-arrest.

A three-member Korean team attempting the Cassin Ridge on Mount McKinley lost their tent containing food, fuel, and equipment due to strong winds, leading to exposure, frostbite, and fatigue, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A solo climber fell into a crevasse on Mount Athabasca after a snow bridge collapsed. He was found wedged upside down and died of hypothermia.
Dave Fulton fell into a crevasse while descending unroped on Mount McKinley, sustaining injuries to his right knee and shoulder.

location_name: Yukon Territory, St. Elias Mountains, Unnamed 3600 meter mountain east of McArthur Peak
description: Two climbers fell into a crevasse after a bridge collapsed; one sustained fractures to their leg and the other sustained a head injury. They were rescued by guides and other climbers and evacuated by helicopter.
Two climbers fell 500 feet on Dana Glacier after the second climber lost footing and pulled the leader down; the leader had placed no protection and one climber sustained serious injuries.
A climber fell approximately 100 feet when his ascenders detached from the rope while cleaning an aid pitch on El Capitan, resulting in serious rope burns to his hands.
Margaret Cashman fell ten feet while leading the sixth pitch of Nutcracker, impacting her heels and sustaining possible fractures. She was lowered to the ground and transported to LMH.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Cathedral Spires, Higher Cathedral Rock
description: A climber fell while traversing on the Braille Book route due to fatigue, loss of concentration, and mental mistakes, resulting in a comminuted fracture of the lower leg.
A climber fell 15 feet after a granite flake broke off while checking out climbs on Rockfellow Dome. The climber sustained broken pelvis and arms and required helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 20 meters after a piton pulled while leading the third pitch of Corkscrew on Mount Yamnuska, sustaining head and neck injuries.

A climber fell approximately 30 feet on the seventh pitch of the Regular Northwest Face of Half Dome after a hold detached, sustaining injuries to his head, hip, and foot due to inadequate protection.
A climber fell while traversing a ledge on Mount Yamnuska after pitons pulled out, resulting in serious injuries and a complex rescue.
A climber fell while attempting Serenity Crack, sustaining a closed fracture of the tibula and fibula, due to inadequate protection and an inexperienced belayer.
Michael Poulin fell about eight feet while bouldering in the Swan Slab area, sustaining a severely angulated right ankle fracture.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Monument, Joshua Tree National Monument
description: Laurie Lauer fell 15-20 feet near the top of White Lightning due to inadequate protection, resulting in a fractured lower right leg.
Michael Gardiner fell 30 feet while leading the Hobbit Roof after his top piece of protection pulled out, resulting in a broken nose and sore jaw.
Bruce Burns fell 60 feet while leading the second pitch of "The Nose" on El Capitan after failing to place protection and slipping, resulting in injuries and a rescue.
A climber fell when two pieces of protection failed, resulting in minor injuries to the climber and the belayer.
A climber fell when a rock knob broke off, pulling out protection; he and his belayer sustained injuries and were treated and released.
Three climbers from Korea fell several thousand feet while descending the Orient Express route on Mount McKinley, resulting in their deaths.

A team of four climbers fell approximately 3,000 feet in the Messner Couloir after the rear climber fell and dragged the others down, with the rope eventually being severed. All four climbers perished.

location_name: Mount McKinley, headwall from the 16,200 foot camp
description: Two climbers, Timothy Hagan and Paul Kogelmann, fell 500-600 feet on the headwall of Mount McKinley after Kogelmann slipped and Hagan was unable to hold the fall; Hagan suffered a broken arm and facial lacerations.
A skier fell on the Raven Glacier in the Chugach Mountains, Alaska, resulting in a serious knee injury due to exceeding abilities and inadequate equipment.
A climber rappelling as part of a camp activity fell to the ground due to inadequate belay and lack of helmet, resulting in injuries.
A climber dislodged a flake which struck his partner on the forehead, causing unconsciousness and a head wound. The injured climber was wearing a helmet, which mitigated the injury.
A climber was struck by a falling snow block, fell about five meters, and fractured his fibula while climbing Mount Temple. His partner left him to get help, and he was later rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Mount McKinley, McGonagall Pass, Muldrow Glacier, Denali Pass, West Buttress, Karstens Ridge, Harper Glacier
description: Three climbers attempting a traverse of Mount McKinley experienced severe weather, HAPE, and frostbite, leading to a helicopter rescue after one climber went for help.
A climber lost control while voluntarily glissading unroped on steep slabs covered with loose rocks on Mount Fisher and tumbled 100 meters, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber fell when a Friend pulled out, landing on and injuring the belayer who was using an inadequate belay technique, after they got off route on The Nose of El Capitan.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Tangle Ridge, Centre Stage Falls
description: A climber died after a single-point rappel anchor failed while rappelling on an ice climb.
Patrick L. fell 18 meters while being lowered after the knot in the anchor sling came untied, resulting in fractures of the right wrist, upper arm, collarbone, and shoulder.

location_name: British Columbia, Coast Mountains, Stawamus Chief
description: A climber fell 300 meters and died after her rope parted while jumarring on Stawamus Chief.
A climber slipped on ice while traversing a glacier, fell into a crevasse, and fractured both legs and a wrist; his partner was able to rescue him and call for help.
A climber slipped on an ice slope while leading a climb on Mount Colossal, sustaining bruises, abrasions, and lacerations after sliding 50 meters and hitting rocks.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Three Sisters, Big Sister
description: A climber slipped on snow and fell about six meters, sustaining a broken leg and ankle while hurrying upward on the southwest slopes of Big Sister.
A climber fell into a crevasse after a snow bridge collapsed, pulling his rope team. He was buried and died. The other two climbers were injured and later rescued.
A snowbridge collapsed over a crevasse while members of an expedition were preparing a campsite, resulting in one person being buried and suffering hypothermia and other injuries.
James Dziadulewicz fell while climbing on Swan Slab after rappelling down and attempting to climb back up his rope without proper protection, resulting in a fractured tibia and abrasions.

Four Italian climbers on Mount Logan requested helicopter assistance after losing snow protection and damaging equipment, making further ascent or descent unsafe; they were successfully slung to safety.
A climber was left alone at 17,000 feet on Mount McKinley without a stove due to fatigue and a decision to retrieve a cached stove. A rescue team brought her down safely before a severe storm hit.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Stately Pleasure Dome
description: Two climbers became stranded during a rain storm one pitch from the top of South Crack due to inadequate clothing and lack of awareness of changing weather conditions.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Stately Pleasure Dome
description: Two climbers became stranded on Stately Pleasure Dome due to a rain and hail storm, with one climber treated for mild to moderate hypothermia.
Two climbers stalled on the east ridge of Mount Temple due to route-finding problems, bad weather, and loose rock, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A climber died after triggering a small avalanche while attempting a glissade down a steep snow chute on Lookout Peak, resulting in a fall over exposed rocks.
A student dislocated his knee while laybacking on Toe Crack and fell, requiring a counter-balanced rappel and rescue.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier, Liberty Ridge
description: Two climbers attempted to ascend Mount Rainier via Liberty Ridge, encountered a storm, and suffered from hypothermia and frostbite; one climber left the other to get help, leading to a search and rescue operation.

location_name: Cathedral Ledge, Cathedral Ledge, north end, above “They Died Laughing”
description: A climber fell to his death while rappelling to access an ice climb, possibly due to rappelling off the end of the rope or untying the knot before being secured.
A climber fell into a fumarole bowl after jumping the bergschrund on Mount Hood's Hogsback route and was later hoisted to a hospital with a broken ankle and lacerations.
A climber fell after their ice tool pulled out due to poor placement and brittle ice, resulting in a broken ankle and dislocated foot.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A guide fell on ice while climbing the Exum Ridge on the Grand Teton, sustaining serious injuries.

location_name: City of Rocks, City of Rocks
description: Tim Mooney fell while attempting to "Pink Point" a route, caught his foot on an edge, and fractured his ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mount Meeker
description: A solo climber fell approximately 1000 feet while attempting a 5.7 rock face on Mount Meeker without a rope.
A 19-year-old climber fell approximately 45 feet while solo climbing unroped on "The Book" (5.9) at Cliff Drive in Kansas City, Missouri, sustaining two severely broken ankles.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Little Matterhorn
description: Jon M. Hofstra fell about 1000 feet while descending unroped from the summit of the Little Matterhorn and died.

location_name: Mount Hood, Hogsback above Crater Rock, west of White River glacier
description: Two inexperienced hikers attempted to summit Mount Hood without proper equipment; one slipped and sprained his ankle during the descent, requiring a search and rescue.
A climber fell 40-45 feet to the ground after his partner took him off belay due to miscommunication, resulting in a fractured heel.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Lathe Strang fractured his left ankle after slipping on icy rock while leading the first pitch of Prevertical Sanctuary on Longs Peak, falling 20 feet.

A climber fell approximately 120 feet while traversing on the Northeast Buttress route of Chair Peak due to inadequate protection and being out of practice, resulting in broken ribs and other injuries.
Two experienced climbers fell to their death after the lead climber's single cam anchor failed while the second climber was traversing a ledge, resulting in a 125-foot fall into the moat below.
A climber with 20 years of experience fell after jumping off the rock face and his protection failed, resulting in a fractured leg.
A climber fell approximately 70 feet to the ground after protection pulled out, sustaining severe head injuries, a broken leg, and a smashed kneecap.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Andy Griffiths slipped and slid 300 feet on Lamb's Slide, sustaining injuries to his left elbow, hip, and ankle.

A nine person party was descending Mount Shuksan when a climber lost footing in soft snow and fell into a crevasse, pulling two others with her. Two climbers were rescued from the crevasse with hypothermia.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber fell approximately 800 feet down a steep snow slope with avalanche debris and over cliff bands, sustaining a fractured heel and talus, likely due to inexperience and soft snow.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: A climber fell on snow while ascending the east face of Teewinot, slid and somersaulted into talus, sustaining injuries but was rescued and released from the hospital.
A climber fell approximately 50 feet on wet rock while climbing "Wedge" at Whitehorse Ledge, sustaining a fractured skull and compressed vertebrae; he was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell approximately 15 feet while descending after missing their ascent route, resulting in a broken ankle, compressed vertebra, and abdominal bruising.
A climber was struck by a rock dislodged from above while descending Fisher Chimneys, resulting in a fall and minor injuries.
A climber belaying on Mount Dana was struck by a football-sized rock, resulting in fractures to his right patella, femur, and tibia.
A climber was rock scrambling when a large rock broke loose, causing him to fall 20-30 feet and sustain fatal injuries.
A climber was struck and killed by a falling rock dislodged by another member of their group in the Beartooth Mountains.
A lead climber fell when a foothold disintegrated, pulling out a camming device. He swung into the rock face, sustaining injuries, and was rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Death Canyon
description: A climber fell 40 feet after a handhold broke off while leading the second pitch of the Snaz, resulting in a serious pelvic injury.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Flaming Rock
description: A climber fell 60 feet after a rappel anchor consisting of slings around a rock pinch failed due to a shifting boulder, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber fell approximately 35 feet to the ground after the belayer ran out of rope while lowering him, resulting in a fractured pelvis.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: Glenn R. McDonald was killed by lightning near the summit of Hallett Peak after climbing Hallett Chimney II with a less experienced partner after a late start despite warnings.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A climber fell while attempting to glissade down a snow patch on Disappointment Peak and was unable to self-arrest because his ice axe was strapped to his pack, resulting in a fractured fibula.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Owen Couloir
description: A climber lost control during a voluntary glissade in the Owen Couloir, failed to self-arrest, and fell approximately 800 feet, sustaining serious injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Guides' Wall
description: Roland Fleck fell 40-50 feet after a piton pulled out while leading the Flake Pitch on Guides' Wall, sustaining multiple injuries.
A climber leading the 26th pitch of The Nose on El Capitan fell 20 feet when a TCU and stopper pulled out, resulting in a compression fracture and hand injuries.
A climber fell 25 feet after a Tri-Cam pulled out while attempting to aid climb, resulting in a severe open subtalar dislocation and probable small fractures.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A solo climber became stranded on the north ridge of the Grand Teton due to snow and route finding difficulties and was rescued uninjured.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: Two climbers became stranded when their rope got stuck on the second pitch of Pear Buttress II, and were assisted by others to complete the route.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Two climbers became lost on the Exum Ridge route, traversed into the West Face, rappelled into nowhere, and signaled for help; they were uninjured but one was unsteady on his feet during the evacuation.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Twin Owls
description: Climbers on Twin Owls were caught in a thunderstorm and unable to communicate, leading to one climber untying and the other descending for help; a rescue was performed.
Two ice climbers rappelled from Cathedral Ledge as darkness approached, but their ropes became frozen and stuck, requiring rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Plain of Six Glaciers
description: Two climbers were hit by a large avalanche while descending from an attempt to reach Abbot's Pass, resulting in a broken leg for one climber.
Two climbers were hit by a wet snow avalanche while climbing Mount Temple, resulting in serious injuries. One climber died, and the other was rescued two days later.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Kahiltna Glacier, West Rib, couloir above 11,000 foot camp
description: A climber was caught in a slush avalanche while ascending a couloir on the West Rib of Mount McKinley, resulting in face lacerations and a shoulder injury.
Three mountaineers were swept off the 'Slipstream' route on Mount Snow Dome by an avalanche and fell into crevasses, resulting in their deaths.

location_name: British Columbia, Selkirk Mountains, Bruins Pass
description: Two mountaineers were caught in an avalanche while skiing near Bruins Pass; one was buried and died, while the other survived and reported the accident.

location_name: Yukon Territory, Mount Logan, Early Bird Buttress
description: Three climbers were caught in a mixed avalanche triggered by rockfall while climbing the Early Bird Buttress on Mount Logan; one climber was buried in a crevasse and died.
Two climbers descending Mount Robson fell into a crevasse after one collapsed the lip; they were rescued by another climbing party and a helicopter.

location_name: Rocky Mountain, Bow Summit Area, Wet Dream Falls
description: A climber fell while leading the first pitch of an ice gully due to inadequate protection, resulting in a ground fall and compound fracture of one ankle and a fractured talus bone of the other.

location_name: Rocky Mountain, Sunwapta Pass Area, Panther Falls
description: A climber fell after a ledge collapsed while leading on ice, resulting in serious injuries including fractured ribs and collapsed lungs.

Two climbers fell 150 meters on Mount Athabasca after an unplanned bivouac left them dehydrated and hypothermic; one sustained a broken ankle and the other suffered internal injuries and broken bones.
An experienced ice climber fell 20 meters after the ice broke away under his crampons while climbing unroped at Mont Royal due to warm weather, sustaining a pelvis fracture and a dislocated hip.
A climber injured his ankle after slipping on loose terrain during descent in a rainstorm after his party separated; a helicopter evacuation was required.
A climber fell while soloing unroped on fourth-class rock on the north ridge of Mount Whyte and was evacuated by helicopter after being rescued by another party.
An experienced climber fell while soloing without protection at Canyon Creek Crags and died from his injuries.
Derek Hersey fell while free soloing the Steck-Salathe route on Sentinel Rock, possibly due to rain.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Monument, Echo Cove
description: Matthew Walker fell approximately 45 feet while free solo climbing "Palm-U-Granite", sustaining a compound dislocation/fracture to his left ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Lake Louise, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A climber fell 15 meters while leading a 5.9 route when a wire stopper pulled out, resulting in fractured ribs and a shoulder.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A climber fell while leading at Back of the Lake Crag when protection pulled, resulting in a compound fracture of the ankle.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Monument, Feudal Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 35 feet while leading Coyote in the Bushes after finding a missing fixed pin and having a long runout, resulting in a fatal head injury.
A climber fell ten meters on Mount King after protection pulled, sustaining a basal skull fracture and bruises despite wearing a helmet.
A 17-year-old novice climber fell 50 feet while climbing back up a rock face during a mountain-climbing class, sustaining minor injuries.
A climber fell while leading Nova Express after placing inadequate protection that pulled out, resulting in a broken back and shattered pelvis.
A climber fell while leading the Northeast Buttress route on Higher Cathedral Rock, likely pulling protection, and sustained fatal injuries despite his partner's attempts to provide aid.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Monument, Bridge of Sighs
description: A climber fell, pulling out protection, and hit the belayer, causing an open fracture of the belayer's leg.

location_name: Oak Creek Canyon, Oak Creek Canyon Overlook
description: A leader fell, pulling protection and the belayer off a ledge, resulting in serious injuries for both climbers.
A climber fell approximately eight meters while climbing alone and unroped in Grotto Canyon, sustaining a fractured left wrist and multiple bruises.
A climber fell approximately 275 meters down the east face of the north ridge of Mount Athabasca after unroping and separating from their partner, resulting in a fatality.
A climber soloing an easy route on Cosmology Crag to set up a top rope fell approximately 25 meters after a large block came loose, resulting in fatal injuries.
Charles Cearley fell approximately 3,000 feet to his death on Mount McKinley after losing his footing while descending the Orient Express Couloir without an ice axe in hand or proper anchor.
A climber fell on the West Buttress Route of Mount McKinley due to a slab avalanche, fatigue, dehydration, and poor weather conditions, resulting in bruised ribs and elbow.

location_name: Lake Tahoe, Trans-hut route west of Lake Tahoe just above Tamarack Lake
description: A skier fractured his left ankle during a fall while skiing with a full pack on the Trans-hut route west of Lake Tahoe due to poor visibility and changing snow conditions.
A climber was struck in the head by rocks dislodged by climbers above while ascending fixed ropes on The Nose route of El Capitan.
Three climbers suffered frostbite after summiting Mount Foraker in high winds and subzero temperatures; one climber fell during the descent, and the group eventually required helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Denali Pass
description: A climber suffered frostbite on Mount McKinley due to inadequate clothing and failure to descend, requiring evacuation after her climbing partners initially prioritized summiting.

Two climbers on Mount McKinley suffered from HAPE and one also from HACE, likely due to ascending too fast and dehydration; the guide's inexperience and delay in seeking medical help exacerbated the situation.
Two climbers on El Capitan's Nose route became wet, cold, and requested assistance due to heavy rain and inadequate gear; they were rescued and provided with dry clothes and shelter.
A climber fell when a copperhead pulled while traversing, resulting in a dislocated shoulder.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley's West Buttress, 14,200 foot level
description: A climber experienced pulmonary edema due to rapid ascent to 14,200 feet on Mount McKinley and was evacuated by helicopter.
A climber rappelling without a backup or end knot went off the end of the rope and fell, sustaining serious injuries and dying a week later.
A climber fell to her death while rappelling due to lack of a safety device, inexperience, and difficulty penduluming to the last rappel station in cloudy and rainy weather.
Two climbers were hit by a rockfall while preparing to climb Cascade Falls, resulting in one fatality.
Two climbers got their rope stuck while rappelling on Royal Arches after the knot on the end of the rope got away from them, requiring assistance to get off the route.
A climber fell when a slingshot belay anchor failed while being lowered, resulting in injuries to the climber and a rockfall that fatally injured another person below.
Two climbers slipped on ice on the Scott Icefield; one sustained lacerations, contusions, and broken teeth, while the other injured his shoulder.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Ski Hill
description: Climber slipped on snow-covered steps while wearing down booties, resulting in an ankle injury.
A climber slipped on snow while descending unroped on Mount Deltaform and fell 150 meters to his death.

A climbing party of three was caught in deteriorating weather on Mount Andromeda, leading them to leave one member in a shelter while the other two sought help; the stranded climber was later rescued.

Two climbers started up Old Stoneham bluff. One climber, Stephan G., became stranded and signaled for help after the other climber, Benoit L., continued to the top alone. Stephan was rescued by a team.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A party of three climbers on Longs Peak triggered a false rescue due to their slow pace, yelling, and the reporting party's failure to update the park service after the climbers self-rescued.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: Three climbers were caught in a soft snow avalanche on Mount Moran's Skillet Glacier route, resulting in injuries including a fractured ulna and radius, lacerated arm, and severe muscle tear.
Two climbers on El Capitan called for help due to lack of water and were rescued after minimal rehydration; they spent the night on top and were flown out the next day.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Muir Snow field, Moon Rocks
description: Three climbers suffered from frostbite, hypothermia, and exposure at the 9,500 foot level of the Muir Snow field due to severe weather conditions and inadequate preparation.
A climber fell into a crevasse after the party decided to unrope while descending Mount Olympus, resulting in a fatal impact.

location_name: Three Sisters Wilderness, North Sister, Thayer Glacier
description: Erinn Broszman fell 400 feet on Thayer Glacier and died; John Stroud also fell and sustained minor injuries. They were hiking without crampons and Broszman was unable to self-arrest.

location_name: City of Rocks, City of Rocks
description: A climber fell while being lowered after the belayer ran out of rope; the climber sustained serious head injuries.
A man in his mid-20s fell 25 feet while free soloing a route.
A 21-year-old with no climbing experience fell while attempting to climb Wiesner's Slab unroped, resulting in compound fractures, internal bleeding, a bruised kidney, and a fractured pelvis.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: Climber fell 20 feet on loose rock while descending Mount Moran's south face after spending two unplanned nights on the mountain due to bad weather and lack of overnight gear.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Red Wall
description: Dan Plaisted fell from a 50-foot cliff while preparing ropes for a climb at Crowders Mountain State Park, sustaining multiple broken bones and requiring airlift to a hospital.
Ted Rogers fell 30 feet while rock climbing when his placed pitons pulled out.
A climber fell 25 feet while leading the Green Dragon route after tripping on his rope, resulting in head trauma and requiring short haul evacuation.
An instructor fell about five feet while bouldering on wet rocks, hitting his head on a boulder and requiring stitches.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber fell while descending the Cables Route on Longs Peak after a successful ascent, was unable to self-arrest, and died from head trauma.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell approximately 1000 feet on snow and rock while descending the Owen-Spalding route on the Grand Teton and died from head injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Windy Gulch area
description: While lowering his partner on Jaws II, Pyatt was injured by falling ice due to warm temperatures and unstable conditions; he sustained a pneumothorax injury with one broken and two cracked ribs.
A climber was injured by falling rock dislodged by their climbing partner in Rocky Canyon, Idaho. The climber sustained broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a broken pelvis.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Needle
description: A climber was struck by a falling rock near the summit of Crestone Needle and fell down the slope, resulting in a fatality.

route_name: South Face to the West Ridge
description: A group of climbers ascending North Twin Sister were struck by falling rocks, resulting in multiple injuries including a broken toe, lacerations, bruises, and a broken forearm after one climber tumbled down a gully.
A climber was struck by a rock dislodged by his partner, resulting in serious leg injuries requiring helicopter rescue and eventual amputation below the knee.
A climber fell after a flake dislodged while weighting a rusted piton, resulting in fatal head injuries.
Three climbers descending Mount Hood in an intensifying storm became disoriented in whiteout conditions and called for rescue due to inadequate equipment and inability to navigate.
A climber fell 25-35 feet due to inadequate belay, resulting in minor injuries and a slight compression of a vertebra. The belayer allowed the rope to pass completely through the belay device.
A climber lost control while glissading on Mount Hood when his crampon caught on ice, resulting in a leg injury.
A climber glissading down the Hogsback on Mount Hood without an ice axe lost control and fell over a cliff, sustaining a leg/ankle injury and difficulty breathing.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell 100 feet after a rock broke loose and protection pulled while attempting a mixed rock and ice route on the north face of Grand Teton, resulting in contusions and a temporary loss of consciousness; the climber and partner self-rescued to base camp.

A climber's hair got caught in her rappel device, and her brother injured his ankle attempting to rescue her. Two other climbers attempted a rescue with improper techniques, and all seven people required evacuation.
An experienced hiker became stranded near the summit of Mount Jefferson during a snowstorm and was rescued by a search and rescue team.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Hallett Peak after their rappel rope jammed during a retreat due to bad weather and icy rock; they were rescued by Park Service personnel.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers attempting Kiener's Route on Longs Peak were caught in a severe winter storm, leading to one climber's death from hypothermia and the other's hospitalization with frostbite and hypothermia.
Bennett Austin developed acute mountain sickness while climbing on the West Rib route of Mount McKinley and was assisted down the mountain after rest and rehydration.
A climber fell when a nylon sling used in the anchor melted through due to rope friction during lowering, resulting in serious injuries.

route_name: Northeast Ridge, Silverhorn Route, Hourglass Route
description: Two climbers were swept by an avalanche while descending Mount Athabasca, resulting in one fatality and one serious injury.

location_name: Mount Hunter, North West Basin Variation to the West Ridge
description: Two climbers triggered an avalanche on Mount Hunter while attempting the North West Basin Variation, resulting in injuries and a rescue.

location_name: Palmer, Knik Valley, Deep couloir in the Knik Valley
description: A climber fell down a couloir after a cornice collapsed; she survived uninjured after being rescued by her partner and others.
A party of four, roped together without protection, fell on an ice slope, sliding about 100 meters. One climber suffered serious leg and elbow fractures, while the others sustained minor injuries.
Climbers on Angel's Fright were struck by falling rocks and a falling litter, resulting in injuries; inexperience and drug use may have been contributing factors.
A climber free-soloing Lazy Bum fell 20-25 feet while downclimbing, resulting in a fractured talus, Colles fracture, and a forehead laceration.
A 23-year-old man fell over 75 feet on Bell Rock while climbing alone and unroped, sustaining fatal head injuries.
A climber descending Mt. Collier slipped on a snow and ice slope, fell and slid over rocks, sustaining back injuries; he was belayed and evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Alberta Rocky Mountains, Grand Sentinel Pinnacle
description: A climber fell about ten meters after a handhold broke and a fixed Tricam pulled, resulting in a serious lower-leg fracture.
A climber fell a short distance on the 'Big Step' of the East Ridge, injuring his ankle after hitting a ledge; a heavy pack may have contributed.
Pam fell while seconding the third pitch of "Corkscrew" on Mt. Yamnuska, sustaining fractures to her tibia and fibula due to an awkward impact with the rock after a short fall.

B.T. fell while leading, scraping himself on the rock and spraining his wrist and thumb; the belayer was distracted, contributing to a longer fall, and hot weather contributed to loss of concentration.
A climber fell about 15 feet while downclimbing after finding inadequate protection, resulting in a broken fibula that required surgery.

location_name: Monashee Mountains, Gold Range, Gates Peak
description: A climber fell when a refrigerator-sized block broke off, pulling out protection. The belayer was injured when yanked by the fall. The leader sustained chest injuries and hypothermia.
A 68-year-old experienced mountaineer fell approximately 150 feet while climbing unroped on a fourth class section of Norman Clyde Peak, sustaining fatal injuries; she was not wearing her helmet.
A climber fell about 20 feet while downclimbing off route on the East Face of Mount Whitney, resulting in a knee injury and requiring rescue.
A climber fell nine meters while leading, striking a ledge and sustaining a head injury, then fell another three meters before being stopped by the rope.
Ian B. took a two-meter leader fall near the top of a pitch, suffering a compound fracture of the right ankle due to inadequate protection placement redirecting his fall towards the rock face.
A climber fell 14 meters after placing inadequate protection and pulling placements, including a tree, resulting in a severe head injury and coma.

location_name: British Columbia, Coast Mountains, Kitimat Range, near Europa Lake
description: A ski mountaineer fell on a steep snow slope, triggering an avalanche and falling over a cliff, resulting in a fatality.
Two climbers fell on descent from Mount McKinley after summiting, resulting in one fatality and one injury due to falls, exposure, and related conditions.
A couple slipped on steep snow on Mt. Victoria, resulting in one fatality from a fall into a crevasse and another from a fall during a subsequent descent after losing her axe.

location_name: North Cascades Range, Canadian Border Peak
description: A climber fell on snow and was unable to self-arrest, sliding over a cliff and into a gully, resulting in a fatality.
A climbing team of four fell approximately 1,700 feet on Mount Hunter due to unstable snow conditions and inadequate protection, resulting in two fatalities and two injuries.
Climber on El Capitan was hit by a falling water bottle, resulting in a ruptured spleen and near-fatal internal bleeding.
A climber was injured by a falling boulder after touching it on a ledge, causing him to fall. Another climber sustained minor injuries from the same rockfall.
A solo climber on Mount McKinley was found buried in snow with hypothermia and frostbite due to inadequate gear and severe weather; he was rescued by another climbing party and eventually evacuated.
John Merrigan experienced Grand Mal seizures at 7,800 feet on the Kahiltna Glacier while climbing Mount McKinley and was evacuated to a hospital.
Two members of an AMICAL expedition became hypothermic and dehydrated while descending Mount McKinley in poor weather conditions and were subsequently evacuated and treated.
Two Korean climbers died on Mount McKinley due to deteriorating weather, inadequate clothing, and hypothermia after reaching 16,200 feet on the West Buttress.
During a descent, a climber unclipped from the rappel ropes and fell, knocking another climber off his stance; both fell to their deaths.

location_name: British Columbia, Rocky Mountains, Mount Narao
route_name: north ice gully on the east face
description: A climber lost control while glissading on a steep snow slope, triggering a small wet avalanche and sliding over rock bands, resulting in serious injuries.
Two parties on the East Ridge of Mt. Temple became stranded due to routefinding difficulties, fatigue, and being off route, requiring helicopter rescue.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows—Daff Dome
description: A climber fell 60-80 feet after a marginal anchor consisting of a stopper and hex failed while he was preparing to set up a top-rope anchor. He sustained injuries to his back, side, pelvis, chest, and ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Lake Louise, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A sport climber fell 12 meters after a single-placement anchor pulled out while lowering, resulting in a severe compound leg fracture, spinal fracture, sprained ankle, and other injuries.
A climber sustained a fractured pelvis after the rope burned through a sling during a rappel at Heart Creek slabs.
A climber rappelling from Reeds Pinnacle fell 40 feet when the rope midpoint marking was off-center, causing one end of the rope to pull through the rappel device.
Two climbers on Mt. Lefroy were struck by rockfall and sustained minor injuries, requiring one to be evacuated by helicopter.
A climber slipped on snow while descending Mt. Lawson, sliding 90 meters and sustaining serious injuries, including a broken collarbone and dislocated shoulder.
A climber fractured his fibula after slipping on a stick during the descent from Mount Ishbel due to darkness, sleet, and fatigue, following a weather delay near the summit.
Climbers on Mount Yamnuska were caught in a storm and became hypothermic, requiring rescue after a rope jam complicated their descent.

location_name: Camelback Mountain, rock face on Camelback Mountain
description: A novice climber's hair got caught in her rappel device while rappelling on Camelback Mountain, requiring rescue. She also experienced circulation issues due to harness hang time.

location_name: Yosemite Valley National Park, Fairview Dome
description: Two climbers on Fairview Dome were stranded due to inadequate clothing, lack of headlamps, and underestimation of the route's length, requiring a rescue.
Two climbers became stranded on Mount Wiwaxy after their pack fell down a gully, leaving them without essential gear; they were rescued by helicopter.
Two climbers were stranded on El Capitan's Magic Mushroom route due to stormy weather and frozen ropes, running out of food before being resupplied by helicopter.
A 14-year-old learning to lead fell on a poorly protected route, became impaled on a carabiner, and was rescued by another climber and SAR team.
Two climbers got off route while rappelling on El Capitan and were unable to locate the next anchor, requiring assistance to get back on route.
A 17-year-old teaching rappelling to Boy Scouts unclipped from his safety line to adjust slack, lost his balance, and fell 70 feet to his death.
Two climbers fell approximately 1,000 feet on Leutholds Couloir after one stumbled and was unable to self-arrest, pulling the other climber down with him. Both sustained injuries and were evacuated.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Creek
description: Debbie Gruneberg fell 20 feet while bouldering alone near Hallett Creek, sustaining serious injuries including fractured nose, sinus, and vertebrae.
Stephen Williams fell 90 feet while climbing alone and unroped on Rattlesnake Mountain, fracturing his pelvis and suffering other injuries.
Shawn MacDonald, 17, fell 80 feet to his death while climbing solo and unroped at Crowders Mountain.
A climber fell 60-70 feet to his death when the knot connecting the rappel ropes came undone during a rappel on Seneca Rocks. The knot was assumed to be tied incorrectly and there was no backup knot.

location_name: New River Gorge NRA, Fern Point
description: A climber fell 90 feet due to incorrectly threading the rappel rope through a Figure Eight device, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
route_name: West Gully (also known as Two Gullys Route)
