description: A climber fell while downclimbing unroped, knocking three others off a ledge, resulting in one climber falling 60 feet and sustaining back injuries.

location_name: Mount Jefferson, east face of the summit ridge
description: A solo climber fell on Mount Jefferson and was swept down a gully by rockfall, presumed to have fallen into a crevasse and died.
A climber fell 65 feet due to an incorrectly set up belay and inadequate communication, resulting in injuries.

location_name: Cascades of Oregon, Three Fingered Jack
description: A climber fell after the anchor failed while leading "The Crawl". She sustained injuries but was rescued after a difficult descent.
Dante Taylor fell about 35 feet while downclimbing after being unable to find a handhold; his belay device (The Soloist) did not work because the rope diameter was too small.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber fell while off route on White Whale II in Rocky Mountain National Park, sustaining fatal head injuries due to not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell 25 feet on Geronimo (5.8) after failing to place adequate protection and the belayer was unable to stop the fall.
Bob Koppe slipped on wet rock while leading the third pitch of Melvin's Wheel III on the Bookend during a rainstorm, falling 30 feet and sustaining trauma to his pelvis.

location_name: New River Gorge NRA, Kaymoor Cliff
description: A climber fell over 20 feet on the route "Bloodraid" after a handhold broke, sustaining a fractured wrist and potential spine injury because they had not placed any protection.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Whittle Wall
description: A climber fell while leading, pulling protection, and the belayer failed to stop the fall due to improper use of a Figure Eight device, resulting in injuries to both climber and belayer.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, The Bastille
description: Two climbers fell when protection pulled out; one lost blood and the other broke his shoulder after hitting his belayer.
Leon Kaatz fell on a wet rock slab while trying to set up a handline and sustained a fractured elbow and cuts/scratches.
A climbing leader fell when a handhold broke off, resulting in a 60+ foot fall, but was rescued by another climbing group and sustained no serious injuries.
Timothy Samartino fell about 90 feet while rappelling due to ineffective braking action and lack of a belay, resulting in scalp lacerations and a concussion.
A roped party of four descending the Cooper Spur route on Mount Hood fell and slid about 1,000 feet into a crevasse after losing footing; two were buried and died, while the other two were injured.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Paintbrush Divide
description: Dan Turk fell approximately 300 feet down a steep snow couloir near Paintbrush Divide, sustaining serious injuries including an open leg fracture and lacerations.
A climber descending the Southwest ridge of Mount Jefferson slipped on a snowfield while attempting a shortcut, sliding 40 feet and sustaining injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon
description: A climber slipped and fell approximately 100 feet on steep snow near Spalding Falls, sustaining multiple injuries due to inadequate equipment (ski poles instead of an ice axe) and the inability to self-arrest.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: A climber fell approximately 2,000 feet on the east face of Mount Teewinot after slipping on snow and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber descending the Owen Spalding route on the Grand Teton slipped on snow, was unable to self-arrest, and fell approximately 300 feet over a cliff band, resulting in fatal head trauma.

Two climbers slid over 1,000 feet on ice after one lost footing, resulting in serious injuries. A third climber was injured in a separate fall during the rescue. Icy conditions and inability to self-arrest were contributing factors.
A climber was struck by falling ice while belaying, resulting in multiple fractures and a pneumothorax; he was able to self-evacuate.

location_name: Lake of the Ozarks, Truman Reservoir, bluffs that abut the Truman Reservoir
description: A climber dislodged a rock while setting up a top-rope, which then hit another climber in the face, causing cuts requiring stitches.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: A climber top-roping on the Red Garden Wall loosened a rock that hit him in the head, causing a minor injury.
A large section of rock fell off Cannon Cliff, striking a person on the talus slope and causing a fractured arm and head injuries.

Two students attempted a traverse of the Presidential Range in extreme cold and wind; one died of hypothermia after being left in a sleeping bag, while the other reached Mount Washington summit with severe frostbite and was rescued.
Two climbers died on Mount Washington after starting late, encountering severe weather, and failing to turn back, likely due to inexperience.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Pat and Jack Pinnacle
description: A climber fell about three meters when the rope slipped through the belay plate due to inadequate belay technique and overconfidence in rope length.
A climber lost control during a voluntary glissade on Mount Hood's south side, falling approximately 700 feet and sustaining injuries.
A climber teaching rappelling fell 20 feet when a carabiner unclipped from the anchor, resulting in a dislocated and compound fracture of the right ankle.
Nine climbers on El Capitan were stranded due to a storm, with some suffering from hypothermia and dehydration, leading to a rescue; one climber fell and hurt their face.
Alex Fraser fell to his death while climbing unroped on Old Man's Route after becoming stranded and attempting to climb higher. He fell twice, sustaining fatal injuries.
Two youths attempted to retrieve climbing gear from rappel stations using inadequate equipment; one became stranded on a ledge and required rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Three climbers on the Upper Exum Ridge requested route information due to inclement weather and approaching darkness, and were guided to safety.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap NRA, Mount Tammany
description: A climber became stranded while attempting to re-anchor a rappel rope, due to rope entanglement and loose rock, requiring rescue.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap NRA, Mount Minsi
description: Two climbers were rappelling when their rope got stuck. One climber went for help and the other was rescued by park rangers.

route_name: Cold Fusion, Point Beyond, Lucifer’s Ledge
description: Two climbers became stranded on Glacier Point Terrace after failing to find the descent route and spent a cold night on the wall before calling for help.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber fell approximately 150 feet while leading a roped pitch on ice with no intermediate protection, resulting in leg fractures and possible back injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A climber fell after protection pulled out while attempting a 5.10a variation on Irene's Arete, resulting in injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Glencoe Spire
route_name: East Ridge of the Grand Teton
description: A climber, Dankert, became stranded on the south face of Glencoe Spire after separating from his partner and attempting to solo the route despite limited experience; he was assisted off the spire uninjured.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell and sustained serious injuries after a rappel anchor failed while descending the Grand Teton; another climber became stranded while seeking help.
Tom Bohanon experienced an acute upper gastrointestinal bleed at 14,200 feet on Mount McKinley and was evacuated to an Anchorage Hospital.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A 55-year-old climber was evacuated from the 14,200-foot Ranger camp due to atrial fibrillation and flown to Talkeetna.

location_name: Glacier Bay National Park, Mount Orville
description: Three experienced climbers died in an avalanche on Mount Orville after apparently reaching the summit; they were found roped together at the base of the mountain partially buried in snow.
A group of four climbers were caught in an avalanche on the South Buttress of Mount McKinley, resulting in injuries after being swept over ice cliffs.

location_name: Yukon, St. Elias Mountains, Mount Logan, East Ridge
description: A party of four climbers were involved in an avalanche on the East Ridge of Mt. Logan, losing equipment and food. They were evacuated by helicopter after determining the route was too dangerous to descend.
Three climbers were stranded on Manure Pile Buttress after dark due to a late start, lack of water, inadequate clothing, and a rappel error, leading to a rescue.
A climber on Mount McKinley experienced dehydration and heat exhaustion, requiring treatment and helicopter evacuation.
A climber fell after a wired nut broke and a small Friend pulled out, resulting in ankle and wrist fractures.
A group of Taiwanese climbers training for Everest were caught in a storm on Denali's West Buttress due to poor weather judgment and inadequate equipment, resulting in one death and two injuries.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier, Howser Spires, North Howser Spire
description: A climber fell into a bergschrund after deciding to glissade down a snow slope with poor visibility, resulting in serious injuries and requiring helicopter rescue.

location_name: Mount Wrangell-St. Elias National Park, Mount Wrangell, Nabesna Glacier, Long Glacier
description: A skier dislocated his shoulder after falling into a crevasse on Nabesna Glacier while attempting a ski-traverse of Mount Wrangell.
Two climbers fell into a crevasse after a snow bridge collapsed; one climber sustained a pelvic cartilage tear and was evacuated.

location_name: Temple Crag, ice chute northwest of Temple Crag
description: Two climbers roped together fell on an ice chute after one lost footing, resulting in serious injuries; they were rescued after a difficult extraction.
Two climbers descending a glacier on Mt. Aberdeen fell and slid approximately 60 meters; one sustained serious leg, ankle, and chest injuries, while the other sustained minor knee injuries.
An inexperienced climber fell while rappelling at Eagle's Nest in Nova Scotia after losing control and grabbing the rope, resulting in severe burns and other injuries.
A climber fell on the Nutcracker route after placing a nut and climbing to a mantle, resulting in a broken ankle that required surgery.
A climber fell while descending North Dome Gulley after deciding to traverse a steep, smooth granite water course without a rope, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Rocky Mountains, Cougar Canyon, Catseye Cliff Left
description: Climber M. S. fell off a 5.11 route on Catseye Cliff Left above the second bolt, dropping about three meters onto a tree top and sustaining a three-centimeter flesh wound to the inner thigh.

location_name: Alberta, Rocky Mountains, Kid Goat Buttress, “Keelhaul Wall”
description: Laura fell 15 meters after a handhold broke, sustaining sprains, cuts, and abrasions; she was lowered and walked out with assistance.
Bruce Stover fell 45 feet while leading "A-Okay" after a piton pulled out, resulting in a broken femur and fractured pelvis.
A climber fell while "French-freeing" on the Salathe Wall, sustaining a skull fracture and requiring rescue.
A climber fell when a nut pulled out, resulting in serious foot and ankle injuries.
Two climbers fell after protection pulled and the belay anchor failed, resulting in one fatality and one injury; dehydration and fatigue were contributing factors.
J. A. fell approximately 300 meters on the east face of Mt. Indefatigable and died.

location_name: British Columbia, Rocky Mountains, Mount Assiniboine
description: A climber fell after a handhold came off while climbing unroped on loose rock, resulting in knee and ankle sprains.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Tonquin Valley, Surprise Point
description: A 76-year-old man fell approximately 120 meters while descending fourth-class terrain on Surprise Point, sustaining fatal injuries.
A climber fractured their leg after slipping on a slick slab while descending East Ledges on El Capitan after climbing Mescalito.
A Spanish climber fell 4,000 feet to his death on Mount McKinley while two others were rescued after suffering from exposure and possible AMS.
Two climbers, Angove and McKinley, were descending Denali Pass roped together when McKinley fell, pulling Angove with him. McKinley died, and Angove was injured.
A climber fell 2,000 feet on Mount Foraker due to high winds, resulting in a broken ankle, sprained ankle, and bruised ribs; he was rescued by helicopter.
An ice climber was struck by falling ice dislodged by the leader while belaying on the Weeping Wall, resulting in a severe concussion and hospitalization.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Lake Louise, Louise Falls
description: A leader fell on ice, pulling protection, resulting in a 20-meter fall that injured the belayer.
A climber fell after an ice tool pulled out while placing protection, resulting in a leg fracture.
Two inexperienced climbers were overdue after climbing the East Ridge of Mt. Edith Cavell in poor conditions and sustained frostbite.
A climber got disoriented in a whiteout on the Columbia Ice Field while attempting to descend the Athabasca Glacier, but was eventually located and picked up in good condition.
Kirk Bland fell 100 feet on Mescalito when a birdbeak placed on a deadhead failed, resulting in a head wound and concussion. He was not wearing a helmet and had not clipped all protection.
A climber was injured when a rappel sling came off a horn anchor, causing a 20-30 foot fall.
A climber died after failing to thread both ropes through his rappel device while rappelling in Cochise Stronghold.
A climber fell 20 meters to his death while rappelling after clipping into only one strand of the rope and declining a belay.
A climber died after a rappel anchor failed, possibly due to improper rigging, while attempting to free a jammed rope on Mount Rundle.
A climber died after falling while rappelling on El Capitan, likely due to inadequate anchor equipment and possibly disconnecting from the anchor to deal with a stuck haul line.

location_name: Lake Louise, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A climber fell 5 meters while being lowered after the rope unclipped from a non-locking carabiner at the anchor, resulting in a puncture wound and fractured tailbone.
A climber slipped on snow while descending Mt. Haddo, knocking down two others and sustaining a head injury due to not wearing a helmet.
Two climbers started late on Fairview Dome's Regular Route, got lost, were inadequately dressed, and required rescue after signaling for help.

Climbers on El Capitan's Zodiac route were caught in an unexpected storm, experienced significant wetting and chilling due to inadequate gear, and called for rescue due to concerns about their ability to continue.
Climbers' ropes jammed while rappelling after they hurried down the route due to a possible theft at the base; they were stranded and required rescue.
Four climbers on El Capitan's The Nose were caught in a storm, leading to hypothermia and a rescue due to inadequate shelter and sleeping bags.
Three climbers died at Windy Corner on Mount McKinley, possibly due to a combination of hypothermia and a snow bridge collapse during gale force winds.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier
description: A climber experienced altitude sickness and possible cerebral edema on Mount Rainier and was assisted in descending to Paradise.
Two climbers sitting on a cornice on Engineer Mountain fell off the north face after the cornice collapsed; one climber died and the other was critically injured.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: Two climbers became stranded on Red Garden Wall when darkness fell and their rappel rope jammed; they were rescued the next day.
A climber fell near the top of the Black Dike route when his tools pulled out of frozen moss and thin ice, resulting in a broken ankle.
An experienced climber fell near the top of an ice route due to inadequate protection, resulting in a severed spinal cord and paralysis.
Two climbers fell approximately 800 feet on Leuthold Couloir after the lead climber fell and the second climber was unable to hold the fall; both sustained injuries and required rescue.
Allison O’Grady fell from the top of Rocky Butte while setting up a rappel, sustaining head injuries.
Pam Chavis fell 75 feet while attempting her first free-solo climb at Chapel Ledges, resulting in a fractured leg and broken ankle.
A climber with no experience fell while free climbing a rock buttress and died en route to the hospital.
Larry Anglin fell while free climbing an 80 foot practice cliff without a belay and sustained critical head injuries.
A climbing student fell approximately eight feet after removing her harness and helmet, hitting her head while observing other students.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: A climber fell 35 feet on wet and muddy rock while climbing Hallett Chimney, sustaining neurological injuries.
A climber fell 30 feet from a bolted route due to improperly placed bolts and his inexperience, resulting in a fractured tibia and head laceration, later complicated by compartment syndrome.
A climber fell approximately 25 feet while leading Skyscraper, sustaining head, neck, and back injuries, due to inadequate protection and lack of active belay.
A climber fell 20 feet on Intimidation (5.10) after slipping on polished, moist rock while attempting to place protection, resulting in broken tibias and fibulas.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge, The Pear Buttress
description: A climber fell about 20 feet while climbing the runout start of The Pear Buttress, fracturing his lower left leg and requiring a litter evacuation.
Guy Riley fell approximately 15 feet while lead climbing after his protection pulled, resulting in hospitalization.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: A climber sustained an open radius fracture from a rockfall caused by climbers above them on Hallett Peak while climbing the Love route.

location_name: Carderock, Carderock Climbing Area, north end
description: A climber fell while bouldering at Carderock, Maryland, sustaining a probable broken fibula. He was assisted by another climber who was an EMT and then walked out.
A climber fell 16 feet while leading the eighth pitch of T-2, fracturing his foot.
A climber fell while leading Holderness School Crack when a Friend pulled out, resulting in multiple injuries including cracked ribs, a broken hand, and minor brain bleeds.
Bryce Perkins fell approximately 60 feet while leading a climbing route in Big Cottonwood Canyon after slipping and having his protection pull, resulting in injuries to his head, back, and ankle.

location_name: Wasatch Mountains, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Storm Mountain
description: Harmer Kirt fell 15 to 20 feet while rappelling at Storm Mountain due to an anchor knot failure, resulting in ankle and wrist injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: Robert Logan fell while leading the second to last pitch of the Culp-Bossier Route on Hallett Peak due to wet rock, sustaining a 20 foot lead fall and fracturing lumbar vertebrae.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Stripe Rock
description: A climber fell to her death after her father ran out of rope while lowering her from Stripe Rock in City of Rocks National Reserve.
Alan Cattabriga fell on a mixed route on Cannon Cliff when his front points slipped on snow-covered rock and his protection failed, resulting in a broken leg and shoulder.
A climber tripped after catching a crampon on clothing while descending Mount Stuart, sliding 300 feet and sustaining a broken rib and bruised pelvis.
A climber fell on a snow finger while traversing in rock shoes, resulting in a bruised heel and sprained knee.
Kevin Rogers fell into a spruce trap while descending Raymond Cataract, injuring his knee. He was rescued by Chris Joosen and Mikko Immonen, and transported to AMC camp via snowcat.
Carroll Robinson was struck on the head by a large rock while rappelling and died from major head trauma.
A climber was killed by a rock dislodged by another climber above. The victim was struck by a rock and died at the scene.
A climber was injured after being struck by a dislodged boulder, causing a 600-foot fall into Milk Creek couloir on Mount Jefferson.
A climber lost control while glissading on Mount Stuart, resulting in severe injuries and subsequent death.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Andrews Glacier
description: Charles Bailey slipped on Andrews Glacier while glissading, lost his ice ax, and slid into rocks, sustaining a serious head injury.
John Hughes slipped during a voluntary glissade on Guy Peak and fell 1,000 feet, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Cannon Cliff, Cannon Cliff, Slip O’ Fools
description: A climber fell 35-40 feet from the top of the first pitch after a miscommunication and not being anchored, possibly struck by rockfall, resulting in serious injuries; the belayer sustained rope burns.
Two overdue climbers, part of a larger group, became exhausted and dehydrated after separating from the main party during a traverse and were later found by a search and rescue team.

A solo climber was reported overdue after planning to climb Cathedral Ridge on Mount Hood. Searchers found his tent but no sign of him, and it is probable he fell and was injured in a crevasse or moat.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber fell approximately 70 feet after a rappel anchor failed when he removed one of the stoppers, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber was preparing to rappel from a rock anchor when the rock broke loose, rolled over him, and fell 150 feet, leaving him injured and his partner stranded.
John Elgin fell 60 feet after apparently clipping into only one strand of the rappel rope.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Hand Crack
description: A climber rappelled off the end of one-half of his rope because the rappel rope was not doubled equally, resulting in a 30-foot fall.
A climber with limited experience took his cousin on a climb that was too difficult, leading to the cousin becoming stranded and requiring rescue after the leader dropped the rope.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Long’s Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on the North Face of Longs Peak after getting off route and encountering ice; they were rescued by other climbers.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak, East Glacier Knob
description: Two climbers without technical equipment became stranded on ledges on the east face of East Glacier Knob and were rescued by the Rocky Mountain National Park SAR team.
A 64-year-old climber fell to his death on the east face of Teewinot while climbing alone and unroped. He was found at the 11,200-foot elevation.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Cascade Canyon
description: A climber fell a significant distance after separating from his partner while scrambling unroped in Cascade Canyon, sustaining serious injuries including a crushed lumbar vertebrae and concussion.
A climber fell while downclimbing a 5.8 crack after failing to lead it, resulting in a leg injury that prevented them from walking.
Kel Young fell while leading "The Prune" at Seneca Rocks and fractured his ankle after toeing a ledge during the fall.

Pamela Foyster fell while descending the east face of Teewinot, failed to self-arrest, and tumbled approximately 50 feet down the snowfield and another 50 feet down the rock, sustaining multiple bruises and a possible fractured right arm.
A climber fell on snow and was unable to self-arrest while descending unroped, resulting in a fatal accident; her partner was injured during a rescue attempt.
A climber broke his ankle descending Mount Rainier, and two rangers died in a fall while attempting to rescue him due to icy conditions, inexperience, and faulty equipment.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Amphitheater Lake
description: Harold Brown fell approximately 300 feet on snow while glissading near Amphitheater Lake, sustaining injuries including a fractured scapula, broken ribs, and a pneumothorax.
Robert Porter lost control while glissading on the Coleman Glacier, fell into a crevasse, and was later rescued and hospitalized.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Three climbers were overdue after attempting the North Face route on Grand Teton due to a late start, slow progress, and route-finding problems, but contacted park dispatch after descending.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
route_name: North Face route, East Ridge route, Jackson/Johnson Route
description: A climber scouting the North Face route of the Grand Teton changed plans to ascend the East Ridge, got his rope stuck while rappelling, spent the night out without bivy gear, and was reported overdue before being found uninjured.

A climber fell 45 feet into a crevasse with water at the bottom and developed hypothermia; he was unable to extricate himself due to weight difference and limited gear, requiring a rescue involving a short-haul helicopter operation.
A student on a NOLS expedition developed appendicitis at 7,200 feet on the Muldrow Glacier and required helicopter evacuation for surgery.
A party of four climbers triggered an avalanche on Pyramid Peak after ignoring warnings and evidence of instability, resulting in one fatality.
Marcus von Zitzewitz and Olaf Hecklinger were killed by an avalanche on the North-West Face of Mount Hunter while climbing between 9,500 and 10,500 feet.

route_name: Unclimbed route on the West Face
description: Two climbers were hit by avalanche debris while rappelling their route on the West Face of Mt. Hunter, resulting in two fatalities.
Robert Gray twisted his back at the 14,200 foot camp on the West Buttress of Mt. McKinley and was unable to walk for several days before descending without assistance.
Chris Harris fell 75 feet to his death while soloing Instant Trauma at night, unroped; personal problems may have contributed.
A climber fell after his crampon caught on his overboot, resulting in a broken fibula and helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Ruth Glacier, Ruth Glacier
description: Michelle Pertuis fell into a crevasse and was extracted without a pulley system, resulting in injuries. She was later evacuated by helicopter along with the rest of her team.
Jody Walker died from head and neck injuries after falling about 100 feet from Morro Rock while climbing unroped.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison, Cruise Gully
description: Steven Permick fell approximately 60 feet while free soloing the Leisure Route and died.
A climber fell approximately 50 feet while leading a 5.4 route, sustaining a skull fracture, broken clavicle, scapula, wrist, and cracked orbit; the helmet was not properly secured.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Wind Tower
description: A 16-year-old climber fell 15 feet onto a rock ledge because the belayer was not providing a belay, resulting in no protection.
Travis Hull fell to his death while teaching a rescue class, having lost his balance near the edge without being hooked into the safety system.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet near the top of the Valhalla route at Ragged Mountain after running it out, sustaining fatal head injuries.
A climber fell while leading Beverly's Tower after his only piece of protection pulled out, resulting in fatal head injuries and injuring another person below.

Joe Presuto fell while leading the jam crack on Sunnyside Bench after running out the last 30 feet of the climb and popping a finger hold above his last piece of protection, resulting in a fractured skull and other injuries.
Shanna Ryan took a 20 foot lead fall while climbing Backflip, sustaining a head injury. She was lowered to the ground and evacuated to Estes Park Medical Center.
A climber fell while traversing on Bastille Crack, pulled out their only piece of protection, and hit the ground.
A climber fell while leading on Kloof, pulling out their only piece of protection.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book
description: Jorge Arias fell 20 feet while leading the final pitch of Cheap Date, pulling out a piece of protection and fracturing his right femur.
A climber fell on Gorilla's Delight after protection pulled out, resulting in injuries including broken ribs and a head injury. The climber was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell while leading the third pitch of Zenyatta Mondatta on El Capitan; the rope was severed, and a carabiner broke, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber fell to his death after a rockfall while descending Devil's Crag #1; he was unroped while waiting for his turn to rappel.
Michael Munsch fell while leading the fourth pitch on Sykes Sickle after a loose rock gave way and a marginal piece of protection failed, resulting in fractures to both ankles and an elbow injury.
Jake McNelly fell while rappelling after failing to properly tie the rappel anchor sling, likely due to distraction, resulting in a fatal fall.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mount Alice
description: A climber fell on a snowfield due to icy conditions and inadequate equipment, resulting in a fractured pelvis.
A climber fell on a steep slope during descent in a whiteout after summiting Mount McKinley; the party was inexperienced and lacked adequate protection, choosing to descend unroped.
Nancy Bluhm fell 75 feet on a snow slope while climbing the South Buttress of Mount McKinley, pulling her belayer off their stance. She sustained a strained back and skin abrasions.
K. D. fell 1,000 feet down Hourglass Couloir after footing gave way due to lack of protection and soft snow, resulting in serious injuries and a Flight for Life evacuation.
A climber fell approximately 1,500 feet down a snow-filled couloir on Mount Sneffles after deciding against glissading, resulting in serious injuries including a broken wrist and facial trauma.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak, Lamb’s Slide
description: A climber lost control while glissading on Lamb’s Slide, fell approximately 1,000 feet, and sustained serious injuries after being unable to self-arrest and impaling himself with his ice ax.
A climber fell 60 feet on wet rock while leading Ruper in Eldorado Canyon State Park, sustaining serious injuries including a basilar skull fracture and concussion.
A climber was hit by falling rock, which also cut his rope, stranding him and his partner; he rappelled and slid to the glacier, then descended to camp before being evacuated.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: A climber recording the first pitch of Rewritten was struck by a rock dislodged by a party higher up, resulting in a fractured forearm.
A climber lost a crampon and fell while ascending above Denali Pass, sustaining a comminuted fracture of the distal fibula.
Ka Eui-Ryong suffered from high altitude cerebral edema (HACE) on Mount McKinley and was evacuated to a hospital.
Two climbers ran out of food and fuel at 16,400 feet on Mt. Foraker after a longer-than-expected approach and were rescued after requesting assistance via PLB.
A climber fell after a nut pulled while being lowered, resulting in a concussion, fractured wrist, and other injuries; she was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell during a rappel due to an inadequate knot and lack of backup knots on the anchor, resulting in lacerations, contusions, small fractures, and a sprained ankle.
A climber rappelling Needle Spoon in Tuolumne Meadows during a thunderstorm fell when the rope slipped through her hand because it was not knotted, resulting in minor injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet while rappelling after failing to securely tie off the rappel anchor sling.
A climber rappelling from a frozen waterfall fell 150 feet after failing to thread both strands of the rope through his rappel device.
Benjamin Rusev fell 75 feet while attempting to rappel in Oak Creek Canyon, Arizona; he was injured.
Two climbers were rescued from El Capitan after being exposed to a storm without a rain fly for their portaledge, leading to them becoming wet and cold.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book
description: Three climbers were benighted and stranded on The Book formation due to a late start, inability to find the route, inadequate clothing and equipment, and the onset of rain and darkness.
Jurgen Bruhm of the German expedition Saxonia 96, was separated from his partner at Denali Pass and presumed deceased after a ground and air search was suspended periodically because of weather.
A hiker died in an avalanche near the Lion Head Trail on Mount Washington after the group ignored warnings and entered a closed area prone to avalanches.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Monkey Face Spire
description: Terry Mitchell fell 500 feet to the ground and died while free-climbing without ropes on Monkey Face Spire.
A climber fell while attempting a difficult section of a climb, resulting in sprained ankles and a dropped ascender; neither climber was wearing a helmet.
A second climber fell while traversing on The Book of Solemnity, swinging into the wall and sustaining a compound dislocation and fracture of her left ankle due to inadequate protection.
Kurt Gierlich fell 60 feet to the ground from a route on Broughton Bluff, suffering multiple fractures and internal injuries.
Three climbers fell 816 feet after the leader's protection failed, pulling out a stopper and a Friend, resulting in a zipper fall.
A climber fell 30 feet after a water knot on a sling failed while setting up a top-rope, resulting in a broken ankle. The climber was rescued by other climbers.
A climber fell while attempting a roof on Shockley's Ceiling, resulting in a bruised ankle and lacerated knee; the rope sheath broke during the fall, and communication difficulties delayed rescue.

A climber fell while leading the last pitch of Olive Oil in Red Rocks, Nevada, after a miscommunication about rope length and inadequate protection. She was not wearing a helmet and sustained a fatal head injury.
A climber fell on the second pitch of Prune, pulling out protection and suffering a broken arm, fractured skull, and knee damage. The belayer stopped the fall close to the ground.
A climber fell approximately 70 feet after a hand hold came off while leading, sustaining injuries to his ankle and hand; he was not wearing a helmet and was off route.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Owen, Koven Couloir
description: A solo climber fell approximately 500 feet while descending the Koven Couloir after a crampon caught on his pants, resulting in multiple injuries.
A climber fell on snow and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a fatal fall over cliff bands during the descent of Mount Jackson.

location_name: Guye Peak, West Face, south section
description: Kristin Beerli was struck and injured by a large rock slab while being top belayed on Guye Peak's West Face.
A climber rappelling Mount Thompson's West Ridge fell 50-60 feet after the rappel anchor failed, resulting in minor injuries.
Two climbers rappelled off route, their rope jammed, and they were stranded overnight, requiring rescue.

location_name: Devil's Tower National Monument, Devil's Tower
route_name: Bailey Direct finish to the Durrance Route
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet after a rock dislodged while leading a variation of the Bailey Direct finish to the Durrance Route, resulting in fatal head injuries.

location_name: Grand Tetons, Middle Teton, Southwest Couloir, South Fork of Garnet Canyon
description: Carrissa Johnson slipped on snow while descending from the Southwest Couloir of the Middle Teton, rolled about 100 feet, and sustained cuts, bruises, and abrasions.
A climber fell into a bergschrund after a snow bridge collapsed while descending Gannett Peak, sustaining injuries and requiring assistance to return to camp.
Two novice climbers got separated from their group on the descent from Grand Teton, became lost in the dark, and were cliffed out, requiring a rescue.
A climber became ill with Acute Mountain Sickness on the Messner Couloir, requiring assistance to descend, but ultimately did not need a helicopter evacuation.
A climber died after an avalanche swept the campsite on Mount Robson, causing them to fall into a crevasse.
A climber was killed by a massive snow block dislodged by warm weather while climbing the North Buttress Moonflower route on Mount Hunter.
A climber fell 35-40 meters after both ascenders came off the rope while cleaning a pitch, resulting in a fractured ankle.
A climber fell when a homemade rivet hanger failed, resulting in a fractured rib. The climber was using a daisy chain which contributed to the high stopping force.

location_name: Saint Raymond de Portneuf, Delaney Falls
description: E.F. fell into a hole in the ice after unroping at the top of a waterfall climb and later died. E.L. was unable to rescue him and had to call for help.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park, Bugaboo Spire
description: A climber fell into a moat after a snow bridge collapsed, releasing a boulder that pushed her down. She sustained massive internal injuries and died.

location_name: Jasper National Park, North Boundary Trail
description: A hiker fell into a flooded creek while crossing a footbridge and was swept downstream, resulting in a fatality.

A climber fell approximately 25 meters to the canyon floor while removing anchors after top-roping a waterfall in Maligne Canyon, resulting in a fatality. Inexperience and climbing in the dark were contributing factors.
A climber fell when two ice screws failed while leading the second pitch of The Professor Falls, resulting in a knee injury.
A solo climber fell 20 meters while attempting to self-belay on Expert's Choice, pulling out screws and sustaining injuries to his hand, back, and neck.
A climber fell 20 meters while leading on ice, sustaining fractured and crushed vertebrae after his tools pulled while placing protection. The warm weather may have contributed to the accident.
A climber fell approximately 150 feet after dislodging a hold while climbing unroped on Mount Neptuak, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Alberta, Castle Mountain, Goat Plateau Approach
description: A climber fell several hundred meters after a handhold broke while off route on the Goat Plateau Approach of Castle Mountain, resulting in fatal head injuries.

Two climbers fell to their deaths on the Northeast Face of Chinaman's Peak, likely due to a leader fall pulling the belayer, with contributing factors including exceeding abilities, inadequate protection, and belay/anchor failure.
A climber fell while climbing a 5.9 variant, exceeding their abilities and placing marginal protection, resulting in a broken leg and foot. The belay and helmet saved the climber's life.
A climber fell 150 feet while attempting a pendulum swing on Thank-God Ledge after finding inadequate protection, resulting in a fractured ankle.
A climber fell 14 meters on Chinaman's Peak after deviating from the normal route, resulting in a compound fracture of the left ankle.

location_name: Québec, Mount Saint Hilaire, Dame Noire Route
description: M.L. fell while leading Dame Noire due to a slippery foot and inadequate protection, resulting in a fractured foot and ankle injury.
Justin W. fell ten meters while top-roping The Wasp, a 5.9 route, and suffered an open head wound because he was not wearing a helmet and was inexperienced.

A climber fell while leading Pee Pee Pillar, a 5.10a route, when a TCU pulled out. He landed on his head and shoulder, sustaining a skull fracture and other injuries, and was airlifted to the hospital.

location_name: Northwest Territories, Baffin Island, Mount Thor
description: A solo climber fell approximately 50 feet to his death after his rope parted near his self-belay device, likely due to heat damage from an ascender during a Factor Two fall on an overhanging aid climb.

location_name: Chugach State Park, Ptarmigan Peak, North Couloir
description: A group of novice mountaineers fell 2,000 feet down the North Couloir of Ptarmigan Peak after a climber slipped and was unable to self-arrest, leading to a chain reaction fall of multiple roped teams. Two climbers died and eleven were seriously injured.
A climber fell 200 meters to his death after losing his footing while descending a snow gully unroped on Mount Temple's Greenwood/Locke Route.

location_name: Mount Revelstoke National Park, Mount Macbeth
description: A climber unroped on the summit of Mount Macbeth, ignored advice to stay roped, stepped onto a cornice, and fell approximately 330 meters to his death.
A climber broke her ankle after jumping across a bergschrund with crampons on, catching a crampon on landing.
Jonathan Giesen fell on Karsten's Ridge after stumbling in snow, resulting in a pneumothorax and requiring helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park, Snowpatch Spire
description: A climber was struck on the forearm by a grapefruit-sized rock dislodged by the rope while pulling it down after completing a rappel on Snowpatch Spire.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park, Bugaboo—Snowpatch Col
description: A party of three was ascending to the Bugaboo-Snowpatch Col when a boulder slid down the slope, striking one climber and glancing off another, causing injuries. A third climber who ran for help also got injured.
A mountaineering expedition on Mount McKinley was caught in a storm, resulting in frostbite injuries to three climbers, one of whom required evacuation.
A guided group was forced to bivouac at 19,000 feet on Mount McKinley due to a storm, resulting in frostbite injuries to four clients and one fatality.

A climber on Mount McKinley developed High Altitude Cerebral Edema (HACE) due to inadequate communication about his acclimatization difficulties and was evacuated, requiring ten days to recover coordination and memory.
A climber suffered from HACE and exhaustion on Mount McKinley's West Buttress after his partners continued to the summit without him; he was rescued by helicopter after becoming ataxic.
A solo climber on El Capitan fell after protection pulled, sustained a head injury, and ran out of water, requiring rescue.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park, Snowpatch Spire
description: During descent, lightning struck the spire, shocking a climber who lost consciousness but was held by their rappel backup device; no serious injuries occurred.
A solo climber on Mount Athabasca became lost in a whiteout, was forced to bivouac in poor conditions, and suffered severe hypothermia, requiring rescue.
Two climbers got off route in poor visibility, a snow slab gave way, and they fell. One climber died and the other was injured.

Two ice climbers finished their climb of Murchison Falls in the dark due to slow progress and inadequate equipment, prompting a concerned third climber to call for a rescue, which was ultimately not needed.
Darko Dular fell approximately 50 feet on the Hardd route after two pieces of protection pulled out, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet while rappelling from a single screw anchor that failed, resulting in bruising injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Rocky Mountains, Mount Murchison, Murchison Falls
description: A climber fell to his death while rappelling after not using a prussik backup and rappelling on small diameter ropes, possibly wet or iced, on Murchison Falls.

location_name: Smith-Dorrien Valley, Ranger Creek, Mount Murray
description: During lowering, the climbing rope cut through the slings, causing M.D. to fall to the bottom and sustain extensive injuries.
A climber fell approximately 35-40 feet while rappelling after the rope ends were uneven, resulting in serious injuries including skull fracture, concussion, and multiple bone fractures.

location_name: Pelham, rocks behind the building where they work
description: Two climbers rappelling at night without headlamps encountered a tangled rope, leading to a near fall and requiring rescue.
A climber was hit in the head by a large rockfall while setting up to rappel after a successful ascent, resulting in a depressed basal skull fracture.

location_name: Alberta, Smith-Dorrien Valley, French Creek, Mount Burstall
description: L.S. slipped on ice while traversing a ledge after removing crampons, resulting in a 15-meter tumble and a 5-meter free-fall, causing injuries and a possible concussion.
G.G. dislocated his shoulder while leading the first pitch of the Perren Variation on Mount Louis and was unable to continue, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A climber forgot to untie a safety knot in the rappel rope, causing it to jam in the anchor, stranding him on the face of El Capitan until rescued.

location_name: Alberta, Clemenceau to Chaba River Trek
description: A group of eleven climbers became stranded on the West Chaba Glacier due to a deep gorge and flooding river, and were evacuated by helicopter after waiting for three days.
A climber/researcher on Mount Rainier experienced acute mountain sickness and was evacuated by helicopter due to his condition and increased avalanche danger.
An avalanche struck near Bridal Veil Falls, Utah, catching two roped ice climbers. One climber was killed and the other seriously injured.
Two hikers triggered an avalanche in King Ravine; one was partially buried but self-rescued, while the other got lost and reported the accident late, resulting in a rescue.
Shawn Hansen died after the anchors he was using to support his friend on an ice floe broke loose, causing him to fall about 80 feet and roll another 70 feet down the rocky slope.
Chris Kapaun fell into a crevasse while glissading unroped on the Inter Glacier, sustaining a compound fracture of the arm and possible head injuries.
Two climbers, Don McIntyre and Joel Koury, fell into a crevasse on the Emmons Glacier after climbing Liberty Ridge; McIntyre died from his injuries and Koury was injured.
A climber descending Mount Hood fell 300 feet after his crampons iced up and he was unable to self-arrest, resulting in lower back pain.
Jim Amidon fell 85 feet while ice climbing on Rigid Inseminator after pulling protection and a carabiner broke, resulting in multiple fractures and lacerations.
A climber fell over 40 feet on the Nisqually Glacier after his ice screws pulled out due to soft ice conditions, resulting in a back injury and fractured hip.
A climber fell while leading on ice due to tool and crampon placements failing, and the inattentive belayer was yanked upward, dislocating his shoulder. The leader fractured his ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Petit Grepon
description: Todd Marshall fell 70 feet after being blown off a ledge by a strong gust of wind, sustaining fatal injuries; his partner was stranded overnight.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A solo climber fell while ascending the Owen-Spaulding Route on Grand Teton and died; the cause of the fall is unknown but may have been due to wind or loss of balance.

location_name: Devil's Tower National Monument, Southwest Buttress
description: A climber fell about six feet on the Direct Southwest route, breaking his right ankle on a ledge after changing plans from the Durrance Route due to other climbers.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet while climbing unroped in hiking boots, resulting in a fractured vertebrate, abdominal injuries, and extensive abrasions.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, The Dihedrals
description: A climber fell approximately 60 feet after the equalized sling anchor failed while being lowered, resulting in numerous fractures.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Longs Peak due to extreme weather and route-finding difficulties, resulting in frostbite and minor head injuries after one climber fell and pulled anchors.
A climber fell 10-12 feet while leading on rock after miscommunication with the belayer and experiencing fatigue, resulting in a fractured metatarsal and ankle injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A guide took a 130-foot leader fall on the Owen-Spaulding Route in Grand Teton National Park, resulting in a fatality; inadequate belay and protection were contributing factors.
A father fell while leading the crux of Standard Route on Whitehorse Ledge, suffering ankle fractures, possibly due to inadequate protection or belay.
Linda Olson fell while leading the second pitch of Tumwater Buttress after a wired stopper pulled out and a large rock flake came loose, resulting in a broken arm and leg.
A climber fell 10-15 feet on the crux of the third pitch of Recompense, breaking his leg, and was lowered to the ground by his partner before being carried out by rescue services.
A climber fell 60-70 feet after a camming unit pulled a refrigerator-sized rock off the cliff, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber died while rappelling the Prodigal Son route in Zion National Park, likely due to rappelling off the end of a thin rope in the dark.
A climber lost his balance while being taught to rappel, pendulumed, and struck his head, resulting in a laceration and possible concussion; he was transported to the hospital for evaluation.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Madrone Coopwood slid 200 feet on Lambs Slide at Longs Peak, sustaining a right illiac fracture, slight rib fractures, and a pneumothorax of the right lung.
A climber glissading below Crater Rock on Mount Hood snagged their crampons on hard snow, resulting in a fractured tibia.
Two climbers fell 2000 feet to their deaths after the lead climber lost footing on a snow/ice couloir.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: A climber with limited experience fell on snow while climbing Mount Teewinot, unable to self-arrest, and sustained minor injuries after falling into a moat.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mount Meeker
description: Scot Eden fell while downclimbing a steep snowfield on Mount Meeker after turning around due to bad weather, resulting in a fractured tibia and soft tissue injuries.
Carlos Loria fell 700 feet on the Coe Glacier while descending Mount Hood after summitting, sustaining a fractured neck and other injuries.
Mark Fraas fell 1500 feet down the Cooper Spur after losing his footing on snow and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber fell on a snow slope and failed to self-arrest, resulting in a fatal fall and subsequent avalanche involvement.
A climber fell approximately 400 feet while descending the southeast couloir of South Maroon Peak due to inadequate equipment and exceeding abilities, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell approximately 500 feet down snow on the Grand Teton after losing control while glissading, resulting in serious injuries and requiring helicopter rescue.
A climbing party of three was hit by falling ice from the Kautz Ice Cliff, resulting in serious injuries to one climber who was evacuated to Harborview trauma center.
A climber fell approximately 125 feet after a large section of rock broke loose while he was downclimbing, resulting in fatal injuries. Another climber was injured by falling rocks.
A mountaineer fell approximately 1,000 feet on Capitol Peak after a handhold broke loose, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber leading the North Chimney dislodged a large rock which he was using for a handhold, resulting in severe crushing injuries to his foot.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber fell 60 feet after a handhold broke while leading on easy terrain, pulling one piece of protection and fracturing his pelvis.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: A climber fell to his death when his rappel anchor failed while descending the Southwest Ridge route of Symmetry Spire after experiencing a storm.

location_name: Red Rocks Canyon NCA, Willow Springs
description: A climber rappelling in Red Rocks Canyon realized his rope was too short and he was stranded. He was rescued after self-rescuing with a rope lowered by rescuers.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier, Disappointment Cleaver
description: Two climbers lost the route in a whiteout on Mount Rainier and requested a rescue due to inadequate gear; they were escorted back to camp by rangers.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Longs Peak after mistaking the North Couloir for Kiener's Route due to inexperience and inadequate equipment; one climber descended to call for help, and the other was assisted back to the base.
Two climbers were stranded on Liberty Cap due to bad weather, low on food and fuel, and were later rescued and treated for dehydration.
A climber fell on High Exposure (5.6) when protection pulled, hitting his back and head.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A 32-year-old male climber fell 40-50 feet on the Lower Exum Ridge of the Grand Teton after pulling three pieces of protection, sustaining superficial lacerations and contusions; his fall was stopped when the rope snagged on a rock horn.
Karen Turk fell approximately 30 feet while rappelling when the overhand knot tying the ropes together "unraveled", resulting in a back injury.
A climber lost control while voluntarily glissading down from Dinwoody Pass, sliding over 100 yards and striking rocks, resulting in a sprained ankle and head injury.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Edith Cavell
description: A climber glissading down a gully on Mount Edith Cavell triggered a small snow sluff, lost footing, and slid approximately 1000 feet, resulting in fatal injuries.
A party of three was climbing Guiness Gully when a wet avalanche came down, sweeping two climbers off the route, resulting in a forearm fracture and leg lacerations for one climber.
Two climbers were caught in a snow/rain storm on El Capitan; one climber suffered hypothermia due to inadequate portaledge and was rescued.
Two climbers got lost on Mount Andromeda due to poor visibility and unfamiliarity with the descent route, resulting in them being overdue and severely dehydrated.
A climber fell through a snow bridge over a hidden waterfall, sustaining minor injuries but requiring rescue due to hypothermia and stiffness.
Greg Kowalsky fell 70 feet when his knot came undone while preparing to be lowered, resulting in fatal injuries.
Two climbers fell 2,000 feet on Mount McKinley while descending roped together on ice, resulting in chest injuries and unconsciousness for the climbers; they were rescued and evacuated to a hospital.
Lois Johnson fell on hard ice while climbing Mount Shasta, resulting in a fractured ankle and a 2000-foot slide down the slope.
Two climbers fell on ice/snow on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley; one fall led to a rescue attempt during which the rescuer also fell.

location_name: British Columbia, Rocky Mountains, Mount Stanley
description: A climber lost control while rappelling and fractured his ankle after his foot got caught in a crack; he was rescued by his partners and later flown to the hospital.
A climber fell while traversing a loose ledge on Gooseberry route after completing the first two pitches, sustaining facial lacerations, a cracked eye orbit, and a bruised shoulder and hip.
J.H. took a 30-foot leader fall on the Calgary Route of Mount Yamnuska while placing gear, resulting in a possible broken hand, dislocated shoulder, and other injuries.

location_name: British Columbia, Selkirk Mountains, Grays Peak, west face
description: A climber fell 80 meters while traversing fourth class terrain on the west face of Grays Peak, sustaining serious injuries including a fractured neck, spine, and femur; he was rescued by helicopter and long-lined to safety.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber fell on the fourth pitch of Ruper (5.8) after missing a hold, impacting a ledge and spraining his foot; a hole in his shoe may have contributed.
A climber fell approximately 50 feet while down-climbing unroped and without a helmet, sustaining multiple lacerations and a spinal fracture.
A climber fell when a carabiner broke during a fall, resulting in a head injury.
A climber fell about 20 feet while attempting to clip a bolt on the 'Cantaloupe Death' route, resulting in a fractured coccyx and a fractured lumbar vertebra.
A climber was lowered off the end of the rope by his belayer at Heart Creek, resulting in a six-meter fall.
A climber fell after the rope ran through the belay device due to the rope being too short and not having a knot at the end, resulting in a sprained ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountains, Back of the Lake Crag
description: A climber fell 10 meters to the ground while being lowered after completing a route because the rope was too short, resulting in ankle and back injuries.
A climber fell 40 feet on the second pitch of Red Shirt Route on Mount Yamnuska when fixed protection failed, resulting in a hip injury after hitting a ledge.
A climber fell 15-20 feet when protection pulled out while leading on El Capitan, resulting in an open ankle fracture and requiring rescue.
A climber fell while leading Lingering Lie when a Camalot placement failed, resulting in a fractured calcaneous, fractured coccyx, and lacerated knee.
A climber fell 30 feet after a piton pulled out while being lowered, resulting in shoulder and ankle injuries. The party was evacuated by helicopter.
A climber fell while retreating on a route, pulling protection, and sustained head and neck injuries after hitting the ground. The climber was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell 12 feet while leading, sustaining a multiple fracture to his lower right leg after it caught on a rock; he was unable to self-rescue and required assistance.
Three climbers fell approximately 300 feet on the West Rib of Mount McKinley after one lost footing, resulting in injuries and a subsequent rescue operation complicated by weather and further falls.
A guide unclipped from the rope team to assist a fallen climber, slipped on a snow slope, dropped his ice ax, and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a fatal fall.
A 40-pound bag of rocks being hauled struck a climber after the haul rope was severed on an overhang.
M.D.L.C. was hit in the right hand by rockfall while climbing on Goat Mountain. His thumb was badly crushed and he was evacuated by helicopter.
A climber sustained a lower leg fracture after being hit by rockfall while climbing the center ice bulge on the North Face Ice routes of Mount Fay.
A climber dislodged a rock on the North Ridge of Mount Victoria, hitting his belayer and causing a lower arm fracture.
Climbers on Mount Louis got lost, found the climbing harder than expected, and one was hit by a rock. They bivouacked without gear and were rescued the next day.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A climber with limited experience fell while climbing "Dirt Deed", a piece of protection pulled out, and he sustained fatal injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Rincon Wall
description: A climber was struck by a falling rock dislodged by another party who failed to provide warning.
A climber fell 25-30 feet when a handhold crumbled, landing on a steep slope and sliding further. She sustained a green-stick fracture of the pelvis and was treated at the Yosemite Medical Clinic.
Two climbers on Avalanche Peak separated; an inexperienced climber down-climbed cliffs and became stranded, requiring rescue by the Warden Service.
Two inexperienced climbers became overdue on Mount Geraldine due to slow progress and were eventually evacuated by heli-sling.
A climber experienced chest pain due to a pre-existing heart condition while climbing to the 14,200 foot camp on Mount McKinley and was subsequently evacuated.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope in Eldorado Canyon after failing to check the rope ends or tie knots, resulting in a fall and serious injuries.
A climber being lowered fell when the rope passed through the belay device because the belayer did not have a knot in the end of the rope or tie it to their harness.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope, which was too short to reach the next rappel station, and was saved by trailing ropes that became tangled with a fixed rope.
Two ice climbers became stranded 60 meters above the ground on the Weeping Wall after misjudging the length of their rope during a rappel descent in the dark; they were rescued by park wardens.
Two climbers became disoriented in the darkness during rappels on the Royal Arches Route and were stranded overnight, later rescued without incident.

Two climbers were benighted while descending Royal Arches due to inexperience, inadequate clothing, and worsening weather, requiring a rescue effort, though they completed the descent the next morning.
Two inexperienced climbers got off route on Mount Edith, took leader falls, and were rescued after attracting attention. They bivouacked with rescuers and were flown out the next morning.
Two climbers became stranded on the Royal Arches descent route due to inexperience and going off route, requiring a rescue.
A climber got stranded on the second pitch of Bulge (5.7) due to fatigue, miscommunication, and high winds, requiring rescue; he was not injured.

location_name: Spring Mountain Ranch, Kyle Canyon, Angel Falls
description: An ice climber was killed by an avalanche while climbing Hosemonster in Kyle Canyon. The top of the upper section of the ice formation broke free, burying him under tons of ice.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Owen
description: A solo snowboarder was caught in an avalanche while climbing Mount Owen, resulting in a 2,000 foot fall and multiple injuries.
A climbing party was caught in a large slab avalanche on Mount Hood's West Crater Rim route, resulting in one fatality and three injuries.
An avalanche swept two rope teams off "The Nose" of the Disappointment Cleaver on Mount Rainier, resulting in one fatality and multiple injuries.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area, Mount Minsi
description: A climber dislodged a large rock, which knocked him off the mountain and severed the rope, resulting in a fatal fall.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Emmons Glacier, near 13,300 feet
description: A climbing team became separated during descent in severe weather; one climber fell into a crevasse and was rescued after a difficult night, suffering from hypothermia and exposure.
Richard Ladue fell 100 feet while solo ice climbing All Mixed Up on Thatchtop, sustaining a fatal head injury.
Bob fell 40 feet while ice climbing after failing to place adequate protection, resulting in broken tibia and fibula.

location_name: Mount Washington, Huntington Ravine, O'Dell's Gully
description: Two climbers fell while simul-climbing O'Dell's Gully due to inadequate protection and one climber losing balance; one sustained soft tissue injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell about ten feet on the Exum Ridge of the Grand Teton due to a strong gust of wind while leading the Friction Pitch in icy conditions, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and ankle injury.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: A climber fell while downclimbing to the second rappel on Symmetry Spire, sustaining a fractured clavicle and pelvic fractures.

location_name: Barton Creek, cliffs along Barton Creek
description: A climber fell after a Gri-Gri failed due to a loose rivet, resulting in injuries and a rope burn to the belayer.

location_name: Table Rock Mountain, vicinity of the Wasp
description: A hiker turned climber fell 30-40 feet after scrambling near the Wasp route, sustaining severe head injury and trauma.

location_name: Table Rock Mountain, Table Rock Mountain
description: A climber fell while leading the route Slipping Into Darkness, sustaining a spinal injury due to inadequate protection.
A climber fell while traversing on Helmet Buttress, striking his head on a tree, resulting in a skull fracture. He was evacuated by helicopter and underwent surgery.
A climber fell while working on a route, pulling his belayer off a ledge. The climber sustained fatal head injuries, and the belayer was injured.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: Stewart Ritchie fell 60 feet after miscommunication with his belayer led to him not being belayed on either rope when he leaned back to be lowered.

location_name: Red Rocks Canyon National Conservation Area, Lost Creek
description: A climber fell 30 feet without placing protection, struck his head, and died from the injuries.
A climber fell 100-120 feet when a rappel anchor (pitons) pulled out, resulting in multiple broken bones.
A climber fell 300 feet on loose rock while ascending the Class 4 West Ridge of Quandry Mountain and died the next morning.
A climber fell 20 feet when a cam hook blew, striking his head and losing consciousness; he was not wearing a helmet and the anchor was found to be behind a fractured block.
A climber fell 70 feet after a foot hold broke and protection pulled while attempting a new route on Grandjean Peak, sustaining serious injuries.

location_name: Red Rock National Conservation Area, Magic Bus
description: L.C. fell about 30 feet when a hand hold broke while leading Blonde Dwarf, resulting in spinal damage and paralysis.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Gumby Roof
description: A climber fell 30 feet after a hand-hold came off and protection failed, landing on his back; he sustained minor injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Baxter’s Pinnacle
description: A climber fell 120 feet while rappelling from Baxter's Pinnacle, sustaining numerous fractures and abrasions, likely due to loose rock and potentially rappelling off route.
A climber fell while downclimbing after deciding to back off a route due to approaching darkness, sustaining a compression fracture of his vertebrae.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A climber fell 120 feet in a snow couloir after slipping on harder snow due to afternoon shadows, sustaining serious injuries including fractures and trauma; he was not carrying an ice ax.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Long's Peak
description: Two climbers simul-climbing Lamb’s Slide on Long's Peak fell when the leader slipped on ice and was unable to self-arrest, dragging his partner; both sustained injuries.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Liberty Ridge
description: A climber fell 200 feet on Liberty Ridge, breaking his lower leg and requiring a rescue.
A climber was struck by falling ice and fell 30-40 feet, sustaining lacerations, a concussion, and skull fractures.
A climber dislodged a loose boulder, triggering a rockfall that injured him during the descent from Thunder Peak, a satellite of Mount Logan.
A climber was injured when a large flake detached from the cliff while climbing on Cannon Cliff.

location_name: Wind River Range, Easy Day Peak
description: Mark Gallagher pulled a large block off onto himself while climbing the North Face route on Easy Day Peak, sustaining injuries to both of his lower legs and requiring rescue.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Summit of Mount Rainier
description: A climber on Mount Rainier suffered from High Altitude Cerebral and Pulmonary Edema (HACE and HAPE) and became unconscious, requiring rescue and hospitalization.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, Amphitheater area
description: A climber fell approximately 60 feet while attempting to rappel after the knot securing the webbing to the anchor came undone, resulting in extensive trauma.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to darkness, miscalculation, and not tying a knot, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber rappelling using the "Australian Rappel" technique lost control and fell 30 feet, sustaining an open head wound and other facial lacerations.
A student slipped on a snow slope on Saska Peak, was unable to self-arrest, fell 450 feet, and died despite CPR and helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Red Rocks Canyon National Conservation Area, White Rock Springs, Angel Food Wall
description: Two climbers, inadequately prepared for the weather and darkness, became stranded on Tunnel Vision and required rescue due to cold temperatures and worsening conditions.
A climber became separated from his companions while searching for the descent route on Notchtop and became stranded, requiring rescue.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Juniper Canyon
description: A group of climbers got stranded on Black Dagger due to darkness, cold temperatures, and high winds, requiring a rescue involving multiple teams and an Air Force helicopter.
Two climbers simul-rappelling without a knot on the rope end fell off the end of the rope, sustaining fractures.

location_name: Wrangell St. Elias National Park and Preserve, University Range
description: A climber was caught in a slab avalanche while traversing ridges in the University Range and sustained fatal head injuries.

location_name: British Columbia, Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Robson, Kain Face
description: Two climbers were caught in multiple avalanches while descending Mount Robson's Kain Face after a storm, resulting in serious injuries and requiring rescue.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Columbia Icefield, Mount Andromeda
description: Two climbers fell 550 meters to their deaths after a cornice failed on the summit ridge of Mount Andromeda.
A climbing team on Mount McKinley experienced hypothermia, frostbite, and exhaustion after summiting, requiring rescue due to deteriorating weather and inadequate equipment.

location_name: Alberta, Jasper National Park, Columbia Icefield, Columbia Glacier icefall
description: Two climbers fell into crevasses on the Columbia Glacier icefall; one fell seven meters and injured their head, the other injured their ankle while attempting to arrest the fall.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse on Mount McKinley and was rescued by his partner and a ranger team; inexperience was a major contributing factor.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Columbia Icefield, Mount Athabasca, Northeast Ridge
description: A climber soloing on Mount Athabasca fell approximately 100 meters after encountering ice, sustaining serious injuries to his head and legs.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Aberdeen
description: A guide and client fell on Mount Aberdeen after the guide's crampon strap broke while short-roping on ice, resulting in injuries to both individuals.
A climber misjudged a pendulum swing on El Capitan, struck a corner, and broke both bones in his forearm.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hallett Peak
description: A climber fell 70-80 feet after deviating from the Culp Bossier Route on Hallett Peak and attempting to traverse without protection, resulting in injuries.
A climber leading the fourth pitch of Grillmair Chimney on Mount Laurie pulled out a microwave-sized rock and fell 5-7 meters, sustaining a broken wrist and elbow, contusions, cuts, and abrasions.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book
description: Dale Yang fell while leading J Crack after his belayer released the belay to brace for the fall, resulting in lower back injuries.
A climber fell after the rope ran out while being lowered, resulting in serious injuries. The belayer failed to recognize the rope was too short and did not tie a knot in the end.

A climber fell approximately 70 feet after a knot in a 5mm cord pulled through a bolt hanger while attempting a pendulum, resulting in multiple injuries including facial fractures and a broken forearm.
A climber fell while leading pitch 7 of The Nose on El Capitan after a cam pulled out, resulting in a 70-foot fall and injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Victoria
description: A climber fell after slipping on loose rock while descending, resulting in lacerations and potential back/rib injuries, requiring helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 15 meters after pulling protection while down-climbing, resulting in a skull fracture and broken facial bones.
A climber fell 25-30 feet after protection pulled out while attempting a move on the Salathe Wall, resulting in a fractured ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book
description: A climber fell while leading a traverse pitch after a foot slipped and protection pulled out, resulting in a fall onto a ledge and injuries.
A climber fell while leading a 5.10a route when his protection pulled, resulting in a lower back contusion.
Steve Garvey died after falling over 100 feet when his rope was cut by a falling rock while leading a climb. He sustained fatal injuries despite wearing a helmet.
A climber fell 20 meters while climbing the wrong route, sustaining hand, arm, and head injuries due to protection failure and inappropriate footwear.
A novice climber fell on ice while descending the Hotlum/Bolum Ridge on Mount Shasta and died.
Franco Toso fell approximately 65 feet while descending the West Rib of Mount McKinley due to losing his footing in a serac field; he sustained contusions and was rescued by helicopter.
A solo climber fell approximately 200 meters down a snow slope on Mount Stanley while descending the Kahl route and died from injuries sustained during the fall.
A three-person team fell approximately 500 feet on a steep icy section while descending from a summit attempt on Mount McKinley, resulting in injuries to two climbers.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Wilson, Oh Le Tabernac
description: The lead climber fell after a large piece of ice broke off while climbing the first pitch, resulting in multiple fractures, serious head trauma, and eventual death.
Malcolm Daly fell while leading on Thunder Mountain after being hit by ice or snow, resulting in injuries; an ice screw failed during the fall.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Wilson, Ice Nine
description: A climber sustained severe crushing injuries after being buried under falling ice while watching the leader on the first pitch of Ice Nine.
A climber was killed and another injured by a rockfall while climbing Apron Jam on Glacier Point Apron in Yosemite Valley.

location_name: Kings Canyon National Park, North Dome
description: A climber was hit in the head by a rock while preparing for a rappel, resulting in a flesh wound.
A solo climber on Mount McKinley experienced fatigue, dehydration, and frostbite, requiring assistance from other climbers and a ranger patrol before being evacuated.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed high altitude cerebral edema (HACE) during descent from the summit and required assistance from other climbers and NPS personnel for evacuation.
A climber developed sudden severe abdominal pain while climbing Mount Uto, requiring a heli-sling rescue.
Ken Goldstein became unconscious at the base of Misery Hill due to HACE and dehydration, was evacuated, and treated at a hospital.
A solo climber, Shigeo Tamoi, summited Mount McKinley's West Buttress with inadequate food and water, collapsed on the descent, and was rescued by another climber after others refused to help.
A solo climber with limited experience, Michael McCarthy, slipped and cartwheeled down the slope on Mount McKinley, sustaining minor bruises after ignoring warnings and advice to descend.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Columbia Icefield, Mount Snowdome
description: A climber summited Mount Snowdome via Slipstream in good weather, but descended in a blizzard, became lost, and suffered severe frostbite, requiring hospitalization and eventual amputation of finger tips.
A climber fell while attempting a pendulum on El Capitan after a copperhead failed and pulled out a nut, resulting in a swinging fall and injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Ha Ling Peak (Formerly Known as Chinaman's Peak)
description: A climber fell approximately 80 meters after protection pulled while being lowered, resulting in a fatality on the Northeast Ridge of Ha Ling Peak.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Twin Owls
description: Claudine Perrault fell 30 feet while attempting to rappel after a rope snag left slack in the system, resulting in a concussion and minor spinal injuries.
A climber rappelled off the end of an uneven rope, falling 20-25 feet and sustaining multiple fractures.

location_name: Alberta, Jasper National Park, Mount Edith Cavell
description: Two climbers ascending the North Face of Mount Edith Cavell were caught in a rockfall, resulting in one climber being knocked unconscious and falling. Both climbers bivouacked on the glacier and were later rescued by helicopter.
A climber scouting a cliff top at Buffalo Crag without being tethered fell 80 feet to the talus, sustaining fatal injuries.
Two climbers were stranded on Half Dome due to worsening snow conditions and ice, leading to hypothermia and frost nip, requiring rescue.
Three climbers were overdue on Mount Albert-Edward due to unexpected bad weather, but were later found safe after waiting it out and hiking out.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mounts Charlton and Unwin
description: Two inexperienced climbers became lost in a whiteout on Mount Unwin after poor weather and heavy snowfall, requiring a helicopter rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: A climber was swept 2,000 feet down the East Face of Mount Teewinot by an avalanche, sustaining serious injuries.

Two climbers stranded on Liberty Ridge due to dropped gear, deteriorating weather, dehydration, and exhaustion required rescue after an unplanned bivouac; they were assisted off the mountain by a rescue team.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber on the Diamond of Longs Peak became ill with low energy, nausea, and dehydration, requiring assistance to descend and treatment at a hospital for food poisoning.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Muir Snowfield Paradise Glacier
description: Two climbers descending Mount Rainier in severe weather fell into a crevasse; one was rescued after being trapped for hours, suffering from hypothermia, while the other self-extricated.
