A climber fell approximately 300 yards on a steep, hard-snow slope on Broken Top, sustaining serious head injuries.
A solo climber fell 1600 feet on the Gibraltar Ledge route on Mount Rainier, sustaining bone fractures and possible internal injuries, but was rescued by another climbing team and park rangers.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hidden Falls
description: A climber fell 60 feet while leading Hidden Falls Left due to poor tool placement on a weakened ice flake, inadequate protection, and an aggressive climbing style, resulting in a fractured scapula, collapsed lung, and minor head injuries.
Three rescuers fell on an icy slope while searching for missing climbers, sliding 600 feet and sustaining injuries.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope while descending from Boardwalk (5.8) on Shiprock, resulting in serious injuries.
A solo climber fell while attempting a climb on the Organ Needle, sustaining fatal injuries after a second fall while attempting to down-climb.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet after moving off route due to wet rock, sustaining lacerations and a concussion. He was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell after the belayer was pulled off their feet due to miscommunication and an unstable anchor, resulting in serious injuries for both climbers.
A climber fell 25-30 feet while leading a pitch, sustaining multiple injuries including fractured ribs and a compressed fracture of L1.
A lead climber fell when protection pulled, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and a tumble down a talus slope with the belayer.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: A climber fell 2,000-2,500 feet while skiing down the Skillet Glacier on Mount Moran after hitting ice or slush and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in a dislocated hip and abrasions.
Two experienced mountaineers fell more than 2,000 feet to their deaths on the Cooper Spur Route of Mount Hood due to unstable snow conditions and possible crampon issues.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Liberty Ridge
description: A climber fell to his death while telemarking down Liberty Ridge after losing control on an icy section and falling down the Willis Wall.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell while climbing The Nose on Looking Glass Rock, sustaining a fractured leg and head injury, possibly due to inadequate protection and deviating from the route.
A climber fell with a collapsing ice pillar after misjudging its stability due to recent warm and cold weather, resulting in broken ribs, shoulder injury, and a bruised leg.
A climber pulled a large rock loose, was crushed and dragged down a slope, sustaining serious injuries to his hands, leg, and head.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Little Twin Owls
description: A climber dislodged a 40-pound rock while ascending the Descent Route on Little Twin Owls, resulting in a fractured left femur and injuries to his knee and lower leg.

location_name: Uinta Mountains, Between Gunsight Pass and Kings Peak
description: A beginning climber dislodged rocks while climbing above the leader, resulting in a fractured ankle, abrasions, lacerations, and a sprained knee.

location_name: Grand Teton, Friction Pitch of the Exum Ridge
description: Two climbers were struck by lightning on the Exum Ridge and sustained numbness, tingling, and weakness; they were able to traverse off the mountain and were transported to a hospital for evaluation.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Sahale Peak
description: A climber on Sahale Peak grabbed a loose rock, was struck in the face, and fell 30-40 feet, resulting in a dislocated shoulder, black eye, broken teeth, and bruises.
Two experienced mountaineers disappeared while climbing to Camp Muir on Mount Rainier during severe weather, and were not found after an extensive search.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Muir Snowfield Paradise Glacier
description: A climber became separated from a large group due to illness and poor communication, got lost in a whiteout, and died from exposure on Mount Rainier.
Scott Ruit fell to his death while rappelling from Birdland after the webbing anchor he set up came loose because it was not properly tied.

location_name: Red River Gorge State Park, Courthouse Rock
description: A climber fell approximately 75 feet after a rock broke off underneath him while looking for an anchor placement for rappelling, resulting in a pneumothorax and fractured arms.
The leader fell on the second pitch of Hawk when an old piton pulled out, resulting in an ankle injury and requiring a litter rescue.

A climber experienced AMS and disorientation while climbing alone on Mount McKinley's West Buttress, requiring assistance. Another climber also suffered from AMS and possible HAPE and was assisted in descending.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Denali National Park, Denali Pass
description: A climber, Russell Worthington, experienced acute mountain sickness on Denali Pass after a rapid ascent and was assisted by other climbers and volunteer rangers; he recovered and descended on his own the next day.
A climber was caught in an avalanche on Mount Burgess, carried over a cliff, and suffered severe injuries including hypothermia and a leg amputation.

A party of three was climbing Mount Woolley when they triggered a slab avalanche, resulting in a 500-meter fall and serious injuries to all three climbers; the rope may have broken and/or protection pulled out.

location_name: Chugach State Park, Flat Top Mountain
description: A climber triggered a small avalanche in a steep gully on Flat Top Mountain, resulting in a long fall and serious injuries due to unstable snow conditions and lack of an ice ax.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Northwest Fork, Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse while descending from a climb on Mount McKinley, sustaining injuries but self-rescuing with his partner.
A climber fell to his death while solo ice climbing unroped on Drambuie Deamon; ice quality was likely poor.
C.W. fell 7-10 meters while climbing thin ice on The Sorcerer, resulting in a broken ankle and broken talus bone.

location_name: Quebec, Gatineau Park, Cabin Creek Falls
description: Climber fell when lowering after not properly buckling his harness and not clipping into the leg yokes, resulting in serious injuries.

A climber leading the crux pitch of Wicked Wanda fell when his ice tool popped, causing a large piece of ice to break off the ice mushroom used as protection. He sustained injuries to his ankle, elbow, and face.
An experienced mountaineer fell on a steep snow slope while descending Mount Athabasca after his crampons balled up with wet snow, resulting in a fatal accident.
A climber fell on the Regular Northwest Face of Half Dome after a sudden hailstorm coated the rock with ice, resulting in an open tib/fib fracture at the ankle.

location_name: Banff National Park, Back of the Lake
description: A climber fell after a carabiner failed, likely due to cross-loading, and was impaled by a branch upon landing.
A climber fell while leading, and the belayer was unprepared for the force, resulting in the belayer tumbling and dropping the rope, but ultimately managing to stop the fall with severe rope burns.
A climber fell approximately nine meters while leading, resulting in severe leg injuries after a pendulum swing into the rock face.
Two climbers fell 40 meters after the lead climber fell, pulling off the belayer and the tree they were anchored to; they were caught by trees, resulting in injuries.
A climber fell while counterbalance hauling a light load on El Capitan due to miscalculating the weight difference and possibly being impaired by alcohol, resulting in entanglement and nerve damage.

location_name: Banff National Park, Back of the Lake
description: A climber fell approximately 19 meters after a miscommunication with the belayer, who had removed the rope from the belay device. The belayer stopped the fall with bare hands and sustained severe rope burns.

location_name: Lake Louise, Wapta Ice Field, Peyto Glacier Approach
description: Three climbers started a ski traverse late, triggering two avalanches. One climber fell several hundred feet and was injured, and two others were injured in a second avalanche while attempting a rescue.
Christoph Haider fell while descending the West Buttress route on Mount McKinley after a long summit day, sustaining head and leg injuries.
Two climbers descended a snow couloir without proper equipment; one fell, pulling the other down. One climber died, and the other was seriously injured.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Mount Johnson, East Buttress of Mt. Johnson
description: Falling ice struck a climber, Jeff Benowitz, giving him moderate injuries while his partner, Chris Turiano, was leading a new route on the East Buttress of Mt. Johnson.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Louise Falls
description: A climber sustained crushing injuries to his left foot after being hit by falling ice dislodged by a party higher on the route. He was evacuated by snowmobile.
A climber leading the sixth pitch of Iron Hawk on El Capitan dislodged a large rock flake, resulting in a fall and injuries to both the leader and the belayer from falling rock debris.
A climber was struck and killed by a large rock falling from the ridge crest while ascending Mount Little.
While leading the third pitch, R.B. pulled off a large rock which hit S.C., resulting in fractured ribs, perforated lungs, and sprains; S.C. was evacuated by helicopter.
Two climbers fell 300 meters after one dislodged a rock that struck the other on Mount Lefroy; both sustained multiple injuries and were evacuated.
A climber was injured by a dislodged rock while descending the Steck-Salathe route on Sentinel Rock after dark; he was not wearing a helmet.
A climber dislodged a boulder which rolled down and injured a belayer, resulting in a partial toe amputation.
A climber fell 60-80 meters after a handhold came off while soloing on Mount Colin, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber fell six meters after a handhold came off and a bolt pulled out, resulting in shattered bones in one foot and a fracture in the other.
Two climbers experienced High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) at 17,200 feet on Mount McKinley's West Buttress and were evacuated by helicopter.
Charles Grey experienced symptoms of HAPE at 14,200 feet on Mount McKinley and descended with assistance after receiving oxygen.
A climber collapsed from abdominal distress at 16,700 feet on the West Buttress of Mt. McKinley due to a pre-existing medical condition that he failed to disclose to his party.
Climbers were struck by lightning on Cathedral Peak after deciding to continue climbing despite seeing distant rain and not having the current weather forecast.
Two climbers finished Royal Arches, then one fell while scrambling off route, dislocating his shoulder after a hold broke or his feet slipped.
Marie Cyr developed pulmonary edema at 17,200 feet and descended with assistance to a lower altitude, where her condition improved.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Selenium Falls
description: A climber fell 140 meters to his death after mistaking the tail end of a V-thread anchor for the main loop during a rappel on Selenium Falls.
Kyle Brown fell 50 feet while teaching rappelling, possibly due to anchor or knot failure, or loss of footing, resulting in fatal head injuries.
A climber on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley experienced respiratory distress and was evacuated by helicopter after not responding to initial treatment.

location_name: Denali National Park and Preserve, Mount Johnson, Ruth Gorge
description: A serac collapsed on two climbers at the base of Mount Johnson, burying one climber who was later presumed dead and injuring the other.

Erik Seedhouse slipped on ice and fell a short distance, shouting that he hurt his leg, but was not seriously injured; the incident highlighted concerns about the team's inexperience and poor decision-making.
A climber fell approximately 300 meters on Cascade Mountain after slipping on snow and being unable to self-arrest due to having his ice ax in his pack; he died of multiple trauma.

location_name: British Columbia, Tantalus Range, Mount Dione
description: A climber descending Mount Dione after completing the second ascent of the West Face slipped and fell 30 meters, sustaining fatal injuries after a rappel error, exacerbated by dehydration and fatigue.
A climber rappelling from a 400-foot rock face realized his rope was too short and he was stranded 150 feet from the ground; he was rescued by the Fire Department.
Two climbers attempting to summit Mount Shasta were caught in a severe winter storm, leading to disorientation, a fatal fall for one, and hypothermia for the other.
One skier was killed and five others injured in an avalanche on Wright Peak in the Adirondack High Peaks while skiing off-trail.

location_name: Black Mountain Range, Celo Knob, The Crescent
description: A climber fell 40 feet after an ice screw pulled out, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and knee injury.
A climber fell while ice climbing, likely due to an anchor or carabiner failure, and sustained fatal injuries.
A climber fell 50 feet on the second pitch of Stairway to Heaven after both feet popped from their holds while attempting to climb over an ice bulge, resulting in a compression fracture.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber fell 800 feet to his death while climbing unroped on loose rock at the base of the Yellow Wall Route on Longs Peak.
A climber died after falling while being lowered due to the failure of a webbing anchor sling that was connected with masking tape.
A climber fell several hundred feet while rappelling on the South Face of Washington Column, likely due to an inadequate anchor system while attempting to free stuck ropes.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: James A. Guest took a 30-foot lead fall on Pervertical Sanctuary on the Diamond of Longs Peak, resulting in fractures to both legs due to inadequate protection.

location_name: Mount Washington, Central Pillar, North Ridge
description: Two climbers fell over 100 feet after their protection failed due to inadequate anchor and brittle rock, resulting in serious injuries and a multi-day rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book
description: A climber fell while attempting to place protection on a 5.10 section after getting off route, pulling protection and fracturing his foot, requiring rescue.
Heather Lower fell 100-125 feet at Cat Slab while being lowered, due to an inadequate tie-in and not wearing a helmet, resulting in her death.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Pywiack Dome
description: A climber fell while leading a pitch, striking his head and sustaining a scalp laceration. He was lowered to the belay, treated, and evacuated to a hospital, later released with no fractures.

A climber fell 25-30 feet while lead climbing, hitting their head on the rock face and lacerating their scalp, requiring stitches. The climber was not wearing a helmet and overestimated their abilities.
Two climbers were struck by rocks during a rockfall event on the Sandy Glacier Headwall route on Mount Hood, resulting in injuries and requiring rescue.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock, The Womb
description: A climber fell approximately 40 feet when a cam pulled while climbing The Womb on Looking Glass Rock, landing on a boulder and sustaining injuries to their coccyx and back.
Aaron Nydam fell about 25 feet while climbing after his protection pulled out, sustaining a dislocated hip and cuts.

A climber fell while leading Stone Groove after a TCU pulled out, resulting in a ground fall partially broken by the belayer. The climber sustained a concussion and lacerations, while the belayer suffered a bruised knee and chipped bone.
A climber fell 25 feet while being lowered because the belayer and a second person could not hold his weight, resulting in back and neck injuries.

location_name: Parley's Canyon, Parley's Canyon, Salt Lake City
description: A climber fell approximately 80 feet due to a lowering error, resulting in a femur fracture and two ankle fractures.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet while rappelling due to an improperly set up rope, resulting in multiple traumatic injuries.
A lead climber fell after a nut pulled out while testing it, causing a cam below to fail; he sustained serious injuries. During the rescue, a rockfall injured another climber.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Mount Shuksan
description: John Nedila slipped on a snow slope on Mount Shuksan and fell 125 feet, sustaining fatal injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mount Ypsilon
description: A climber lost control while glissading on the Spectacle Lake Snowfield on Mount Ypsilon and sustained head and facial injuries after impacting rocks.
Diana Kornet fell approximately 2,500 feet to her death after slipping near the summit of Mount Hood while unroped in windy conditions.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell while attempting Second Coming, a 5.7 route, when a cam placement failed, resulting in a broken ankle and requiring evacuation.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber was struck in the face by falling ice while preparing to climb the third pitch of the Casual Route on Longs Peak, sustaining lacerations, a concussion, fractured nose, and hematomas.
An ice fall from an ice cliff injured five climbers, including two guides who sustained serious injuries and required helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Kautz Cleaver
description: A climber sustained serious injuries from a spontaneous rockfall while setting up camp on the Kautz Cleaver of Mount Rainier.
A climber dislodged a rock with their daypack, which struck a member of the group, causing serious internal injuries requiring hospitalization and surgery.
A cornice collapsed under a group of mountaineers during guide tryouts, resulting in one person sustaining fractures to the L-1 and L-2 vertebrae.

Thomas Porro fell into a crevasse on the Interglacier after a snow bridge collapsed while he was crossing it unroped. He sustained a fractured foot, sprained knee, and facial injuries and was rescued by rangers.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier, Kautz Glacier
description: Two climbers, David German and Judy Rittenhouse, encountered poor weather while climbing the Kautz Glacier Route on Mount Rainier, fell into crevasses, and developed frostbite, requiring assistance for descent.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier
description: A climber on Mount Rainier's Fuhrer Finger route developed High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) and required a helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 250 feet to his death after failing to complete his figure eight knot while tying in to the rope.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Andy Haberkorn was struck by lightning and killed while seconding a pitch on the Casual Route on Longs Peak.
Two climbers fell during a descent after aborting a climb due to poor visibility, resulting in injuries to themselves and another member of the party.
A climber dislocated her shoulder after slipping on snow while descending Mount Olympus, requiring a rescue.
A climber got stuck on a Tyrolean traverse in the dark due to rigging problems and fatigue, requiring a SAR response, but eventually self-rescued.
Steven Wallace died in hospital after a 40 foot fall from Sentinel Rock while rappelling.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area, Mount Tammany
description: A climber fell to his death while rappelling after the anchor failed; no backup protection was used.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber lost his sight due to snow blindness while descending Longs Peak after forgetting his sunglasses on a bright, sunny day.

location_name: Seneca Rocks, West Face of the North Peak
description: A climber soloing a chimney fell after a camalot pulled, sustaining fatal head and internal injuries. He was not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: High winds knocked over one climber and threw another into rocks, resulting in a fibula fracture, during a retreat from Longs Peak.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet while scrambling unroped near the summit of Symmetry Spire after completing the Southwest Ridge route, sustaining serious injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Owen
description: Rene Steque fell 300 feet on snow at the base of the Koven Glacier while descending Mount Owen after a successful ascent, resulting in a fractured pelvis, fractured right thumb, and a head laceration.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon
description: A climber fell 350 feet to his death after a rappel anchor failed on the Open Book route in Garnet Canyon, Grand Teton National Park.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: Tom Jones slipped on snow during the descent of Mount Moran's Skillet Glacier route, sliding approximately 1,000 feet and then falling again, resulting in injuries requiring helicopter rescue and hospitalization.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Climbers near the summit of Grand Teton were unable to find the descent route and experienced mild hypothermia; they spent the night on the mountain and were assisted by other parties the next day.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress developed AMS and HAPE and was evacuated after continuing to ascend despite worsening symptoms.
A climber experienced AMS at 13,200 feet on Mount Shasta, prompting a SAR response, but the party descended on their own and the climber recovered.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Temple, East Ridge
description: A climber suffered a cardiac arrest and fell approximately 150 meters while ascending the Aemmer Couloir on Mount Temple, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Robson
description: A solo climber lost his tent and ice ax in a storm on Mount Robson and activated his personal locator beacon. He was found uninjured.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Temple, East Ridge
description: A party of three was overdue after 30 hours on the East Ridge of Mount Temple and were found exhausted, requesting evacuation, which was performed by heli-sling.

A climber with little mountaineering experience summited Mount Shasta during a storm, wandered off-route, fell, and spent two nights out before being found with mild hypothermia and other minor injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Haddo
description: A party of four became stranded on the south face of Mount Haddo after misinterpreting a guidebook description of the descent and were evacuated by heli-sling.

route_name: Mount Athabasca via the Athabasca-Andromeda col
description: A climber fell 22 meters into a crevasse on the Athabasca-Andromeda Glacier after unroping and stepping through a poorly bridged section. He sustained cuts and bruises and was rescued by park wardens.

location_name: Alberta, Jasper National Park, Athabasca Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse on the Athabasca Glacier while attempting a ski ascent of North and South Twin, sustaining minor injuries and shock before being rescued.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Aberdeen, North Glacier
description: A climber fell approximately 200 meters while solo climbing on ice, sustaining head injuries, abdominal trauma, and an ankle fracture.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak, East Face
description: Jeff Snyder fell on ice while leading to Stetner's Ledges due to inadequate equipment and protection, resulting in a knee laceration and subsequent rescue.
A climber fell approximately 30 meters while leading the final pitch of an ice climb, sustaining ankle and back injuries due to inadequate protection.
H.C. fell a long distance while ice climbing after a large plate fractured around his tools, resulting in injuries requiring stitches and surgery.

location_name: Ouray Ice Park, Ouray Ice Park
description: An experienced climber fell 140 feet at Ouray Ice Park after his belayer took him off belay due to miscommunication, while the climber was not clipped into the top-out anchors, resulting in a fatality.
J.M. tripped on easy terrain while descending after instructing an ice climbing session, falling six meters and sustaining a dislocated shoulder and back injury.
While ice bouldering five feet off the ground, a climber fell and shattered his lower leg.

location_name: Alberta, Kananaskis Country, Mount John Laurie (Yamnuska)
description: A climber fell 5-6 meters after a foothold broke while down-climbing on Yamnuska, resulting in rib injuries. He was lowered to the base and called for assistance due to concerns about further injury during the hike out.
D.E. fell after a handhold broke while approaching the col between Mounts Woolley and Cromwell, resulting in cuts, bruises, sprained hands, and a knee injury.

A climber fell on a 5.10 route and continued falling past multiple bolts due to an inadequate belay anchor that pulled the belayer off their unanchored position, resulting in the belayer swinging and hitting the cliff.
A rock-climbing teacher fell more than 60 feet while setting an anchor, without a helmet or rope, and died from massive injuries.
A climber fell approximately 25 feet due to inadequate protection while climbing near Bestowal Crack in Eldorado Canyon, resulting in injuries and requiring evacuation.
A climber fell 50-60 feet while looking at a climb from the top of a route without being tied in, sustaining major injuries.
A climber with limited experience fell while attempting a tension traverse, striking her head and back, resulting in a skull laceration and loss of consciousness.
A climber fell 15-20 meters on Mount McGillivray while leading the third pitch of Kahl Crack after a handhold pulled off due to wet conditions.
During crevasse rescue practice, a mountaineer sustained a spiral fracture in her lower leg after being spun around by a sudden jerk on the rope when a team member jumped off a cornice.
Priska Landolt injured her knee while descending below the fixed lines on Mount McKinley due to a possible ski tip hook and heavy pack, requiring medical attention and eventual evacuation.
Jason Kraus sustained a leg injury from falling ice while belaying his partner in the Japanese Couloir and was evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Johnson Canyon Upper Falls
description: J.G. was hit by falling ice dislodged by a climber above, causing her to fall ten meters and suffer a compound lower left leg fracture.
A guide was struck in the head by falling rock while descending Avalanche Gulch on Mount Shasta and sustained head trauma and a skull fracture.
A climber soloing Sea of Dreams on El Capitan had his hand crushed by a falling rock, resulting in the amputation of a finger. He self-rescued and was flown to a hospital.
A climber glissading with crampons on Mount Shasta caught his crampons, causing a fall and impaling his thigh with his ice ax, resulting in serious injuries.
Two climbers fell approximately 700 feet after a piece of ice gave way, resulting in injuries to both climbers.
A climber suffered frostbite and exhaustion on Mount McKinley due to dehydration, inadequate clothing, poor physical condition, and poor weather, requiring helicopter evacuation.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress developed High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) and was treated at the 14,200-foot camp before descending against medical advice.
Members of an expedition suffered from altitude sickness, including HAPE and HACE, due to a rapid ascent on Mount McKinley's West Buttress; one member was treated for cerebral and pulmonary edema.
A climber was evacuated from Mount McKinley due to a gastrointestinal bleed from a preexisting condition that was not reported, requiring surgery.
A climber stabbed his right knee with his left crampon while being lowered after top-roping a climb because his partner lowered him too quickly.
A climber fell after a cam and fixed stopper pulled out while climbing in the dark, resulting in a leg injury.
Two climbers fell from Middle Cathedral Rock after their anchor pulled out; both climbers died.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Snowdome, Slipstream
description: A climber soloing Slipstream on Mount Snowdome in Jasper National Park died after an apparent anchor failure while rappelling in deteriorating weather conditions.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Patterson, East Face
description: A climber sustained a fractured arm from rockfall while climbing Mount Patterson, requiring a rescue.
A large rock slide occurred on Mount Shasta's Avalanche Gulch route, injuring two clients from a guided group and another climber.
A party of two was overdue after 32 hours on the Lemire Route and were evacuated by heli-sling after encountering difficult route finding, poor rock quality, and difficult climbing.

location_name: Kananaskis Provincial Park, Mount Sir Douglas
description: Two climbers ascended Mount Sir Douglas via the East Ridge and summited late. They attempted to descend a glacier without crampons and called for rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Glacier Gorge
description: Climber suffered a transient ischemic attack (TIA) while belaying on The Barb, requiring a self-rescue and helicopter evacuation.
Two climbers were killed in Stairs Gulch by a glide avalanche while attempting to climb to Twin Peaks. They were caught in the avalanche early in the morning and were found buried in the snow.
A climber descending Glacier Peak alone and unroped fell into a hidden crevasse on the Sitkum Glacier and was rescued by another climbing party.
Climbers were on a wall when a 6.8-magnitude earthquake hit, causing rockfall and an avalanche on Mount Index. They rappelled down safely after the shaking stopped.

Two climbers attempted the North Ridge of Mount Baker, encountered deteriorating weather, got lost, bivouacked multiple times, and suffered frostbite and hypothermia before being rescued. One climber lost several toes.
A climber was killed and three others injured after falling into a crevasse on the Coleman Glacier on Mount Baker.

location_name: Mount Hood, South Side and Cathedral Ridge
description: A climber with limited glacier experience fell on frozen scree and into a crevasse while descending Mount Hood after choosing the wrong gully, and was rescued.
A climber fell on frozen scree while descending Middle Sister, sustaining serious injuries due to inadequate equipment and clothing, and inexperience.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber slipped on ice while ascending the North Chimney unroped and fell 70 feet, sustaining injuries to his ankle and heel.

location_name: Mount Hood, South Side, Pearly Gates, Hogs Back, Devils Kitchen
description: A climber lost footing on ice at the Pearly Gates on Mount Hood's South Side, falling down the Hogs Back and sustaining abrasions and a sprained ankle; dull crampons may have contributed to the fall.

location_name: Frankenstein Cliff, Frankenstein Cliff, Standard Route Left
description: A climber fell while attempting a bulge on ice, decking on a ledge and breaking his ankle.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet when a section of ice broke off, resulting in a fractured tibia and fibula and bruised ribs.
A climber fell while ice climbing on Pegasus due to poor ice quality and inadequate protection, resulting in a fractured heel bone.
A climber fell over 20 feet at an indoor climbing gym after pushing off the wall and finding no tension in the rope, resulting in head, neck, and back injuries.
A climber descending from camp alone after a weather-shortened climb decided to descend via a non-standard route and fell from a 70-foot cliff band.
Christopher Ekstrom fell 15-20 feet while leading the first pitch of Lyon's Chair, twisting his ankle and breaking his tibia due to inadequate protection.

route_name: The Incredible Hand Crack, Keyhole Flake, Super Crack, Generic Crack
description: A climber fell while leading, pulling out protection and shattering their right fibula and breaking their ankle. They also sustained a concussion.
A climber fell ten feet after a stopper pulled while down-climbing a crux, resulting in a ruptured Achilles tendon.
A climber fell 50 feet after a piece of protection attached to a loose boulder failed while setting up a top-rope, resulting in serious injuries.

Daniel Chaffee fell 70 feet on Vertigo when his protection pulled out, sustaining serious injuries including multiple fractures and facial injuries. He was rescued by a large team and airlifted to the hospital.
A climber fell 35-40 feet after his protection pulled out while down-climbing due to rope drag, resulting in minor injuries; he was not wearing a helmet.
Rod Lucas fell 40 feet on Crack of Infinity when his protection pulled out, resulting in a broken ankle and pelvis.
Ken Colburn fell 300 feet to his death after slipping on wet rocks near the summit of Guye Peak while unroped and possibly off route.
A climber fell approximately 600 feet down a rock slope after unroping and scrambling on loose rock near the summit of Chair Peak.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet to the ground after failing to clip into a quickdraw while leading a sport climb at Rumney Crags, resulting in bruising and a hospital visit.
A climber fell while traversing on a trad route due to inadequate protection, resulting in a serious ankle fracture after a pendulum fall into a rock dihedral.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Gumby's Roof
description: A climber fell approximately 20-25 feet while top-roping due to belayer inexperience, resulting in a broken ankle.
A climber was struck in the forehead by a rock while crossing the north couloir of Milk Creek, suffering a concussion.
A climber dislodged a large boulder, rode it a short distance, and then fell several hundred feet, sustaining injuries. He was rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Misery Ridge Mesa
description: A 19-year-old fell about 40 feet while scrambling on Misery Ridge Mesa after a handhold broke loose, resulting in a broken leg and scalp laceration.
A party on Bestowal Crack dislodged rocks and gear, including a large block that fell to the roadway, striking a person. The party also threw ropes on climbers below without warning.

location_name: North Cascades, Dome and Dana Glaciers
description: A group of climbers were struck by a refrigerator-sized snow block while traversing a slope, resulting in one climber sustaining a fractured pelvis, fractured vertebrae, and a pneumothorax.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Main Falls
description: Aaron Shupp fell 20-30 feet while leading the Main Falls Route due to fatigue and inexperience, injuring his leg when his crampon caught on ice. He was lowered to the base and refused medical treatment.

location_name: Devil's Lake State Park, Devil's Lake State Park
description: A climber fell after getting lost on the route and experiencing fatigue, pulling a cam and sustaining minor injuries; the belayer was pulled off the ground due to a weight difference and lack of anchor.
A climber fell after a handhold came off, and the belayer, being inexperienced and inadequately anchored, was pulled towards the wall and received rope burns.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Disappointment Cleaver, Emmons Glacier
description: A climber died of arteriosclerotic cardiovascular disease while climbing Mount Rainier with a guided group on Disappointment Cleaver.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore's Wall, Sentinel Buttress
description: A climber passed out from dehydration and exhaustion near the top of a climb and was lowered to a ledge, regained consciousness, and was assisted to the base, refusing further medical assistance.
A climber fell 50 feet after the water knot in a sling extending the anchor failed during a rappel.
Two climbers were struck by lightning while descending Lightning Bolt Crack; one was briefly unconscious and delusional, the other experienced electrical current and temporary paralysis.
Two climbers got off route on a wet, foggy day on Silver Peak, called 911, and were talked down by Seattle Mountain Rescue via cell phone.

location_name: Moore's Wall, Sentinel Buttress, Zoo View
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet after a belay anchor placement pulled out, resulting in a fractured ankle and possible internal injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Two climbers attempting the Exum Ridge on the Grand Teton got caught in a severe storm during their descent, became disoriented, and required rescue; they were ultimately unharmed.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Rock Spring Canyon
description: Three skiers left the Teton Village Ski Area boundaries, got lost in Granite Canyon due to a wrong turn, lacked survival gear, and spent a night in the backcountry before being rescued.
The leader fell when a cam pulled out while testing it, striking the wall and sustaining a leg injury; the belayer's hands were burned, and a skinny rope was used.
A large rockfall occurred during a technical rock rescue training session, injuring two park employees who were struck by flying debris.
During a sport-rappel, an old cotton rope broke when a climber bounced, causing a 20-foot fall resulting in a broken ankle, abrasions, and lacerations.
A climber following a route took a fall, jamming the rope. The leader, without setting an anchor, attempted to free the rope, risking a fall. SAR rescued the follower.
Two climbers got their rope stuck on the Whitney Gilman route and called for help; they were hauled up by rescuers after it was determined they didn't know how to use ascenders.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Owen
description: A climber sprained her ankle after a belay anchor failed due to an undone knot during a guided descent on Mount Owen.
A climber pulled off a large flake of rock while leading, causing a fifteen-foot fall and multiple injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton, Petzoldt Ridge
description: A climber fell after a large rock feature came loose when he weighted it, resulting in a leg injury requiring rescue and hospitalization.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Table Mountain
description: Ben Goodwin fell 10-20 feet while down-climbing Heartbreak Ridge on Table Mountain and landed on his back, resulting in abrasions and contusions but no spinal injury.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Nez Perce
description: A climber leading the first pitch of what he thought was the South Ridge of Nez Perce fell when a large block broke away, resulting in an eighty-foot fall due to improper belaying and inadequate protection.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet after a handhold came off near the summit of Symmetry Spire, resulting in a shattered elbow and broken foot.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A climber dislodged a rock while climbing, which struck him and caused him to tumble, resulting in lacerations, contusions, and fractures.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton, Owen-Spalding
description: A climber fell about twenty feet while rappelling the Owen-Spalding route on Grand Teton after untying knots in the rope and losing control, resulting in a serious arm injury.

location_name: Wind River Range, Cirque of the Towers, Wolf's Head Peak
description: A climber pulled off a large rock while climbing back up a gully to retrieve a stuck rope; the rock severed the rope, causing the climber to fall approximately 250-300 feet and resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber was swept 200 meters down-slope by an avalanche after an ice anchor failed, resulting in a broken leg.

Three climbers died after being caught in a small soft slab avalanche on the Southeast Ridge of Mount Foraker; the lead climber may have triggered the avalanche, which carried the other two down the slope.
Two climbers died after one triggered an avalanche while snowboarding down Mount St. Elias; one other climber suffered frostbite.

location_name: Sageunay National Park, Cap Trinite, Les Grands Gallets
description: A couple fell to their deaths while resting on a portaledge due to overloading, improper attachment to the anchor system, and failure to tie into an independent anchor.
A climber attempting to solo the Zodiac route on El Capitan died from hypothermia after a storm moved in, and he became stranded on the wall due to a complex rope system and equipment issues.

Climbers attempted Split Mountain in early October, encountering unexpected snow and cold. One climber, Dave French, was hospitalized for frostbite after the group was forced to bivouac due to getting lost and running out of daylight.
A group attempting to ford the McKinley River had trouble due to heavy packs and misjudging the crossing, resulting in falls, injuries, and lost gear.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Denali Pass
description: A five-member Spanish expedition on Mount McKinley experienced multiple accidents: one climber fell into a crevasse and self-extricated, and two others fell while descending unroped from Denali Pass due to icy conditions and fatigue, resulting in serious injuries.
A guide fell 50 feet into a crevasse after breaking through a snow bridge, sustaining multiple broken ribs, and was later evacuated by helicopter after weather delayed a planned pickup.
A climber fell 90 feet into a crevasse while snowshoeing down a glacier on Idems Peak and died.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse while descending the Kahiltna Glacier on Mount McKinley's West Buttress and sustained a possible hip injury, requiring helicopter evacuation due to hypothermia and potential fractures.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Bow Falls
description: A climber fell while ice climbing on Bow Falls after failing to place adequate protection, resulting in a basal skull fracture and other injuries.
A climber fell while leading the first pitch of Lady Killer after running it out to the top, sustaining pelvic and spinal injuries.

location_name: Ouray Ice Park, Ouray Ice Park
description: John Ohlson fell while leading Pic O’ the Vic (WI 4) in the Ouray Ice Park, sustaining compression fractures, a broken thumb, and lacerations. He was relatively new to water ice climbing and the protection was inadequate.
T.M. fell 25 meters while leading the last pitch of Professor Falls after her ice tool pulled out, resulting in a broken ankle.
An experienced ice climber fell after an ice tool placement pulled out while leading the second pitch of Shades of Beauty, resulting in serious ankle fractures.

location_name: British Columbia, Dowler Range, Mount Dougie Dowler
description: A climber fell approximately 800 feet to his death while solo climbing Mount Dougie Dowler unroped.

location_name: Eldorado State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet while soloing Redguard on Red Garden Wall, sustaining cranial and wrist fractures and requiring chest decompression.
A rappeller being belayed by an inexperienced belayer who was not tied in was pulled off the top of the slab and fell 60 feet, sustaining minor injuries.
A climber fell 40 feet after protection pulled while leading a thin A4 pitch, resulting in injuries and rope burns to the belayer.

A climber attempting a solo speed record on El Capitan fell approximately 60 feet due to a pulled copperhead, broken rivet hanger, and a snapped locking carabiner, resulting in rope burns and an inflamed back injury, leading to a rescue.
A climber fell while being lowered after a top rope setup due to the absence of a stopper knot, resulting in head and body injuries but ultimately survived due to wearing a helmet.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge, Whiteman
description: A climber fell approximately 110 feet from the top anchor of the first pitch of Whiteman due to miscommunication with the belayer, resulting in multiple broken bones and internal injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Canmore, Mount Fable, Southeast Ridge
description: A climber fell while off route on Mount Fable's Southeast Ridge after inadequate protection pulled out during a fall, resulting in injuries and requiring helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 20 feet when a rock block used as protection pulled out, resulting in a crushed ankle.
A climber fell 25 meters after a foot slipped and protection pulled out, resulting in a femur fracture and requiring heli-sling rescue.
Scott Hamilton fell more than 150 feet while solo climbing without ropes or a helmet on The Dome in Boulder Canyon and died.

location_name: Clear Creak Canyon, Clear Creak Canyon
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet during an uncontrolled rappel due to lack of backup, single rope rappel, and a heavy pack.
A solo climber fell while descending from Denali Pass after a summit attempt, succumbing to exhaustion and lack of recent glacier experience.
A climber fell approximately 30 feet while descending alone from Denali Pass, sustaining rib fractures, a spleen laceration, and a bruised liver, requiring helicopter evacuation.

Russ Watts fell 150 feet from Notch Camp on the West Rib of Mount McKinley while checking snow conditions without a belay, due to icy conditions and exhaustion from a previous summit ascent, resulting in multiple fractures.
A skier fell through a cornice while traversing the Wapta Icefield in whiteout conditions on Mount Balfour after the group decided to unrope. The skier fell to his death.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Louise Falls
description: A climber was crushed by falling ice while belaying in a cave under a large veil of hanging ice at Louise Falls, resulting in a fatal fall.

location_name: Waterton Lakes National Park, Cameron Lake Road, Pearl Necklace
description: A climber fell after an icicle broke while leading without protection, resulting in a broken tibia and fibula.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Athabasca, North Ridge
description: A climber was hit by rockfall on the North Ridge of Mount Athabasca, causing a diminished level of consciousness and requiring rescue.
A climber was hit by a falling rock while climbing Avalanche Gulch on Mount Shasta, resulting in a fractured clavicle and other minor injuries.

location_name: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park, Mount Augusta, North Buttress
description: A climber was struck by a rock while scouting for a bivouac ledge on Mount Augusta, resulting in serious injuries and a subsequent rescue.
A climber pulled on a loose rock, causing a rockfall that injured him, resulting in a fractured humerus and dislocated shoulder.
Climber pulled on a large detached block which fell, causing the climber to fall down a chimney/gully, resulting in broken ribs and other injuries.
Climbers on the Direct West Buttress experienced fatigue, dehydration, and a possible pulmonary infection, requiring assistance from NPS volunteers to descend.
A solo climber was evacuated from Mount McKinley's West Buttress due to HACE and HAPE after becoming disoriented and ataxic during a summit attempt.
A climber fell after loose chalkstones came away while climbing the east chimney route at Sugar Loaf, resulting in an avulsion fracture and a gash requiring stitches.

location_name: Selkirk Mountains South, Mount Billy Budd
description: A climber slipped on a snow patch while descending Mount Billy Budd without an ice ax or rope, was unable to self-arrest, and fell 300 meters on snow and then tumbled 20 meters onto rock, resulting in fatal head injuries.
A climber slipped on a snow slope, failed to self-arrest, hit a boulder, and tumbled over rock talus, resulting in a serious hip injury and requiring helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Temple, East Ridge
description: A solo climber on Mount Temple experienced neurological problems and was rescued after bivying on the ridge.
Two climbers were overdue after spending the night on a ledge on The Finger due to early season snowfalls and were rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Waterton Lakes National Park, Crandell Mountain, Tick Ridge
description: A large group of inexperienced climbers became stranded after descending into progressively steeper terrain and being blocked by cliffs, requiring a helicopter rescue.

location_name: Peter Lougheed Provincial Park, Mount Brock, Southwest Face
description: A solo climber got stranded on Mount Brock due to changing weather conditions and inadequate equipment after deviating from his planned route and had to be rescued.
Climbers in Tuckerman Ravine triggered an avalanche; two climbers were swept away and died from trauma, and another climber was injured.
Climbers descending Mount Hood fell into a crevasse after losing their footing and being unable to self-arrest, pulling other climbers into the fall, resulting in fatalities and injuries.
A climber fell 12-15 feet on the first pitch of Spiderman due to inadequate protection, rope stretch, and a dynamic belay, resulting in a broken ankle.
A climber with limited experience in placing protection fell after climbing too high above their last piece, resulting in a dislocated ankle and a spiral fracture of the fibula.
A climber fell while leading the first pitch of Recompense due to inadequate protection, poor technique, and slippery shoes, resulting in a compound ankle fracture.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness Area, North Carolina Wall
description: A climber fell while attempting to clip his fifth piece of protection; the fourth piece pulled out due to rock failure, resulting in a fatal fall to the base of the route. He was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell while leading the second pitch of Perhaps when a fixed piton pulled, resulting in fractures and requiring SAR assistance.
A climber fell while leading Air Guitar, a 5.10a crack, after a cam pulled and a carabiner broke, resulting in fatal head injuries.
A climber fell after a hook popped while attempting to free an aid climb; the rope was cut by a sharp edge during the fall, but the climber survived with minor injuries.
A climber fell to his death while rappelling from Spaceshot in Zion National Park, likely due to an improperly tied or failed knot.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier, Liberty Ridge
description: A climbing team encountered a fierce storm while descending from Liberty Cap on Mount Rainier, leading to disorientation, falls, and exposure, resulting in three fatalities.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, cliff top below the Ledge Springs Trail
description: Brian Zimmerman fell approximately 30 feet while free-soloing to set up a top rope climb, sustaining head, elbow, and leg injuries.
A man fell to his death while attempting to retrieve his cell phone from a pit using inadequate equipment and without a harness or friction device.
Ice broke off the first pitch of "Positive Thinking" on Poke-O-Moonshine, taking a climber with it, resulting in a fatality and minor injuries to the climbing partner.
A climber was struck and killed by falling rock while climbing the Disappointment Cleaver route on Mount Rainier.
A climber was struck in the head by a rock while ascending Liberty Ridge on Mount Rainier, resulting in a head injury and subsequent rescue involving a helicopter crash.
Two climbers were killed by a lightning strike on the summit of Lone Peak after completing a five-pitch climb.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Left Slab Crack
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet to the ground after the rope ran out during a lowering, resulting in injuries including a head wound, bruised kidney, and bruised lung.
A 15-year-old experienced acute mountain sickness and was left unsupervised at basecamp while his father attempted to climb the mountain, raising concerns about child endangerment.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Wilson, Wilson Major
description: Two climbers approaching Wilson Major triggered a slab avalanche and were swept into trees; one suffered a broken ankle.
A high school backcountry ski group was buried by an avalanche on Mount Cheops, resulting in seven fatalities.
A group of eleven backcountry skiers was caught in an avalanche, resulting in seven fatalities and one injury.
A solo climber was caught in an avalanche on Mount Lady MacDonald and buried in debris, resulting in death by suffocation.
A party of ice climbers on Mount Murray was hit by two avalanches, resulting in one climber breaking a leg.

location_name: Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Robson
description: A solo climber disappeared while climbing Mount Robson's Fuhrer Ridge and is presumed to have fallen into a crevasse.
A climber on the West Rib of Mount McKinley suffered frostbite due to dehydration and inability to access mittens, requiring a helicopter evacuation.
A climbing party on Mount McKinley's Messner Couloir experienced dehydration, exhaustion, and minor frostbite due to slow progress and failure to turn back, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A client lacerated their cheek due to a bent braces collar, and a climber fractured a bicuspid, both requiring medical attention.

location_name: Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Robson, Robson Glacier, Mousetrap
description: A climber fell through a snow bridge over a crevasse on the Robson Glacier, sustaining rib and shoulder injuries from falling snow and ice blocks; a rescue was performed with assistance from another climbing party.

location_name: Banff National Park, Five Mile Creek, Mount Cory, Dumber
description: G.H. dislocated his kneecap while top-roping on ice after his foot slipped.
A climber fell while ice climbing after a tool placement in a bulge shattered, leading to a broken ankle and a slide down a ramp.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Murchison, Balfour Wall
description: R.C. fell while leading an ice climb on the Balfour Wall after his tools pulled, resulting in two broken ankles.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Johnston Canyon
description: L.R. fell while climbing unroped on low-angle ice in Johnston Canyon, breaking her ankle and lower leg.

location_name: Banff National Park, Back of the Lake Crag
description: T. fell while leading the Ash Wednesday route at Back of the Lake Crag and fractured his fibula.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Moraine Lake, Schiesser Ledges Route
description: G.A. fell off the side of a moraine and tumbled about 50 meters down the steep side wall, sustaining a head injury and facial trauma, and later died in the hospital due to blood clots.

location_name: British Columbia, Squamish, Lower Malamute area
description: A 23-year-old male from the United States fell while rock climbing in the Lower Malamute area and was transported to the Squamish Hospital with possible back injuries.
Irene fell while attempting a crux move on the final pitch of Nutcracker, resulting in a bi-malleolar fracture dislocation of her left ankle.
A solo climber fell approximately 150-200 feet down a scree slope on Mount Lorette's South Ridge and died.

location_name: Alberta, Kananaskis Country, Mount Lorette, South Ridge
description: A climber fell approximately 400 feet to his death while solo climbing Mount Lorette's South Ridge.
A climber fell 25-35 meters after getting off route and a nut pulled out, resulting in a fatal head injury.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park/Alpine Recreation Area, Snowpatch Spire
description: A climber fell on the final pitch of the Kraus/McCarthy route on Snowpatch Spire after mistakenly assuming the 5.10 crack was the 5.8 crack, and the top-most nut and cam ripped from the crack.

location_name: Alberta, Bow Valley, Yamnuska, CMC Wall
description: A climber fell 15 meters on Yamnuska's CMC Wall after pulling out loose rocks and a fixed pin, resulting in a dislocated knee and ankle pain; she was rescued by helicopter.
D.G. fell 30 meters to his death while rock climbing on the Stawamus Chief after rigging a toprope for another party.
A climber fell while leading Overhang Bypass, likely due to inadequate protection, and was not wearing a helmet; he sustained fatal injuries.
A climber fell approximately 50 meters while scrambling up Cascade Mountain and sustained a severe head injury, resulting in death.

location_name: Banff National Park, Back of the Lake Crag, Air Voyage Wall
description: D.W. fell while leading Scared Peaches, a 5.12a route, when his protection pulled, resulting in an eight meter fall and a deep gash to his thigh.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Tonquin Valley, Mount Oubliette
description: A climber fell when a foothold broke and pulled out protection, resulting in bruising and a leg injury. They self-rescued back to camp.
A climber fell on El Capitan while aiding the Zodiac route when a fixed copperhead blew, resulting in a hip injury.

location_name: Windy Point, North Fin area west of Windy Point
description: Joaquin Fox fell 80 feet while rappelling, unable to stop himself, and sustained back, eye, and possible head injuries.
A climber slipped and fell on fixed lines, hitting a partner below and causing him to fall. The fallen partner sustained a puncture wound and knee injury but was able to descend.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Lake Louise, Louise Falls
description: An ice climber was injured at Louise Falls when a piece of ice broke off the icefall due to a sudden cold snap.

location_name: Banff National Park, Weeping Wall, Center Pillar
description: A leader dislodged a large piece of ice which hit the belayer on the head, causing serious injuries. Quick actions by a nearby party were critical in the rescue.
A climber was struck by rockfall on Mount Fryatt while putting on crampons, resulting in a head injury and requiring helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Roche à Perdrix
description: A climber was struck in the head by a falling rock while rappelling, resulting in a concussion and fractured vertebrae.
A climber dislodged a rock, lost footing, and fell approximately 100 meters down broken ledges while descending Throne Mountain.
A climber dislodged a large rock which struck and broke the femur of the belayer below, requiring a multi-pitch rescue.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress suffered frostbite and AMS, requiring assistance from NPS personnel and medical treatment before descending.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress suffered High Altitude Cerebral Edema and was evacuated after becoming unconscious at 17,200 feet.
Peter Staples suffered from High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) at the 17,200-foot camp on Mt. McKinley's West Buttress route and was assisted down to a lower camp.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed HAPE due to a rapid ascent and was treated by NPS medical personnel before descending.
Christopher Allewell experienced severe abdominal pain and was diagnosed with colitis, requiring evacuation from Mount McKinley and hospitalization.

location_name: Bugaboo Glacier Provincial Park/Alpine Recreation Area, Snowpatch Spire
description: A climber fell approximately five meters when a sling popped off a horn while down-climbing, resulting in a dislocated shoulder.

A team of three mountaineers separated on Mount McKinley, with one member, Voytovych, lagging behind and causing concern due to crevasse hazards; he was later found exhausted and dehydrated, while another team member, Volkov, was treated for frostbite.
Matt Sachs sustained a knee injury while climbing to the fixed lines on Denali and was evacuated. His climbing partner, June Braugham, was also evacuated due to limited mountain experience.
Two women were stranded on a cliff ledge on Mount Indefatigable after taking an incorrect exit route in the dark and were rescued by helicopter.
Two climbers rappelling from the "Shaken Not Stirred" route on the Moose's Tooth fell approximately 1000 feet when their slung block anchor failed due to possible freeze-thaw cycle.
Assistant guide strained his lower back while ascending below the fixed lines and was assisted down to Ranger Camp and eventually evacuated by helicopter.
Two climbers attempting the Black Dike triggered an avalanche, resulting in one climber sustaining fractured vertebrae and a bruised kidney, while the other experienced serious bruising.
Two climbers on El Capitan became severely dehydrated due to unseasonably warm weather and inadequate water supply, requiring a rescue for water replenishment before completing their climb.
Two climbers simul-climbing Mount Dana fell on ice due to a slip, resulting in serious injuries for one climber who was short-hauled to a hospital.
A 22-year-old woman fell to her death while solo climbing the Venusian Blind Arête on Temple Crag; she was found off-route and may have encountered loose rock.
A climber fell 30 feet on the East Face of Chimney Rock due to fatigue and inadequate protection, resulting in serious foot injuries and requiring a difficult evacuation.
A climber fell 250 feet to the ground after a belayer may have accidentally unclipped him from the anchor, and the climber's backup attachment failed.
A climber fell on the first pitch of Calypso after the second climber pulled all the protection, resulting in a pendulum and broken ankle.
A climber fell 35 feet on the third pitch of Recompense after a cam placement failed, resulting in a broken wrist and dislocated bones. He was 15 feet above his last piece of protection.
A first-season leader fell while attempting Roadside Attraction, pulling a nut and sliding down a slab, resulting in minor injuries.

route_name: Super Pooper or White Maiden’s Walkway
description: Two climbers fell approximately 700 feet to their deaths while taking down their belay system, possibly due to a slip and inadequate protection.
Trent Gabel fell to his death while climbing Middle Sister, likely after dislodging rocks; he was separated from his adult partner at the time.

location_name: North Sister, Slopes below the summit
description: Dr. Bruce Shively fell 600 feet to his death while descending the steep, unstable slopes below the summit of North Sister after becoming separated from his climbing partner.
A climber fell approximately 65 feet after protection pulled out in a "zipper fashion" while climbing at Cobb Rock, landing feet first and then on his back, resulting in back pain.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Sunnyside Bench, Jam Crack
description: A climber with limited trad experience fell while leading Jam Crack after a piece of protection pulled out, resulting in an angulated fracture of her right ankle.
A climber died after a rappel anchor failed while rappelling on Cathedral Peak in Yosemite National Park.
An instructor and a client fell on slick granite slabs during a downpour, resulting in the instructor suffering a serious ankle injury.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Overboard Area
description: A climber was lowered off the end of the rope by the belayer, resulting in a fall and serious injuries.
A climber fell 20 feet after dislodging a rock block on the descent from Clyde Minaret, resulting in a fractured hip, leg, lacerations, and a sprained ankle.
A hiker fell to his death after dislodging a rock on Snowmass Mountain; recent rain softened the soil, contributing to the accident.

location_name: Snow Creek Wall, Snow Creek Wall, Outer Space
description: William Tharpe died in a rappelling accident on Snow Creek Wall after a fall, likely due to a rappel error with no backup, and dislodged rocks struck another climber.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, Near one of the access gullies, west of the Amphitheater
description: Russell Page fell approximately 40 feet during a rappel training exercise due to a loss of control and lack of belay or backup, resulting in a severe skull fracture.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Ruth
description: A climber fell approximately 1600 feet while glissading on Mount Ruth after losing control and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in multiple injuries.
A climber was struck by a falling rock dislodged by his partner, resulting in injuries including bruised vertebrae, a compressed disc, a fractured rib, and a bruised kidney.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton, North Face
description: A climber on the North Face of the Grand Teton was hit by a falling rock and knocked unconscious, requiring a rescue operation.
A climber was hit by a rock slab while solo aid-climbing, resulting in a broken ankle, tibia, and fibula. He was able to rappel to the bottom and was rescued by SAR.

location_name: Boulder Creek Canyon, Boulder Creek Canyon, ten miles west of Boulder
description: A man was pinned by a large rock that rolled onto his leg while preparing to cross a creek on a traverse rope to reach a climbing area.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber experienced High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) and possibly High Altitude Cerebral Edema (HACE) after descending the Grand Teton and was assisted down.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: On July 26, a lightning strike on the Exum Ridge of the Grand Teton fatally injured one climber and injured seven others; the group was caught in a storm due to a late start and poor positioning.

location_name: Devils Tower National Monument, Devils Tower
description: Jacqueline Weimer fell approximately 100 meters while rappelling adjacent to El Cracko Diablo on Devils Tower after losing control of the rope and having it slip through her rappel device.
A climbing team mistakenly took a gully on Reid Headwall, encountered poor weather, and became stranded, requiring rescue due to near hypothermia in some party members.
Two climbers got stranded on Fairview Dome due to getting off route, delays, and worsening weather with inadequate clothing, but were rescued by the Park Service.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley became ill with acute mountain sickness and possible high altitude pulmonary edema and was escorted to a lower camp for treatment.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Deltaform, Supercouloir
description: Two climbers attempting the Supercouloir route on Mount Deltaform fell after starting to descend, possibly due to cornices, and were later found deceased in avalanche debris.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Rundle, Professor Falls
description: A party of two was climbing Professor Falls when a large avalanche occurred. They took shelter and were covered by debris but were uninjured. Other climbers below were also safe.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mount Wilson
description: Three ice climbers were caught in a size 2.5 avalanche on Mount Wilson in Banff National Park and were buried, resulting in three fatalities.
An ice climber was swept 300 meters down slope by a wet avalanche, sustaining a lower leg fracture and bruising, while approaching the bottom pitch of Super Bock in Yoho National Park.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Mount Vice President
description: An American man backcountry skiing on Mount Vice President in Yoho National Park died when he was swept away by a size three avalanche caused by a cornice collapse.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber on Mount McKinley developed a deep vein thrombosis due to an inadequate supply of blood thinners and required evacuation.
A skier fell 60 feet into a crevasse on the Deville Glacier while ski touring and died.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Athabasca, North Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse on Mount Athabasca's North Glacier while skiing unroped; he was rescued after four hours and released from the hospital with no injuries.

location_name: Banff National Park, Cascade Mountain, Cascade Waterfall
description: A climber leading the last pitch of Cascade Waterfall fell and injured his ankles. He was lowered to the base and transported to the hospital with a hairline fracture.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Bourgeau, Bourgeau Right-Hand
description: A climber on Bourgeau Right-Hand took a 15-meter lead fall, resulting in fractured ankles and frostbite, and self-evacuated.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Andromeda, Practice Gullies
description: Two climbers fell when the leader's tool placements failed and the anchor failed, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and fractured femur for one climber and minor bruising for the other.
I.T. fell while solo climbing a mixed route in Haffner Creek Canyon, fracturing his ankle in three places and requiring helicopter evacuation.
J.S. fell while attempting an unroped mixed traverse on poor ice, resulting in a broken tibia and fibula.

location_name: Peter Lougheed Provincial Park, Mount Brock
description: A climber fell approximately 1,000 feet on Mount Brock while descending after a solo, unroped climb, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Kananaskis Country, Mount John Laurie (Mount Yamnuska)
description: A climber fell about 20 meters and broke his leg after a large rock came loose while climbing The Bowl on Mount Yamnuska.

location_name: Kananaskis Country, Mount John Laurie (Mount Yamnuska)
description: A climber fell approximately 40 feet while rope-soloing on Mount Yamnuska after a hold broke, resulting in a fractured ankle.

location_name: Alberta, Waterdog, North D'art Area, Obliteration
description: T.M. fell approximately 100 feet after a handhold came loose while scrambling unroped to the base of an ice climb, resulting in bruising and a sprained ankle.

location_name: Banff National Park, Grotto Canyon, Paintings Walls
description: A climber fell 30 feet while leading a 5.9 climb at Grotto Canyon due to an inattentive or inexperienced belayer, sustaining multiple injuries.

location_name: Banff National Park, Tunnel Mountain, Gooseberry
description: A lead climber fell 30-40 feet on the third pitch of Gooseberry on Tunnel Mountain, sustaining a back injury. He was evacuated after suffering muscle spasms during the walk out.
A climber fell while climbing the third pitch of Northwest Books on Lembert Dome after struggling to place gear, striking his head and losing consciousness briefly.

location_name: Banff National Park, Tunnel Mountain, The Shoe
description: A climber on the first pitch of "The Shoe" fell when his gear pulled, resulting in a head injury and subsequent rescue.

location_name: Mont Saint Hilaire, northern slopes near “Cave of the Fairies”
description: A climber fell approximately 50 meters to his death while climbing unroped and alone on Mont Saint Hilaire.
Climbers were attacked by bees, leading to a fall and fatality. One climber fell after untying from the rope while down-climbing to escape the bees. The victim was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell about 40 feet after the belayer allowed the end of the rope to pass through the belay device, resulting in a fractured arm, dislocated shoulder, and abrasions.

A climber fell 20 feet to the ground while being lowered because the rope was too short and the belayer was distracted, resulting in the end of the rope feeding through the belay device. No serious injury resulted.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Church Bowl, Bishops Terrace
description: A climber fell while leading Bishops Terrace due to inadequate protection and not wearing a helmet, resulting in serious injuries. The belayer was nearly pulled off the ledge.

location_name: High Sierra, Palisades Region, V-Notch, Polemonium Peak, Sill
description: A climber died after a rappel anchor failed while descending from a climb in the High Sierra.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Denali Pass
description: A Korean climber fell 50-60 feet above Denali Pass and sustained a head injury, requiring a difficult rescue operation hampered by high winds and whiteout conditions.

location_name: High Sierra, Mount Ritter, Southeast Glacier
description: A climber fell approximately 500 feet on the Southeast Glacier of Mount Ritter after separating from his partner and attempting to traverse hard ice without proper equipment.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Athabasca, North Face
description: Two climbers were struck by rockfall on Mount Athabasca's north face, resulting in one fatality and one injury; the group was ascending the route when they encountered rockfall.

location_name: Kananaskis Country, Mount John Laurie (Mount Yamnuska)
description: A climber fixing a project on Mount Yamnuska was hit by a falling rock, knocking him off his stance and causing him to break both lower limbs.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Lake O'Hara, Abbott Pass
description: A climber was struck in the head and killed by rockfall while ascending the approach gullies to Abbott Pass from Lake O’Hara in Yoho National Park.
A party of three was struck by a falling snow block while climbing the Japanese Couloir on Mount Barrille, resulting in one climber sustaining serious injuries.
A team was struck by falling ice and snow while climbing Peak 11,300, resulting in an injury and a retreat.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber on Mount McKinley experienced medical problems, including chest pain and difficulty breathing, and had to be assisted down the mountain after failing to disclose previous medical history and taking antibiotics.
Overdue climbers Sue Nott and Karen McNeill were located on Mount McKinley after failing to communicate their status due to a misplaced radio antenna; a search was initiated but they were found safe.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A mountaineering expedition exhibited poor behavior by separating from injured and ill teammates, failing to maintain tents during a storm, and disregarding instructions, leading to citations for disorderly conduct and tampering.

location_name: Kananaskis Country, Barrier Mountain, Barrier Bluffs
description: A climber fell 15-20 meters while rappelling due to an incorrectly loaded rappel device and failure to test it, resulting in serious injuries.
Climber fell while ascending a fixed rope to bolt a route due to accidental disengagement of the ascender and lack of a backup ascender, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: White Tank Regional Park, Waterfall Area, Phoenix
description: A climber rappelling alone fell to his death while attempting to pass a knot in the rope; he became separated from his harness approximately 175 feet above his location.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Mount Dennis, Carlsberg Column
description: A climber slipped and fell over 35 meters while traversing to the base of Carlsberg Column, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Temple, Aemmer Couloir
route_name: Aemmer Couloir variation of the East Ridge
description: A group of four climbers attempting the Aemmer Couloir variation on Mount Temple became stranded after going off route, requiring rescue for two exhausted climbers and evacuation for the other two.
A solo climber got stranded on Mount Rundle after scrambling into steep technical rock slabs and being unable to go up or down, requiring a warden rescue.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Lake O'Hara, Mount Biddle
description: A party of six climbers on Mount Biddle were caught in a storm; one climber separated and was presumed dead, while the rest continued to the summit. One climber was stranded on descent and required rescue, and the separated climber was later found and rescued.
Two climbers were caught in an avalanche in a crevasse on the Ingraham Glacier; one was buried and died, the other was partially buried but survived.
Two experienced climbers were caught in a large avalanche on Liberty Ridge on Mount Rainier and died; they were likely in the process of setting up or breaking camp when the avalanche occurred.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier
description: A climber fell on an icy pitch of the Kautz Glacier Route, pulling out protection and causing both climbers to tumble into a crevasse, resulting in injuries.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet while simul-climbing on the North Ridge of Mount Baker due to inadequate protection and belay, resulting in a broken leg.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Hidden Falls
description: A climber leading an ice route fell approximately 30 feet after an ice foothold and tool placement failed, resulting in a minor ankle injury.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber free-soloing Smoke and Mirrors fell approximately 100 feet, sustaining serious injuries and requiring a complex rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, The Grand Traverse
description: Dwight Bishop fell to his death while free-soloing on the Grand Traverse, likely on the North Ridge route of the Grand Teton.

location_name: Red Rocks Canyon, Black Velvet Canyon
description: A climber fell ten feet on the 17th pitch of Epinephrine, sustaining a knee injury, and later developed hypothermia on fourth-class terrain, requiring rescue.
Jeff Cabral fell to his death while cleaning the fifth pitch of Tangerine Trip after both of his ascenders came off the rope, and he was not adequately backed up.
A climber fell 30 feet when a handhold broke off while attempting to mantel a shelf, resulting in a fractured ankle.

location_name: Oregon Cascades, Mount Washington, West Face
description: Two climbers fell from near the top of the West Face of Mount Washington, likely due to inadequate protection, resulting in both fatalities.
A climber fell backwards while passing other climbers on the Northeast Face of Middle Palisade and died from the fall.
A climber fell 30 feet from the crux of Boston after a cam failed, resulting in a ground fall and ultimately death three days later.
Mark Kent fell while climbing Godzilla at Smith Rock when his protection pulled out, resulting in a fall to a ledge and head injury.

route_name: Eagle Face of Norman Clyde Peak
description: A climber fell while leading due to a hold breaking and later sustained a broken ankle when a rappel anchor failed, causing a rockfall.

location_name: Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area, Twin Arches formation
description: A boulderer fell six feet when a handhold broke off, fracturing her pelvis and bruising her ribs. She was evacuated by helicopter to a hospital.
A climber fell after a handhold came off, resulting in a fractured talus and helicopter rescue; the climber may have been off route.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Matthes Crest
