description: A climber jumped down a short distance instead of down-climbing, resulting in a broken and severely deformed foot, requiring helicopter rescue.

location_name: Big Cottonwood Canyon, Storm Mountain Amphitheater
description: Amberly Rogers fell while attempting to set up a top-rope at Storm Mountain Amphitheater and was not anchored at the top of the cliff. She died from her injuries several days later.

A climber fell to his death after getting off route on Anthill Direct in Eldorado Canyon as daylight faded; his gear sling became caught, restricting breathing, and the second, with limited English, was unable to assist effectively.
Two climbers fell 1,000 feet on Mount Hood after a fall on steep snow pulled out the belayer and their picket, resulting in fractures, abrasions, and lacerations.

A group of backcountry skiers encountered icy conditions in Pipeline Gully. One skier fell and was injured, and another fell while attempting to descend without an ice ax after losing a crampon, resulting in a fatality.
A solo climber fell approximately 200 feet after dislodging rock on Mount Hood's South Side route, resulting in a fractured leg and requiring rescue.

A climber descending Mount Jefferson fell after encountering ice under fresh snow, causing his crampons to catch and break his fibula. He and his partner spent the night on the mountain and were rescued the next day.

location_name: Indian Peaks Wilderness, snowfields between North Arapaho Peak and “Deshawa Peak”
description: A climber traversing snowfields slipped, was unable to self-arrest, and fractured his fibula and ankle after his crampon caught his leg during the fall.

location_name: Mount Hood, South Side, below Mazama Chute, above fumaroles on west side of Hogsback
description: A climber slipped on snow while descending Mount Hood and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in injuries. Rockfall also presented a hazard.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber fell several hundred feet on snow during descent after a winter ascent of Grand Teton and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a significant head injury.
A climber fell while free-soloing an unknown route, resulting in multiple fractures and other injuries requiring hospitalization and surgery.
A climber fell while leading Talkin' 'Bout Mudflaps after a stopper pulled, resulting in a ground fall and multiple injuries.
A climber fell 8-10 meters after protection pulled, hitting a ledge and sustaining injuries including compression fractures and a sprained ankle; the rope was also cut.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness, The Amphitheater, Daddy
description: A climber was likely struck by lightning while belaying on a ledge, causing him to lose consciousness and later rappel to the ground due to concerns about hypothermia.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Muir Snowfield
description: A climber lost control during a voluntary glissade on the Muir Snowfield, resulting in a severely fractured ankle due to improper crampon use.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Emmons/Winthrop Glacier Route
description: A climber descending Mount Rainier via the Emmons Glacier Route with knee pain chose to glissade with crampons, lost control, pulled his partners off their feet, and fell 75-100 feet, sustaining a lower leg injury.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Unicorn Peak
description: A climber lost control while glissading on a steep snowfield on Unicorn Peak, impacting rocks and sustaining a serious leg injury.
A climber died after rappelling off the end of a rope due to miscommunication, wind obscuring the rope, and possible fatigue.
A climber being lowered in Boulder Canyon was dropped 25 feet when the rope ran through the belay device, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber slipped on ice while descending the Kautz Glacier, dislocating his shoulder but was able to self-arrest with an ice tool.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet on Liberty Ridge after a crampon caught, sustaining severe head trauma and later died despite rescue efforts hampered by poor weather.

route_name: Tempest, Octopussy, Never Never Land, Salathé Wall, The Nose
description: Four climbing teams were stranded on El Capitan due to a four-day winter storm; two climbers on The Nose died from hypothermia, while the others were rescued.
Two climbers, Penn and Hancock, became stranded on Liberty Ridge after realizing they were not capable of completing the climb and requested a rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A solo mountaineer died of exposure on Longs Peak after separating from his group in a blizzard and being inadequately clothed and equipped.
Two climbers were benighted and ledged out on Lembert Dome after a technical rock climb, inadequately equipped and dressed, and unable to navigate the descent.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Tenaya Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Tenaya Peak due to limited outdoor climbing experience and requested help; rangers rappelled down and set up a top-rope for them to reach the top.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Fairview Dome
description: Two climbers became exhausted and stranded on Fairview Dome due to snowfall and inadequate gear; one was hospitalized for kidney failure, and the other suffered frostbite.
Two clients, Joanne Devenish experiencing AMS and Rosemary Zimmerman with a lower leg injury, were assisted down to the 14,200-foot medical camp and evacuated.
A climber was caught in an avalanche on Mount Huntington's West Face Couloir and presumed dead after his partner initiated search and rescue efforts.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Columbia Icefields, Mount Athabasca
description: Two climbers triggered a class 2.5 avalanche on Mount Athabasca while descending, resulting in one minor injury and one broken ankle and compression fractures.

location_name: Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Robson, North Face
description: Two climbers died after being caught in a cornice failure and avalanche on the North Face of Mount Robson after disregarding warnings about hazardous conditions.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Rib suffered significant frostbite due to dehydration and exposure, requiring rescue and medical treatment.

location_name: Kluane National Park, Mount Logan, King Trench, Prospectors Col
description: Three climbers were trapped in a storm on Mount Logan at 5,500 meters, resulting in severe frostbite. They were rescued after 48 hours.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mount Edith, South Ridge
description: Two climbers got lost on the South Ridge of Mount Edith due to poor information about the descent route and became stranded above steep terrain, requiring a rescue.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mount Kerkeslin, Kerkeslin Falls
description: A climber fell while leading the third pitch of Kerkeslin Falls, fracturing their lower leg. They were rescued by a warden service team after a second party on the route called for assistance.
A climber leading on ice had a tool placement fail, resulting in a fall and a sprained ankle. The climber was able to rappel and walk out with assistance.
A climber fell 20 feet while ice climbing at Haffner Creek, resulting in a broken ankle; another climber fell four meters but was uninjured.
A climber fell 20 feet while descending from Guinness Gully on Mount Dennis after tripping on low-angle terrain, sustaining multiple fractures and other injuries.
John Hrizo fell about thirty feet while leading the second pitch of Northwest Books on Lembert Dome after getting off route and encountering slippery rock, resulting in broken ankles and cuts.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, Black Canyon of the Gunnison, North Rim wall
description: A 37-year-old climber fell approximately 60 feet while ascending the Escape Artist route and suffered possible pelvic and femur fractures.

location_name: Banff National Park, Devils Gap, Macadamia
description: A 30-year-old climber suffered serious injuries after falling 40 feet while leading Macadamia (5.9) near Devil’s Gap in Banff National Park when a hand-hold broke off.
A father and son fell 400 feet while descending the Bell Cord Couloir; the father died and the son sustained a mild head injury.

location_name: Boulder Canyon, Near Security Risk Crag
description: A 31-year-old male suffered a fatal fall while free soloing to set up a top-rope system, wearing sandals and without a helmet, near Security Risk Crag in Boulder Canyon.
A climber fell 100-150 feet to his death while solo climbing on Half Dome, likely due to loose rock, inadequate protection, and misuse of a Grigri.

location_name: Garden of the Gods, Three Graces
description: A climber fell while climbing the south ridge of the easternmost slab of the Three Graces after a flake broke off when a cam was placed. The climber was not wearing a helmet and fell headfirst.
A climber fell 15-25 feet due to miscommunication and inadequate belay, resulting in broken ribs, a broken ankle, and a slight concussion; a 9.4mm rope shot through the Grigri belay device.
A climber rappelling on Lions Way in the Purcell Mountains died when the anchor failed, resulting in a 60-meter fall to the boulder field below.

location_name: Great Smokey Mountain National Park, Rainbow Falls in the Cherokee Orchard area
description: A climber rappelling from a cliff above Rainbow Falls fell approximately 30 feet after his rope severed, sustaining serious injuries.
A climber was injured on Tuolumne Peak when a large rock dislodged, causing a fall and crushing his finger and injuring his arm.

location_name: Camelback Mountain, Camel’s Head, Gargoyle Wall
description: A climber fell about 25 feet after a handhold broke, resulting in broken legs at the ankles.

A climber fell 60 feet while leading the second pitch of Great Dihedral after climbing off route and having difficulty with gear placements, resulting in a compound tib/fib fracture and other injuries.
A 25-year-old man was fatally injured in Eldorado Canyon State Park while rappelling; he was not wearing a helmet and sustained severe head injuries.
Two climbers, Jerry and Terry Humphrey, died after a fall on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley; they were inadequately equipped and fatigued during their summit attempt.
A climber fell 20-30 feet and sustained injuries when the belayer ran out of rope while lowering and the rope slipped through the belay device.

location_name: Mount Baldy, Near the summit of Mount Baldy to level snow near the Sierra Club’s Baldy Hut
description: A mountaineer glissaded out of control 1,200 vertical feet on Mount Baldy, sustaining fractures of the shoulder blade, ribs, and skull.
A climber was struck in the head by a dead tree dislodged by another climbing party, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber fell 15 meters and broke both legs when a ledge broke beneath him while attempting Belfry on Mount Yamnuska.

location_name: Mount Robson Provincial Park, Mount Resplendent, near the base of the Mousetrap, below the Robson-Resplendent Col
description: A climber glissading with crampons on Mount Resplendent caught a crampon point and suffered a broken fibula.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress developed high altitude cerebral edema (HACE) and high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) and was evacuated to a hospital.
A climber developed high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) after ascending too quickly on Mount McKinley's Cassin Ridge, ignoring acclimatization advice, and required evacuation.
Two ice climbers were rescued from Mount Washington after spending a night out in subzero temperatures and high winds due to inexperience, inadequate equipment, and deteriorating weather conditions.
Shelley Windsor fell approximately 90 feet to the canyon floor after the rappel anchor she constructed came apart when she weighted the rappel.

location_name: Grandfather Mountain Corridor area of the Blue Ridge Parkway, Shiprock, Hindu Kush
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet to the ground while rappelling after a rope bight slid through the super-shut anchors, resulting in a fatal accident.

location_name: Baffin Island, Stewart Valley, Great Sail Peak
description: Drew Wilson died after rappelling off the end of his rope, having forgotten he was on the short end while using a Grigri.

location_name: British Columbia, Mount Robson Provincial Park, Base of Mount Robson
description: An inexperienced climber slipped on snow, fell off a cliff, and died due to inadequate equipment and climbing alone.
Two climbers got stranded on Royal Arches due to route finding difficulties, darkness, and a storm, leading to a rescue.
Two climbers became benighted on the eleventh pitch of a route due to weather, inadequate clothing and equipment, inexperience, and a late start, requiring rescue.

location_name: Purcell Mountains, Bugaboo Spire, Kain Route
description: A climber got his leg stuck in a crack while climbing the Kain Route on Bugaboo Spire and required rescue.
Kevin Smith was rappelling on Capitol Peak when his anchor failed, leaving him stranded. His partner left to get help, and Smith was rescued later that day.
A climber was blown off his feet by a gust of wind while traversing Odell Gully, causing him to fall 400 feet and sustain multiple injuries.

location_name: North Sister, Early Morning Couloir, Northeast Face, Thayer Glacier Headwall
description: Climbers descending the Thayer Glacier Headwall were caught in a point release avalanche that swept two climbers down the slope, resulting in serious injuries; avalanche beacons were carried but not turned on.

A climbing team of seven was descending the Emmons Glacier when one climber tripped on rope slack, pulling two others off their feet. One climber broke his nose and injured his leg, another severely sprained her ankle, and a third became hypothermic.
A novice climber fell 60 feet to her death from the anchors of a bolted sport climb after failing to properly re-thread the rope through the rappel rings.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Lower Exum
description: Leah Samberg fell 35 feet on the Lower Exum Ridge after getting off-route, resulting in a shattered arm and broken hip; a late start contributed to rushing route-finding.
Kate Tinnesand fell over 700 feet on the west side of Three Fingered Jack while descending the south ridge after a climb, sustaining fatal injuries.
Jim Ratz died after rappelling off the end of his rope while rappelling from the Honeycomb route in Sinks Canyon.
Heather Paul fell while down-climbing the East Ridge Route of Cloudveil Dome, resulting in a fatal accident.
A climber fell on the Gibraltar Ledges route on Mount Rainier, was unable to self-arrest on the firm snow, and tumbled approximately 900 feet, resulting in fatal injuries.
Jim Curnutt was hit in the thigh by icefall while ascending the Kautz Glacier Route, sustaining a serious leg injury and requiring rescue.
A climber pulled a large boulder while leading, which fell and struck the belayer, causing her to fall off a ledge; the belay anchor was inadequate to stop the fall.
A climber was hit by rockfall while ascending Fuhrer Finger on Mount Rainier and sustained an open fracture of his tibia and fibula, requiring rescue.
A climber was struck on the head by a rock dislodged by climbers above while ascending the CMC Route on Mount Moran, sustaining head and neck injuries.

location_name: Devil's Tower National Monument, Devils Tower
description: A climber was injured by a rock dislodged by a party climbing above her on Devils Tower while climbing the Pseudo Weissner route.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Ptarmigan Ridge
description: Two climbers attempting Ptarmigan Ridge on Mount Rainier experienced frostbite, deteriorating weather, and route-finding difficulties, leading to a rescue after they ran out of food and fuel.
A climber broke his leg while glissading on the Inter Glacier with crampons, which caught and caused him to tumble.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Sharkfin Tower
description: A six-person team climbing Sharkfin Tower went off-route, experienced rockfall injuring one member, and then during a retreat, a rappel anchor failed, causing four climbers to fall, resulting in three fatalities and one serious injury.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, The Snaz
description: A climber was struck by rockfall on a ledge after a successful climb, causing temporary loss of sensation and a fall that was arrested by a partner.
A rope team fell on the Ingraham Glacier, unable to self-arrest, and slid into a crevasse, resulting in multiple injuries and a rescue operation.

Two climbers died on Mount Rainier's Muir Snowfield after getting lost in worsening weather conditions, likely succumbing to exhaustion and hypothermia due to inadequate clothing and lack of navigation tools.
A group of five climbers summited Mount Ritter and were caught in a storm during their descent, leading them to become disoriented and stranded in technical terrain, requiring rescue.
A climber fell through a snow bridge on Mount Bona and suffocated after becoming wedged in a crevasse.
A climber fell into a crevasse on Byron Glacier after tripping and sliding down an ice ramp while descending unroped, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Tahquitz Rock, South Face of Tahquitz Rock
description: A climber fell to his death while free-soloing on the South Face of Tahquitz Rock; windy conditions may have contributed to the fall.
A climber fell to his death while climbing alone and unroped on the Southeast Ridge of Mount Bonneville.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Five Gallon Buckets
description: A climber fell about ten feet after his instructor warned him that his climbing rope was under his leg, resulting in a head injury.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison, Scenic Journey
description: A climber fell 20 feet while leading the eighth pitch of Scenic Journey, resulting in a broken foot and a long self-rescue.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Low Profile Dome
description: A climber fell after redirecting the rope, resulting in a deformed lower leg with an open fracture. The rope was stuck, creating slack, and the climber admitted to ignoring her instincts before starting the climb.
An experienced climber died after a large rock came loose while he was standing on it unroped, causing him to fall and tumble down the mountain.

route_name: The Scariest Ride in the Park
description: Jimmy Rae Forester fell to his death while free-soloing The Scariest Ride in the Park.
A climber fell approximately 150 feet while climbing a via ferrata at Nelson Rocks Preserve after unhooking a line and mis-stepping, resulting in a fatality.
James Harr died after falling when his partner lost control of the rope while lowering him; the rope slipped through the belay device and there was no knot in the end of the rope.
A beginner climber fell approximately 30 feet while climbing Gunklandia, hitting her head on the wall and sustaining a deep laceration. She was lowered and assisted to park rangers.
Two climbers got off route on Mount Church, one fell to their death while the other got stuck; the accident was caused by inexperience, inadequate equipment, and poor decision-making.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: A climber fell 100 feet on the Red Garden Wall after getting off route, and the belayer had difficulty stopping the fall, resulting in minor injuries.
Barnett slipped and fell about 100 feet while down-climbing slabs, fracturing his ankle. He was facing out and wearing a pack, which may have contributed to the fall.
A climber fell while leading on Cathedral Peak when protection pulled out, resulting in a leg injury and subsequent rescue.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, Salathé Wall
description: A climber fell while leading the first pitch of the Salathé Wall after a hybrid alien placement pulled, resulting in trauma to his ankles, back, and head.

location_name: Big Cottonwood Canyon, Beware of Dog, upper S-curves
description: Paul Sternman suffered a 60-foot ground fall on Beware of Dog when a quickdraw unclipped from the carabiner on the fourth bolt due to its poor placement and resulting gate loading. He sustained injuries and was evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Wonderland of Rocks
description: Two climbers simul-rappelling off "Solid Gold" incorrectly equalized the rope, and one climber fell 30 feet when he reached the end of the rope, resulting in unspecified fractures.
Todd Skinner fell over 500 feet to his death when the belay loop on his worn harness broke while rappelling fixed lines.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon
description: Eva Bell fell 80-100 feet while soloing 4th class terrain near the Open Book route in Garnet Canyon, sustaining injuries and requiring helicopter extraction.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Spider Line
description: Daniel Scott fell twelve feet while climbing Spider Line after an anchor pulled out; he was not wearing a helmet and died.
A climber fell approximately 800 feet on Lamb's Slide after losing his footing while climbing unroped, sustaining a broken leg and shoulder.

location_name: Mount Olympus, Couloir between the two summits
description: A group of climbers descended Mount Olympus unroped and without crampons, missed their intended traverse, and several fell, resulting in three injuries and a rescue.
A climber fell while down-climbing on Casaval Ridge, sliding on snow/ice and sustaining a laceration and suspected concussion; he was assisted to safety by another climbing party.
A 41-year-old man fell on snow/ice while ascending Mount Shasta, was unable to self-arrest, and slid 1,100 feet, fracturing his leg and ankle.

location_name: Mount Hood, South Side, below Pearly Gates, Devil’s Kitchen
description: Two climbers fell on an icy slope on Mount Hood after losing their footing and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in serious injuries.
A telemark skier fell approximately 300 feet on an icy patch while circumnavigating Mount Hood, resulting in multiple fractures and requiring a rescue.
A climber fell while skiing down the Orient Express on Mount McKinley after losing his balance, sustaining a fractured nose and corneal abrasions.

location_name: Grand Tetons, Southwest Couloir of the Middle Teton
description: Ben Morley fell 500 feet while ski-mountaineering near the Southwest Couloir of the Middle Teton after hitting a patch of ice, sustaining hip and leg injuries.
Climbers descending Mount Shasta triggered rockfall, injuring one climber who sustained broken ribs and other injuries; the party was later evacuated by helicopter.
A climber suffered frostbite on Mount McKinley due to inadequate clothing and care of extremities, resulting in the amputation of toe tips.
Two climbers on Mount McKinley suffered frostbite due to inadequate clothing and cold temperatures; one wore gloves instead of over-mitts, and the other wore extra socks restricting blood flow.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: An Exum guide fell about 80 feet when hand-holds broke off while ascending the Direct Jensen Ridge route; he and a client sustained injuries.
A climber developed High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) at 14,200 feet on Mount McKinley and was evacuated due to being a solo climber after his team disbanded.
A climber with a history of cardiac problems experienced a cardiac event two hours from basecamp while attempting to climb the West Rib and Cassin routes of Denali and required evacuation.

Two climbers, Sue Nott and Karen McNeill, disappeared on the Infinite Spur route of Mount Foraker and are presumed to have perished in a snow cave from hypothermia and/or asphyxiation after losing their pack containing critical supplies; weather was a factor.

A climber rappelling from the top of a climb fell 70-100 feet after the rope anchor failed, but was stopped by a tree before falling to the ground. They sustained serious injuries and were evacuated by rescue services.
Ian Seevers Mack died after falling 115 feet while preparing to rappel on China Wall. He was anchored when he fell.

location_name: Table Rock Mountain, The North Ridge
description: A climber died after a rappel setup error where the ropes were not properly connected to the anchor, and the mistake was not caught during checks due to distractions and haste.
A climber rappelled off the end of a rope that was too short, resulting in a 50-foot fall and serious injuries.

Three experienced climbers summited late on Mount Hood via the North Face Gully. Two climbers fell during descent on Cooper Spur, and the third died of hypothermia after waiting in a snow cave. All are presumed dead.
Two climbers got their ropes stuck, were inadequately prepared with clothing, equipment, and food, and became too tired to continue, requiring a SAR rescue.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber experienced acute abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting during descent on Mount McKinley and required evacuation.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: Masamichi Kobayashi experienced vision problems and altitude sickness while descending from the summit of Mount McKinley, requiring a multi-day rescue and eventual helicopter evacuation to Anchorage. He was later released from the hospital.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber with a history of atrial fibrillation experienced symptoms at 17,200 feet and was evacuated due to dangerously low blood pressure, eventually recovering enough to fly out on his own.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount Barrill, Japanese Couloir
description: Two climbers were killed in an avalanche on Mount Barrill's South Face after climbing the Japanese Couloir route; they did not rope up or place protection.
Three climbers triggered an avalanche in Pinnacle Gully after ignoring avalanche warnings and traversing into a dangerous area; they were flushed down the slope but sustained no injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Kahiltna Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse on the Kahiltna Glacier and was unable to self-rescue due to cold and tiredness, requiring a ranger rescue.
A climber caught a crampon on crusty snow while descending Mount Hood, twisting their ankle. They were assisted by guides and transferred to a snowcat.
A climber fell on ice while solo climbing unroped on Mount Hood, suffering a leg fracture and requiring rescue.
An experienced climber fell 170 feet to his death while at the top of an ice route, not tied in and not wearing crampons.
A climber fell to her death while rappelling on Mount Wake after coming off the end of her rope; a knot was not tied at the end of the rope and the rope diameter was undersized for the belay device.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A woman fell approximately 150 feet on Longs Peak after getting off-route and attempting to down-climb, sustaining multiple serious injuries and requiring a litter evacuation.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness Area, Shortoff Mountain, Little Corner
description: A climber fell approximately 15 feet while leading a climb, sustaining back injuries and requiring rescue due to the terrain and lack of appropriate gear for an unplanned overnight stay.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A climber fell about 100 feet, hitting the mountain face repeatedly after a piece of protection pulled out, resulting in multiple injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Roof Routes
description: A climber fell about 20 feet while trying to clip into his first piece of protection, resulting in a fractured leg.

route_name: Regular Route of the Northwest Face
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet while aid climbing on Half Dome after a cam failed, resulting in torn back muscles and fractured vertebrae; haste and being off route were contributing factors.
A climber fell approximately 25 feet after a piece of protection pulled, resulting in a compound fracture of the left foot and other injuries.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, Little Pinnacle
description: During a high-angle rescue training exercise, a participant acting as a victim fell approximately 35 feet due to a rigging system failure and lack of belay, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber took a 15-foot pendulum fall while leading a technical rock climb and was rescued by a joint US and Canadian team.
A climber fell while attempting the crux move on Recollections of Pacifica, pulling out two pieces of gear and striking her back on a rock outcropping, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Bath Rock
description: A climber fell 25-30 feet on Donini's Crack after two cams pulled out, resulting in a compound fracture to his wrist and possible fractures to other body parts.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Buzzard's Perch
description: Adam Baxter fell while leading "Terror of Tiny Town" when his protection pulled out, resulting in injuries including a forehead abrasion and pain in his hip and lumbar spine.
A climber fell while climbing a dihedral crack, pulling protection due to inadequate gear placement and the belayer's poor position.
A climber rappelled off the end of the rope in the dark, without a knot, resulting in a fall and serious injuries.

location_name: Yosemite Valley National Park, Church Bowl
description: A climber fell after the rope ran out while being lowered, due to misjudging the rope length and not tying a knot at the end; the belayer was not anchored and was pulled towards the falling climber.

location_name: Eldorado State Park, The West Ridge
description: A climber fell 15 feet and injured his lower back when the end of the rope slipped through the belayer's device while being lowered.

Meghan fell approximately 25 meters while rappelling Royal Arches due to a series of errors including misjudging rope length, difficulty tying off, and attempting a precarious reach for the anchor, ultimately resulting in a fall.

location_name: Buffalo National River Wilderness Area, Hawksbill Crag
description: A 20-year-old woman fell approximately 30 feet while rappelling off a bluff after striking a tree branch and not having a belay system in place, resulting in fractured vertebrae, pelvis, and femur.
A climber fell approximately 300 feet while descending Mount Hood's Southside route after catching a crampon, resulting in a shoulder dislocation, facial abrasions, and a sore ankle.
A party of eight climbers descended Mount Hood in poor weather, became disoriented, and three climbers fell several hundred feet after the lead climber fell over a cliff; they were later rescued.
A climber fell on snow while descending Avalanche Gulch on Mount Shasta, sliding 700 feet and sustaining injuries including a head laceration, broken ribs, and a broken finger.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: Beckie Covill experienced a short fall while descending the fixed lines on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley, injuring her right knee and requiring assistance from park rangers for evacuation.
A climber fell 400-600 feet down Tuckerman Ravine after losing footing on snow/ice while descending at dark with his ice ax secured to his pack, resulting in a leg injury.
A climber fell near The Heart in Avalanche Gulch and received puncture wounds from their crampons, refusing assistance and descending on their own.
A climber fell approximately 100 feet on Mount Hood's Southside route after losing footing and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in abrasions, puncture wounds, and a twisted ankle.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Diamond
description: A climber rappelling the Dunn-Westbay route dislodged a flake while trying to free a stuck rope, was knocked unconscious, and fell to Green Pillar Ledge, sustaining a broken clavicle and ribs.
A climber was hit in the knee by a dislodged rock while ascending Dunderberg Peak, resulting in a sprain.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber was injured when a large boulder dislodged while pulling on a stuck rope during descent, causing severe trauma to his lower leg.
A climber experienced HACE symptoms below Denali Pass and was short-roped down to lower altitudes for treatment and further descent.
A climber fell over 100 feet after protection pulled out while aid climbing on El Capitan, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Mount Robson National Park, Mount Robson, Kain Face
description: A climber on the Kain Face of Mount Robson wrapped a rope around his leg, stumbled, and pulled his groin. He was evacuated by helicopter the next day.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A client on a guided Mount McKinley climb collapsed and experienced seizures due to a pre-existing illness and dehydration, requiring a medical evacuation.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber suffered snow blindness due to not wearing eye protection and was temporarily blind, requiring assistance and potential evacuation.

location_name: Yosemite Valley National Park, Washington Column
description: Two climbers attempting the Prow on Washington Column retreated and rappelled down an unfamiliar route, leaving their ropes behind and becoming stranded. They were rescued by another climber.
Climbers became benighted on Royal Arches due to a late start and slow progress, leading to exposure and requiring rescue due to an impending storm.
Two climbers were caught in a storm on Cathedral Peak after misjudging the weather and not bringing adequate clothing, leading to hypothermia and a difficult descent.
Two climbers were caught in a small avalanche on the East Ridge of Pfeifferhorn, carried over cliffs, and sustained major injuries, requiring helicopter rescue.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Emmons Glacier
description: A climber fell into a crevasse due to a bridge collapse on the Emmons Glacier, sustaining a dislocated shoulder, and was subsequently rescued by guides and a helicopter.

location_name: Alpine Lakes Wilderness Area, Sherpa Peak
description: A father and son died after falling 100-150 feet down an ice slope and over a cliff while climbing unroped on Sherpa Peak; the father died of hypothermia and the son of head injuries.
A 67-year-old ice climber fell after a tool placement failed, resulting in a foot injury. The climber was fatigued and had poorly racked gear.
A client with International Mountain Guides suffered a shoulder dislocation during a short fall on ice while descending from high camp on the Kautz Glacier route.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: Alison Arnold fell 10-15 feet while down-climbing the CMC route on Mount Moran, striking her face and injuring her ankles; she was wearing hiking shoes and was unroped.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Vladimir Wojnar fell approximately 15 feet while pulling up the rope with the attached Figure-8 during a rappel descent of the Grand Teton, sustaining a head injury and other injuries.

location_name: New River Gorge National Park, Beauty Mountain
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet after multiple protection placements failed, resulting in serious injuries including a broken scapula, broken ribs, and a bruised lung.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet while attempting to traverse from one route to another after removing protection, resulting in numerous fractures and lacerations.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Lower Gorge
description: Jim Anglin fell approximately 100 feet to his death while descending a Fourth Class climbers’ way into the Lower Gorge.
A climber fell 15-20 feet at Hellgate Cliffs when a nut placement pulled out, resulting in injuries requiring SAR and ambulance transport.

Climber fell on the final slab pitch of the Beckey Route on Liberty Bell, injuring their right ankle, possibly due to wearing kletterschuhe instead of boots and not having a spotter; weather also became a factor.

location_name: Reimers Ranch County Park, Dead Cat's Wall
description: A 17-year-old climber fell after clipping into a gear loop instead of the belay loop while cleaning a route, resulting in a ground fall and injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
route_name: Enclosure Couloir or the Black Ice Couloir
description: Two climbers fell to their deaths after their anchor failed, likely due to external forces such as an avalanche or rockfall, exacerbated by warm temperatures.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Owen
description: A climbing party got off route on the North Ridge of the Grand Teton; a climber dislodged a rock, injuring his hand, and the party was benighted before being rescued.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Base of Irene's Arête
description: A climber leading on 5.3 terrain pulled on a hold that broke off, resulting in a 30+ foot fall onto rock ledges. The climber sustained injuries but the camalot held.

location_name: Wind River Range, Leg Lake Cirque
description: A person threw a rock off a ledge, which struck and killed a NOLS instructor below.
A climber descending Mount Adams with crampons fell after a crampon caught his leg, resulting in a broken ankle.

Three climbers became lost on the Muir Snowfield due to poor weather and inadequate equipment; one experienced climber helped the other two survive two nights until the weather cleared and they could descend.

A group of 17 people were practicing crevasse rescue when an avalanche occurred due to failure to test snow stability on a moraine slope above the ice cliff; one person was partially buried and another rode the avalanche down the cliff, but no one was hurt.
Two ice climbers were hit by an avalanche triggered by another party above them; they sustained minor injuries and damaged helmets.

location_name: Mount Washington, Huntington Ravine, Odell Gully
description: A solo climber was caught in an avalanche in Odell Gully on Mount Washington and died as a result.

location_name: Little Bear Peak, West Ridge Hourglass Route
description: Two climbers triggered a large slab avalanche while traversing the south side of the West Ridge of Little Bear Peak, resulting in one fatality and one injury.
A climber suffered frostbite on all ten fingers after removing his gloves for a short time during a summit attempt on Mount McKinley and delayed seeking medical treatment.

Climbers descending from Denali Pass encountered whiteout conditions and windslab, leading to a fall into a bergschrund and frostbite injuries; a rescue was performed and all parties returned to High Camp.
A climber fell 30-40 feet at Buttermilk Falls when his rope was cut on jagged rocks, resulting in broken bones and hospitalization.
A climber misjudged the length of rope needed for a pendulum swing, resulting in a fall and injuries including a fractured rib, contused lungs, fractured wrist, and scalp laceration.
Paul Duval died after rappelling off the end of an un-equalized rope at Moonlight Ridge due to misinterpreting rope markings and not verifying the rope's midpoint.

Two climbers fell to their deaths after a rappel anchor failed due to deteriorated webbing; one climber was clipped to the anchor and the other was clipped to the rope between the rappel device and the anchor.

location_name: Tohickon Valley Park, Tohickon Creek cliffs
description: Joseph McDevitt fell approximately 70 feet while climbing unroped at Tohickon Valley Park and was seriously injured.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, North Chasm View Wall
description: Michael Walsh fell 30-40 feet while leading the fourth pitch of the Stoned Oven route, sustaining a life-threatening head injury and requiring rescue.
Christopher Townsend fell 20 feet after a nut failed, but walked out of the hospital later in the day.

A climber fell approximately 15 feet while leading, having placed no protection, and sustained a hyper-extended ankle and a slight break in their Talus. The climber attributes the fall to being too relaxed and fatigued.

location_name: Sierra Nevada, Palisades Region, The Thumb
description: J.C. dislodged a large rock, was struck, and fell, sustaining lacerations, bruises, and a collapsed lung, but self-rescued with B.Y.
A climber fell after placing inadequate protection on an easier section of the route, resulting in a head injury and requiring assistance from his partner and eventual monitoring by park rangers.
A novice climber fell approximately 150 feet after losing his footing on icy snow, resulting in back and leg injuries.
A climber fell above the first bolt on Drivin and Cryin, breaking his ankle, but was able to walk out with minimal assistance.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet while leading without protection on Grandmother's Challenge, sustaining ankle fractures and lower back pain.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon Open Space, Ripple Wall
description: A climber fell while leading Rethinking the Ethics after hooking fingers into the bolt ring at the anchor, resulting in a head injury and requiring evacuation.

Trevor Mathews fell while climbing, pulling out protection, resulting in head trauma; Claire McKay was injured when the rope pulled taut, causing a fractured cheekbone and broken arm; both were rescued in worsening weather.
A climber fell after a stopper dislodged and the top piece pulled out, resulting in a ground fall and injuries.
A climber fell at least 50 feet on Werk Supp after protection pulled, sustaining serious brain injuries.
A climber fell at the crux of a sport route, his legs caught in the rope, causing him to be thrown upside down and his foot to smash into an overhang, resulting in a fractured talus.

location_name: Mount Washington, Lion's Head Winter Route
description: A mountaineer lost control while glissading on Lion's Head Winter Route and fell approximately 75-100 feet, hitting trees and stopping against a stump.
A climber fell on an icy slope in Huntington Ravine and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in a soft tissue injury.
A climber fell approximately 200 feet while descending the Mazama Chute variation of the Southside Route on Mount Hood and sustained a head injury.
A novice climber fell on snow while descending Mount Hood's Southside Route, unable to self-arrest, and slid approximately 300 feet before being rescued and air-evacuated to a local hospital.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Squid
description: A climber fell while ice climbing, held by an ice screw after falling approximately 35 feet and hitting a ledge, sustaining serious injuries to her pelvis and lower leg.
A climber fell 50 feet while soloing Werk Supp (5.9) in Eldorado Canyon State Park, sustaining serious injuries and later died.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness, Shortoff Mountain, Paradise Alley
description: A climber fell approximately 40 feet after getting off route while climbing Paradise Alley, resulting in serious injuries including a broken collarbone and scapula. The accident occurred due to a combination of factors including being off route, fatigue, and darkness.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell while attempting a climb, resulting in a broken ankle, due to inadequate belay and inexperience of both the climber and belayer.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Wind Tower
description: Lon Abbott fell from the anchors on top of the first pitch of Recon after calling "Off belay!" and not being on belay, resulting in serious injuries; Avery McGill was also injured.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber pulled a large flake loose, which hit him and his belayer, causing injuries and requiring rescue.
A climber was struck by a watermelon-sized rock on Cooper Spur of Mount Hood and fell approximately 1000 feet, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moores Wall, Dolphin Head
description: A climber fractured his ankle after falling multiple times while attempting a climb, complicated by fatigue and exceeding his abilities.
A climber suffered frostbite on his hands and feet due to dehydration and ignoring warning signs while attempting to summit Mount McKinley via the West Buttress.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed atypical HAPE and was evacuated after his condition worsened; possible carbon monoxide poisoning from stove use in tent may have contributed.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet when a stopper failed while rappelling, resulting in serious injuries; he was not wearing a helmet.

route_name: Regular Northwest Face of Half Dome
description: Two climbers summited Half Dome and got lost in the dark and fog during the descent, requiring assistance from park dispatch and a ranger to find the trail.

Two climbers, Tatsuro Yamada and Yuto Inoue, went missing on the Cassin Ridge of Mt. McKinley and were presumed fatal due to inadequate equipment, including sleeping bags and fuel, and subzero temperatures.
A climber fell after a foothold broke, pulling out protection, resulting in a serious leg injury and requiring a technical rescue.
Climber got his knee stuck in an off-width crack while attempting a variation on a route and required rescue.
Janet jumared up a fixed line to escape a bear, but was unable to descend due to snow stretching the rope; SAR team assisted her in rappelling down.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: Two climbers got stranded on Yellow Spur in Eldorado Canyon due to darkness, lack of a headlamp, inadequate clothing, and inexperience, forcing them to spend a miserable night on the mountain.
A climber died near Denali Pass on the West Buttress route of Mount McKinley due to sudden arrhythmic cardiac death.
A climber on Mount McKinley's West Buttress died suddenly near the summit; the cause of death is unknown, but no pre-existing medical conditions or contributing factors were identified.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Eldorado Peak
description: A mountaineer fell approximately 25 feet from a snow-covered rock bluff while approaching Eldorado Peak and sustained serious injuries.
A climber fell approximately 120 feet into a crevasse while en route to Wilson Headwall and was rescued by climbing rangers.
A climber fell 20-25 feet while leading Elmo's Fish due to the belayer improperly using a Grigri device by grabbing it to pay out slack without a hand on the brake.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Inspiration Traverse, Klawatti Glacier
description: A climber fell approximately 35 feet from a ledge into a moat while scrambling with a heavy pack during deteriorating weather on the Inspiration Traverse, resulting in a fatal head injury; her partner was injured later while seeking help.
A climber fell 200 feet to his death after incorrectly attaching ascenders to a static rope, which was then severed by the ascenders during the fall.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton, Lower Exum
description: George Gardner fell to his death while solo climbing the Lower Exum Ridge of the Grand Teton; a sudden wind gust may have contributed to the accident.
A climber fell 50-60 feet due to belayer error while using an Edelrid Eddy belay device at Minimum Crag in Maple Canyon.
A climber fell near the anchor after his protection failed, resulting in a ground fall and significant injuries.
A 20-year-old rock climber fell about 40 feet after protection pulled out, sustaining broken bones and other injuries.
A climber following the first pitch of Moonlight Buttress took a long pendulum swing, struck the rock wall, and sustained a fractured pelvis.
Derek Mamoyac fell while descending Mount Adams after stepping in snow that gave way, resulting in a fractured ankle and dehydration; he was rescued after five days.

A 16-year-old female climber fell approximately 100 meters on snow while descending Teewinot, sustaining hip, ankle, and elbow injuries, as well as abrasions and lacerations. She was unable to self-arrest due to soft snow conditions and was fatigued.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Gilkey Tower
description: A climber fell approximately 600-800 feet on a snowfield while traversing from the South Teton to Cloudveil Dome and was unable to self-arrest, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Avalanche Canyon
description: A hiker fell on a steep snowfield in Avalanche Canyon, sustaining serious injuries after slipping and falling multiple times, and was rescued after being overdue.
Two climbers separated on Mount Rainier summit in a whiteout; one called for help, but both eventually skied down without injury. Helicopter assistance was attempted but proved difficult.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Merry Carney fell approximately 50 feet while rappelling on the Owen Spalding route due to unfamiliarity with the 8.2mm ropes and figure-eight devices, resulting in broken ribs and a tibia-fibula fracture.
Two climbers were stranded on Devil's Tower due to a stuck rappel rope and inclement weather; one climber was able to ascend and free the rope, while the other was lowered due to hypothermia.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Camp Muir, Muir Snowfield
description: Three experienced mountaineers were caught in a blizzard while descending from a day hike to Camp Muir; one died, and two were rescued with hypothermia and frostbite.
A Lithuanian climber with a minor foot injury requested and received an unnecessary helicopter evacuation from Denali's West Buttress, leading to a citation for interfering with agency function.
A climber was swept down a rocky approach by an avalanche while on his way down for supplies, sustaining a fractured wrist and leg, but was rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Rescue Gully
description: A climber triggered an avalanche while skiing down from 17,200-foot camp on Mount McKinley, resulting in a laceration on the head and a knee injury, requiring rescue.

A climber on a solo summit attempt of Mount McKinley went missing after being last seen near the 18,700-foot elevation, and search operations were terminated after several days due to sub-zero temperatures and high winds.
Two climbers became stranded on Condor Crag due to nightfall and were assisted by park staff after calling for help; they were uninjured.

location_name: Canadian Rockies, Waterton National Park, Waterton National Park
description: A climber fell 40-50 feet while ice climbing due to inexperience and poor protection placement, landing upside down but miraculously sustaining no immediate injuries.
A solo ice climber fell in Haffner Creek and sustained injuries to his shoulder and collarbone. A guide assisted him and called for help.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Hidden Valley
description: A lead climber fell while descending, striking his follower and then the ground, resulting in fatal head injuries. The follower sustained back and rib injuries.
A climber fell 20 feet to the talus and sustained back injuries after the belayer failed to anchor or knot the belay rope, and the rope ran through the belay device due to distraction.
A climber fell after a foothold broke off while climbing without protection on a route he mistakenly identified, resulting in serious injuries and hospitalization.
A climber fell approximately 120 feet after failing to place adequate protection while rushing to finish the climb, resulting in injuries including sprained ankle and wrist, cuts, and a hematoma.

location_name: Inyo National Forest, Third Pillar of Dana
route_name: The One That Almost Got Away
description: A climber fell approximately 75 feet while climbing an alternate route on the Third Pillar of Dana, sustaining fatal injuries. He was not wearing a helmet and had placed inadequate protection.
A climber fell after their anchor pulled out, hitting a ledge and sustaining injuries; the fall was held by their partner.
A climber fell approximately 30 feet while aid climbing on the Nose of El Capitan due to a failed aid placement and lack of a self-belay, resulting in serious injuries.
While simul-climbing, slack developed in the rope, causing a climber to fall and fracture his heel after hitting a tree.
A climber fell and her gear sling caught on a cam, strangulating her and stopping the fall without loading the rope.

location_name: Canadian Rockies, Banff National Park, Mount Neptuak
description: A climber fell while negotiating 4th class terrain on Mount Neptuak, resulting in a broken arm and requiring helicopter rescue.

location_name: Kananaskis Country, Grassi Lakes, White Imperialist wall
description: A lead climber fell 20 feet after the belayer was unable to hold the fall, resulting in a tailbone injury and evacuation.

location_name: Banff National Park, Wicked Gravity Wall
description: A climber fell 20-30 feet after leaning back without informing the belayer, who was not holding the rope, resulting in a badly broken ankle.
A climber fell 40 feet on the first pitch of The Nose due to inadequate protection, fracturing her elbow and sustaining abrasions.

A climber fell while ascending the Southeast Buttress of Cathedral Peak, sustaining serious injuries. She was not wearing a helmet and the protection was inadequate. She was short-hauled by helicopter for medical treatment.
A climber fell approximately eight metres after a piton pulled while being lowered, resulting in a compound fracture to the left ankle.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet on the NW side of Eastpost Spire after not placing any protection, resulting in a broken ankle, lacerations, and potential concussion.

location_name: Clear Creek Canyon, Wall of the 90's
description: A climber fell approximately 40 feet after the rope pulled through the belayer's device due to the rope being too short and not having a knot in the end.

location_name: Canadian Rockies, Banff National Park, Mount Temple
description: LR slipped and fell while down-climbing on Mount Temple, seriously breaking his leg, requiring a helicopter rescue.

A climber fell about 60 feet while climbing the “Ham and Eggs” route on the Moose’s Tooth, sustaining tibia/fibula fractures and ankle/metatarsal dislocations. Other climbers organized his rescue and evacuation.

location_name: British Columbia, Canadian Rockies, Castle Glacier
description: A climber lost balance and slid uncontrollably down a snow slope, falling into a bergschrund and sustaining injuries; a rescue was initiated via satellite phone and completed by Jasper National Park specialists.
A climber descending unroped on the West Buttress of Mount McKinley fell and became entangled in another group's rope, resulting in a dislocated shoulder.
Two climbers fell while ascending the West Rib route on Mount McKinley and died from their injuries.

location_name: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks, Mount Whitney
description: A climber on Mount Whitney was struck by a falling rock, causing serious injuries and requiring rescue.
A lead climber pulled off a large rock on Sunshine Crack, which hit the belayer on his lower back, causing injury and difficulty maintaining consciousness during self-evacuation.
Hikers repeatedly activated their SPOT device due to lack of water and perceived dehydration, leading to multiple search and rescue responses and a citation for creating a hazardous condition.
A guided client developed High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) on Mount McKinley and was evacuated by helicopter after failing to descend at the onset of symptoms.
Two climbers attempting the Cassin Ridge requested a rescue due to running out of food and water and having no working stoves; they were resupplied and completed the climb.
Climber fell after a handhold came loose on rotten rock, resulting in a pelvic fracture, maxillary fracture, facial lacerations, and a wrist fracture/dislocation.
Two climbers rappelling Morrow Peak made errors in their rappel setup, including an unlocked carabiner, leading to a near fall. They called 911 and were heli-slung to safety.

location_name: Garden of the Gods, Red Twin Spire
description: A climber fell over 50 feet after incorrectly threading his rope through his rappel device at Red Twin Spire in Garden of the Gods.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to mistaking the rope's midpoint, resulting in a fall and injuries.
A climber leading the second pitch of Necromancer on Mount Yamnuska dislodged a rock that hit their partner, breaking their foot. The injured climber was heli-slung from the base.
A climber was approaching Abbot’s Pass hut when a party above dislodged a large rock, resulting in injuries.
A solo scrambler got stranded on Mount Rundle after climbing into terrain he could not climb up or down, requiring a helicopter rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A party of three inexperienced climbers attempted to solo Organ Pipes late in the day with inadequate gear and food, resulting in one climber becoming stranded and requiring rescue.

location_name: Canadian Rockies, Banff National Park, Mount Rundle
description: Three climbers attempting to traverse Mount Rundle got stuck on a technical section and called for a heli-slung rescue after underestimating the route's difficulty.
A climber became stranded on a small ledge on Marmot Dome and required rescue due to being unable to ascend or descend; he was wearing hiking boots and had taken two short falls.

location_name: British Columbia, Purcell Mountains, International Mountain, International Mountain
description: A guide fell into a crevasse when a snow bridge failed while ski mountaineering with clients. The guide was roped up and was pulled out by the assistant guide.
During an ice climbing competition, a climber was caught in an avalanche triggered by climbers above, and was swept 1,000 feet to his death.
Two climbers were caught in an avalanche on Dodge's Drop in Tuckerman Ravine, Mount Washington, resulting in injuries but no fatalities.
Two climbers were hit by a large avalanche while climbing the Main Vein route; one climber was killed when the avalanche broke a cornice 1,500 feet above them.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Torment-Forbidden Traverse
description: A climber died after a block of ice calved off while transitioning from rock to ice on the Torment-Forbidden Traverse, causing a fall and injuries from falling ice and debris.
Ranger Sam Wick fell into a crevasse on Emmons Flats while descending from a summit climb attempt and sustained injuries to his right hip, ribs, lower back, elbow, and knees.
A mountaineer fell approximately 1,000 feet on icy talus in Central Gully, suffering numerous significant injuries including a femur fracture, due to an inability to self-arrest.
Two inexperienced climbers fell while ice climbing at Cathedral Ledge, resulting in minor injuries.

A climber fell approximately 50 feet after unclipping from the anchor, due to miscommunication about belay status and inadequate belay practices, resulting in a dislocated hip, bruised lung, and mild whiplash.
A climber rappelled off the end of the rope due to distraction and not tying a knot, resulting in a sprained ankle and other minor injuries.
A climber fell from the second pitch while setting up a z-rig to haul a bag, suffering serious injuries but surviving due to the haul bag partially counter-balancing the fall.
A 17-year-old male free-soloing in Boulder Canyon fell approximately 40 feet, sustaining a laceration to his head, shoulder area and pain to his ankle.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: Two climbers attempting Mount Teewinot via the East Face became off route and one fell approximately 300 feet, resulting in death due to injuries sustained during the fall.
A climber was lowered off the end of the rope, falling 12 feet and sustaining minor injuries.
A climber fell after the rope ran through the belay device because the belayer did not tie a knot in the end of the rope, resulting in injuries to the climber's face, head, and knee.
A climber fell 60 feet due to inadequate belay technique and using a rope too skinny for the belay device, resulting in back injury and hand burns.
A climber fell while leading, hitting a ledge and sustaining a compound fracture of the ankle, requiring rescue and hospitalization.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, East Face of Mount Teewinot
description: A climber fell approximately 70 feet on the East Face of Mount Teewinot due to wet rock and inadequate protection, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber fell 35 feet on a run-out 5.10 route, hitting the ground and sustaining a foot fracture, ankle dislocation, and mild head laceration due to inadequate protection and not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Columbia Hill State Park, Horsethief Butte
description: Two climbers fell to their deaths while setting up a top rope anchor due to inadequate protection and human error in anchor construction.

location_name: Pine Creek Canyon, Pine Creek Canyon wall directly below the Zion-Mount Carmel Tunnel
description: A climber fell 20 feet when the rope was too short and slipped through the Grigri during lowering, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Clear Creek Canyon, Clear Creek Canyon
description: A climber with limited trad experience fell while downclimbing after failing to find adequate protection, resulting in an ulna fracture and a metacarpal fracture.

location_name: Big Cottonwood Canyon, Stairs Gulch area
description: A 29-year-old climber fell about 30 feet and broke both ankles when an anchor came out while backing off the route Mr. Sandman.
A climber fell to his death after his rope was severed, likely due to getting caught in a notch and the dynamics of the fall. He had placed inadequate protection and was not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran, Skillet Glacier
description: A woman fell approximately 1,200 feet while ascending the Skillet Glacier but was able to ski out with minor injuries.
A woman fell approximately 1,200 feet in Tuckerman Ravine's Left Gully, unable to self-arrest, resulting in a lower leg fracture, arm, and rib injuries.
A guide lost his footing on a snow slope during the descent of Mount Shuksan, pulling a client from their stance and resulting in a 400-foot fall and an ankle injury.
A climber fell approximately 400 feet on Mount Hood's Southside due to soft snow conditions and not being roped, sustaining serious injuries.
Mr. Wilkinson tripped over his crampon while descending, resulting in a puncture wound to his left knee.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Flattop Mountain
description: A climber fell 50-100 feet on a snow couloir on Flattop Mountain, was unable to self-arrest, sustained serious injuries including a broken pelvis, and was later found hypothermic and disoriented by backcountry skiers who initiated a rescue.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, The Triad
description: A climber fell on a steep snow slope while descending The Triad, unable to self-arrest due to soft snow and balled-up crampons, resulting in a lower leg fracture after impacting a rock.
A climber fell after the webbing anchor failed while being lowered, resulting in serious injuries including broken ribs, punctured lung, and broken vertebrae.
A climber leading Blood on the Rocks fell when multiple pieces of gear pulled, resulting in a ground fall and serious injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, West Ridge
description: Climber fell 20-25 feet when a foot slipped and a flake broke off, pulling protection. The climber sustained scraped elbows, bruised heel, tweaked wrist, and back pain.

location_name: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Great White Icicle
description: A solo ice climber fell approximately 300 feet after a section of ice gave way, resulting in a femur fracture and loss of consciousness.
A climber was struck by falling ice on Mount Hood and fell approximately 400 feet, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Wind River Range, Cirque of the Towers
description: A climber pulled a large rock off while following a 4th-class chimney, resulting in a broken humerus.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Death Canyon, Caveat Emptor
description: A climber leading the second pitch of Caveat Emptor created an anchor using a suspect block, which dislodged, pulling him off the ledge and resulting in a fall; his partner also fell when the anchor failed.

location_name: North Cascades, Pickett Range, Mount Terror
description: A climber fell about 60 feet after a rock came loose while simul-climbing the Stoddard Buttress on Mount Terror, sustaining a head injury, broken heel, and femur.
A climber was struck by a falling rock on the Sandy Glacier Headwall route on Mount Hood and suffered a fractured femur.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to an uneven rope setup, resulting in fractured lumbar vertebrae.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Castle Rock
description: A climber broke a foothold while leading and fell, sustaining a broken leg. She was rescued and transported to a hospital.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber fell after getting off route on White Whale at Lumpy Ridge, injuring her foot and requiring hospitalization.
Climber dislodged a large block while traversing around it, causing a fall of the entire pitch; the rope stopped the fall, and no one was seriously hurt.
A climbing guide slid into a steam vent near the summit of Mount Rainier and fell 15 to 20 feet, sustaining injuries; she was rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot, Northwest Couloir
description: A climber slipped on snow in the Northwest Couloir of Teewinot, was unable to self-arrest, and fell approximately 200 feet, sustaining significant injuries.
Two climbers became stranded on a ledge near Monkey Face due to exhaustion and dehydration, requiring a rescue.
Two climbers were caught in a sizable avalanche while descending the Freezy Nuts gully in Denali National Park. Both climbers died as a result of the incident.
A climber was caught in an avalanche while approaching an ice climb on Baldy Peak and was found buried under snow and debris.

A group of three experienced backcountry skiers triggered an avalanche while skinning up a steep slope on the Canwell Glacier, resulting in one person being fully immersed and carried down about 100 meters with minor injuries.
A rock climber was stung over 1,000 times by bees and stranded, requiring rescue; three others were also stung and hospitalized.
A climber caused a fracture of an ice dam, resulting in a fall when a surge of water and ice pushed her off the ice wall, causing multiple injuries.
A climber dislodged a large rock, which swept a person standing below down a ravine, resulting in paralysis.
A guide was lowered and dropped 40 feet due to the client incorrectly rigging the Reverso belay device, resulting in a broken pelvis and other injuries.
A climber fell approximately 30 meters when an ice pillar fractured while leading The Fang (WI5). He was rescued and transported to Vail Valley Medical Center.
A climber fell 100 feet on the Cassin Ridge after his anchor failed, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Taylor Glacier
description: A climber soloing the Taylor Glacier fell 1,500 feet to his death after slipping on black ice and unconsolidated snow.
A climber fell when the rope ran through the belay device due to the belayer being distracted and the rope not being secured at the end; the climber landed in the dirt and sustained minor injuries.
A climber fell 30 feet due to belay failure (unsecured rope, distraction) and lack of a knot at the end of the rope, resulting in injuries including a scalp laceration and ankle fractures.
A climber fell about 30 feet when a piece of protection pulled, resulting in the loss of the tip of his thumb, which was later reattached after a complex rescue and transport.
A climber misjudged a pendulum swing on The Nose of El Capitan, resulting in a broken femur, cracked ribs, and a broken forearm.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A climber fell while seconding and impaled his forearm on a carabiner; he rappelled and walked out, refusing an ambulance but going to the hospital in a private vehicle.
A solo climber fell approximately 1000 feet on the West Rib of Mount McKinley after his ice ax lost its grip, resulting in shoulder and ankle injuries.
A solo climber fell 40 feet while climbing The Owl (5.7) on Dome Rock, sustaining multiple injuries and hypothermia due to inadequate clothing.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber fell about ten feet past their last gear placement on Stettner's Ledges Route, resulting in foot injuries after rope stretch caused impact with a ledge; self-rescue and external assistance were required.

location_name: Yosemite, Tuolumne Meadows, Cathedral Peak, Eichorn Pinnacle
description: Christina Chan fell approximately 400 to 500 feet while descending the Eichorn Pinnacle on Cathedral Peak and died.
A climber was lowered from a single-pitch route, and the rope melted through the nylon webbing slings of the anchor, causing a 20-foot fall resulting in injuries.

A climber took a 35-foot lead fall on the East Buttress of Middle Cathedral due to inadequate protection, resulting in a concussion, fractured lumbar vertebrae, and other injuries, requiring a helicopter rescue.
Austin Forbes fell approximately 20 feet while lead climbing at the Plotinus Wall, suffering a skull fracture, lung contusion, and left shoulder dislocation. He was not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber dislocated her shoulder while pulling on a hold, a pre-existing condition, and was lowered to the base of the wall after rescuers reduced the shoulder.
A climber took a 15-foot ground fall after protection pulled out while leading "I, Robot" (5.7), resulting in broken ribs and a partially collapsed lung.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Bastille Crack
description: Donald Budlong fell from the Bastille Crack and pulled two pieces of protection, resulting in a broken pelvis and other injuries.
Two experienced climbers were caught in a severe storm and washed off Crestone Needle, falling approximately 500 feet into a mudslide area, resulting in their deaths.
During a traverse between Mount Wilson and El Diente, a rockslide rendered one climber unconscious who later died, and injured two others, one seriously.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: Joe Miller fell to his death after his rope was severed by a sharp edge while climbing the Yellow Spur route on the Redgarden Wall.
A climber fell 120-150 feet after an ascender ripped off the rope due to not tying in short and a possible issue with ascender alignment, resulting in serious injuries but no fatalities.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon
description: A climber fell approximately 140 feet while simul-climbing on Redguard Route in Eldorado Canyon, sustaining serious injuries; the fall was likely due to a slip while simul-climbing.

location_name: Horseshoe Canyon Ranch, Horseshoe Canyon Ranch
description: A climber fell after clipping the third bolt due to excessive slack in the rope, resulting in foot and ankle injuries after hitting a boulder.
A mountaineer fell to his death on Mount McKinley after losing control of his sled and being unable to self-arrest, falling over 1,000 feet into a crevasse.
A climber fell after a block broke off, his protection failed, and he swung into the wall, resulting in a broken femur.
A climber on Mount McKinley experienced HAPE and HACE after a rapid ascent to 14,200 feet and was evacuated.
A climber developed high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) after ascending too quickly on Mount McKinley's West Buttress and required a technical lowering and evacuation.

location_name: Boulder Canyon, recently developed climbing area across from the Bihedral Rock
description: A climber with a pre-existing injury was injured during a top-roped climb and required assistance from the Boulder Fire ladder truck to be rescued.
A climber fell approximately 65 feet on El Capitan after a cam failed, resulting in serious injuries including a head wound and broken ribs.
Andrew Tysinger fell approximately 100 feet while rappelling from Boulderado Crag because the carabiner gate on his harness was not properly closed; he was not wearing a helmet.
A 31-year-old female fell approximately 15 feet while rappelling due to rappelling off the end of the rope, resulting in a lower leg injury and possible back injury.
A climber fell 300-400 feet to the ground while rappelling after the overhand knots slipped through the rappel rings due to a rigging error and lack of a backup knot.

location_name: Indian Peaks, East Ridge between Little Pawnee Peak and Pawnee Peak
description: Glenn Porzak fell 60-70 feet while climbing on the East Ridge between Little Pawnee Peak and Pawnee Peak when a rock gave way, resulting in serious injuries and a technical rescue.
A climber dislodged an 80-pound rock, striking her and her belayer, causing the belayer to lose control and the climber to fall 35 feet, resulting in a broken femur and ankle.
A climber got stranded during a rappel when she swung off route and couldn't ascend the rope due to lack of skills; she reached the ground and called for rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers with no alpine experience attempted Keiner's Route on Longs Peak, became stranded, and required rescue after encountering more difficult climbing than expected.
A climber, Noah Gershon, was stranded on the Second Flatiron after attempting to climb the face without proper equipment and unfamiliarity with the routes; he was rescued uninjured.
Two climbers rappelled off route and became stranded, requiring a technical rescue by Rocky Mountain Rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak, The Diamond
description: A climber became stranded after rappelling off route on The Diamond and missing the correct anchors; she was rescued by park rangers.

A large avalanche on Mount Rainier's Ingraham Direct route involved eleven climbers, resulting in one fatality and three injuries. The avalanche danger was high due to recent storms, but climbers ignored the obvious clues.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, South Teton
description: Wray Landon was caught in an avalanche while skiing near the summit of the South Teton and died.
A climber fell approximately 80 feet due to a tie-in error involving a figure-8 on a bight and a carabiner failure while top-roping; he sustained minor injuries.
A leader fell 20 meters after the belayer pulled the rope, causing serious injuries including multiple broken bones and a pneumothorax.
A climber unclipped from his team's rope during severe weather on Mount Rainier and disappeared; he was not found despite extensive searches.
A climber dislodged a rock while scrambling, fell a short distance, and was struck by a rock, causing bruising and fatigue.
Two climbers fell into a crevasse near Camp Muir due to whiteout conditions and inexperience, but were rescued with minor injuries and hypothermia.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Thatchtop Mountain
description: A climber fell after removing himself from a three-point anchor without ensuring a backup, leaving his partner on a single point of protection; he fell a significant distance and sustained injuries.
A climber leading Brush Bash on ice fell approximately 20-25 feet due to inadequate tool placement and lack of confidence, resulting in a badly sprained ankle.

A party of three simul-climbing on Pinnacle Gully fell when a climber's crampon failed, pulling out protection and causing a fall of approximately 300 feet for one climber and 100 feet for another; they sustained minor injuries.
A climber fell about 20 feet on volcanic blocks and slid 50 feet on a snowfield while free-solo climbing Mount Thielsen, sustaining injuries and requiring rescue.
A climber fell on Arms Control and lacerated his arm on a carabiner, causing a serious injury.
Joe Leineweber fell 20-30 feet while leading a bolted route on French's Dome, fracturing his tibia and fibula after his foot hit a ledge during the fall; cold fingers were a possible factor.
A climber fell approximately 50 feet to the ground after a suspected equipment failure involving Petzl Strings used improperly on a sling at the anchor.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: A climber was lowered off the end of her rope after leading the first pitch and fell approximately 20 feet, sustaining a hip injury.
Climber fell near the last bolt on Reliquary (5.12b) due to inadequate belay and distractions, landing on and killing the belayer's dog.
M. Tucker fell approximately 30-40 feet while climbing Elephant Man (5.13b) and suffered fatal head injuries.
A climber on Ro Shampo (5.12a) smashed their belayer into a boulder after forgetting to unclip the belay end of the rope after cleaning bolt #1.
Dennis Murphy fell more than 100 feet on Upper Washbowl Cliff after losing his footing while preparing to rappel.
A climber fell while clipping the second bolt on Breakfast Burrito, landing on her back and hitting her head, but sustained only minor injuries.
A climber fell after getting off route on a runout section, resulting in a fractured heel bone, cracked rib, and scrapes.
A climber fell after placing inadequate protection on the Great Arch route, resulting in minor injuries including a head impact.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore's Wall
description: A climber fell while leading, dislodging a poorly constructed anchor. The anchor was slung tight enough to prevent the boulder from falling completely, but it prevented movement until help arrived.
A climber fell while leading Frogs Head, pulling multiple pieces of protection, and hit the ground, resulting in a sprained ankle, scraped leg, and wrist injury.
Joshua Robertson died from injuries sustained in a fall on P2 of Mescaline Daydream (5.8) when one or more gear placements failed.
Two climbers with limited to no experience rappelled at Paint Rock with inadequate equipment, resulting in falls and injuries due to a melted prusik and lack of a proper belay/rappel device.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness, Hawksbill Mountain, Fischesser Wall
description: A climber was lowered off the end of the rope while cleaning gear and fell approximately 15-20 feet to the ground, sustaining injuries to her lower back, buttocks, and left hip.
