location_name: Red River Gorge, Midnight Surf Wall
description: A climber fell while leading on Tape Worm when the rope was severed by a worn carabiner on a quickdraw, resulting in head injuries.
A climber fell into the crater of Mount St. Helens after a cornice collapsed beneath him while he was posing for a picture.

A climbing party of four fell on the Emmons glacier, slid approximately 100 feet, and plummeted into a 35-foot-deep crevasse. One climber died from traumatic injuries, and three others sustained injuries.
A hiker fell approximately 50 feet on the Lion Head trail after snow balled up in his crampons, resulting in a lower leg injury.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Paintbrush Divide
description: A climber slid on snow and fell on talus near the summit of Paintbrush Divide, sustaining a tibia-fibula fracture due to inexperience and inability to self-arrest.

route_name: Mazama Chute variation of the Southside route
description: A climber fell about 200 feet on Mount Hood while descending the Mazama Chute variation because he was unable to self-arrest, resulting in abrasions and a knee injury.
Robert Wiebe slipped and fell approximately 700 feet while ski traversing the Coe glacier and died from his injuries.
A climber lounging on a boulder was struck in the head and shoulder by a rock dislodged by a climber above.

location_name: Mount Rainier National Park, Mount Rainier
description: A climber at 13,500 feet on the Emmons Route suffered from high altitude pulmonary edema exacerbated by a chest cold, requiring rescue and airlift.
A climber fell to his death after a free-hanging curtain of ice fractured while he was free-soloing. He suffered head trauma and died soon after the fall.

location_name: Yellowstone National Park, Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
description: Two experienced ice climbers died when the frozen waterfall they were climbing, Silver Cord Cascade, collapsed.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Parking Lot Rock
description: Jeff Everett fell 20-30 meters after being lowered off the end of his rope, impacting ledges and a tree, resulting in multiple injuries including a broken neck.
A climber with no experience free-soloed Beachcomber (5.4) in hiking boots, fell from the Arrowhead Pinnacle, and died.
A climber fell 15 feet after a rock flake broke loose, resulting in a severe leg injury with a splintered tibia.

Guided teams were caught in a severe storm on Mount Rainier's Ingraham Glacier, resulting in hypothermia and frostbite due to a lack of timely weather forecast communication; all were eventually accounted for and safely descended.
A climber slipped while rappelling, struck her head, and was rescued with a pulley system; she sustained a laceration and shoulder injury but no TBI.
A climber injured his back during a rappel on the Third Flatiron due to poor technique and had to be rescued.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness Area, The Amphitheater
description: Two inexperienced climbers got into trouble on a moderate trad route when the leader got stranded and the rope became stuck, requiring a rescue.
Beth Davis fell approximately 20 feet while trying to retrieve a stuck rappel rope, resulting in a broken arm, possible broken shoulder, and internal injuries.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon
description: Jillian Drow fell to her death while descending into the South Fork of Garnet Canyon after summiting the Middle Teton, having separated from her group and strayed off route.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Multiple climbing parties on Grand Teton were struck by lightning during a storm. One climber fell to their death, and several others sustained serious injuries, including burns and internal injuries, requiring rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon Boulder Field
description: A climber slipped on a rock in the Garnet Canyon Boulder Field, trapping his lower leg and causing a possible fracture.
Three solo climbers on Denali Pass suffered from altitude illness and exhaustion, requiring rescue by helicopter.
Two climbers were found deceased after being caught in an avalanche or falling on Mount Frances after new snowfall and a warming event.
Two climbers were top roping when an avalanche swept through the area; the unanchored belayer was swept off their stance but held by a knot, and neither climber was injured.
A climber belaying their partner was struck in the head by a dislodged rock, but was wearing a helmet and sustained minor injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber fell while top-roping after the rope came untied from the harness due to an incomplete tie-in knot, resulting in lumbar back pain and hospitalization.

location_name: Clear Creek Canyon, High Wire Crag
description: A climber fell 70 feet after a miscommunication with the belayer led to the climber being taken off belay while weighting the rope to place a directional quickdraw.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, The Bastille
description: A climber fell after his belayer mistakenly thought he was off belay and let go. The climber landed on his feet and reported low back pain.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to uneven rope lengths and not tying a knot, resulting in a 50-foot fall and serious injuries.

Jody fell after untying from the anchor, assuming she would be lowered, but Karen had taken her off belay due to miscommunication. Jody fell approximately 70 feet, sustaining a skull fracture and subdural hematoma.

A climber fell approximately 35 feet to the ground after the belayer took their brake hand off the rope while moving into a better position to catch the fall, resulting in an ankle injury for the climber and rope burns for the belayer.

location_name: San Juan National Forest, El Diente Peak
description: A solo climber fell 20 feet into a snowfield while descending El Diente Peak after dark, fracturing his leg and requiring rescue.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon NCA, Tunnel Vision
description: A climber rope soloing a 5.9 route retreated and experienced difficulty rappelling, lost control of the rope while adjusting the device, and fell approximately 25 feet, injuring both ankles.
Andy fell while climbing Holiday Road, sustaining a broken ankle after moving left of the bolt line and hitting a ledge; his partner arrested the fall.
A climber fell approximately 170 feet while cleaning gear on Mid-East Crisis due to not backing up his ascenders, resulting in a broken ankle and other injuries.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet due to inadequate protection and complacency, resulting in a broken foot. The climbers then had to rappel and cross a river to reach safety.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon NCA, Pine Creek Canyon, Mescalito Formation
description: A leader fell about 30 feet while attempting to place gear on the third pitch of Dark Shadows, resulting in fractured leg and vertebrae with likely paralysis.

location_name: Buena Vista Crags, Buena Vista Crags, left of Pump Station
description: A climber fell approximately 18 feet while climbing a dihedral, resulting in a fractured talus. The fall was attributed to inadequate protection, loss of communication with the belayer, and underestimating the difficulty of the climb.
A climber fell approximately 75 feet from the top anchors of Rat Stew after failing to thread his rope through the anchor rings while cleaning, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: A climber fell 60-70 feet after a ledge broke beneath his feet while simul-climbing on Longs Peak, resulting in serious injuries including a fractured wrist, broken ribs, and a punctured lung.

location_name: Kings Canyon National Park, Thunderbolt Peak
description: A climber fell over 100 feet after separating from his group and getting off route on Thunderbolt Peak, resulting in serious injuries and eventual amputation.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Sunny Side
description: A climber fell while leading Suppress the Rage due to a distracted belayer and excessive slack, resulting in a broken pelvis and vertebrae.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, Muir Wall
description: A climber fell while leading Pitch 24 after a cam hook popped and subsequent protection failed, resulting in a fractured calcaneus and talus, and a severely sprained ankle.
A climber fell on a trad route when protection pulled out, resulting in a crushed vertebra.
A climber fell 20-30 feet while leading, with protection pulling out, and landed on a ledge, sustaining head injuries due to not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to not tying a knot and not checking the length, resulting in a 30-foot fall and a fractured femur.
A climber was struck by rockfall and fell about 20 feet, sustaining a broken ankle, hand injury, and head lacerations.
A climber fell from near the top of Earl's Revenge due to an unfinished tie-in knot, resulting in a fractured forearm and possible spinal cord injury.
A rope team of four climbers fell 1000-1200 feet on the Autobahn after failing to clip into fixed protection, resulting in two fatalities and two injuries.
Luciano Colombo fell approximately 1,400 feet on the Autobahn after deciding not to rope up with his partners while descending from Denali Pass, resulting in fatal head injuries.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Orient Express couloir
description: A solo climber fell to his death while descending on foot in severe weather conditions on Mount McKinley after ascending towards Denali Pass.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Pig Hill
description: A climber fell and broke his leg while descending. Others suffered minor injuries and frostbite. One climber died from exposure after the group was separated during descent.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mount Meeker
description: A climber fell on an icy snowfield while attempting Mount Meeker, was unable to self-arrest, and sustained injuries after impacting rocks in a boulder field.
A climber pulled a large flake off while leading, causing him to fall 700 feet to the ground; the falling flake severed the rope.
A climber pulled a 20-pound rock loose while preparing to clip into the anchor, which fell and struck the seated belayer, causing minor injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Moose's Tooth, Root Canal Glacier
description: Climbers were hit by an ice avalanche while in their tents on the Root Canal Glacier, resulting in one fatality and two injuries.
A 58-year-old male climber experiencing chest pain and labored breathing on Mount McKinley was evacuated due to a cardiac emergency and deteriorating weather conditions.
A climber fell 90 feet after a cam placement pulled out a chunk of rock, resulting in an ankle fracture. The climber was off route and had inadequate protection.
A climber fell when protection pulled while aid climbing on El Capitan, resulting in the loss of a thumb which was later reattached.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak, junction of Lambslide Couloir and Broadway
description: A solo climber fell 30 feet on steep snow, injuring his shoulder while self-arresting, and was rescued by rangers.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: Two climbers unfamiliar with the descent of The Yellow Spur were stranded after dark due to lack of headlamps and were escorted down by Rocky Mountain Rescue Group.
A climbing party got their rope stuck and called for rescue; a passing climber freed the rope, and rescuers assisted a scared climber to finish the climb.
A climber became stranded while free soloing on the First Flatiron due to icing conditions and going off route, but was rescued without injury.
Two climbers became stranded on Castle Rock after dark while attempting to rappel and were rescued.
Two climbers got stranded on Royal Arches due to a rappel error caused by inexperience, fatigue, and dehydration. They rappelled off route and their ropes came up short, requiring a rescue.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Eldorado Canyon State Park
description: Two climbers were stranded on a rock climb because they did not know how to descend. They were guided down by rescuers.
A solo ice climber triggered an avalanche in Pinnacle Gully and fell approximately 1,150 feet, sustaining significant injuries but was able to call 911.
Climbers were caught in an avalanche while descending a gully near Deer Creek. They were unharmed but noted the avalanche risk and their misjudgment of the terrain.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Meadows of Garnet Canyon
description: Two backcountry skiers died in their tent after being buried by a large avalanche in the Meadows of Garnet Canyon in Grand Teton National Park.

A climber became exhausted and possibly suffered from AMS or HACE, leading to a forced bivy in high winds and drifting snow; he was later left by his partners to seek help and subsequently fell down a steep ice/snow slope and was not found.
A climber fell into a crevasse on Mount Rainier while unroped and unfamiliar with the route, resulting in a fatality after being buried under snow.
A climber fell 100 feet after incorrectly threading an ascender and suffering from dehydration while aid climbing on The Prow at Cathedral Ledge.

location_name: North Sister, below the summit of North Sister
description: Brian C. Jones slipped on a friable volcanic rock slope below the summit of North Sister and fell about 1,000 feet to his death.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Nez Perce
description: Laura Mason fell about 100 feet while glissading on Nez Perce Peak due to loss of control and suffered injuries to her left lower leg.
A climber fell 30-40 feet while being lowered when the rope end fed through the belay device due to no knot being tied and inadequate rope length according to the guidebook.
An experienced climber fell while descending a 3rd/4th class gully due to a loose rock, resulting in a broken tibia and fibula.

location_name: Enchanted Rock State Natural Area, Echo Canyon and Triple Cracks area
description: A climber fell approximately 70 feet after disconnecting from the anchors without verbal confirmation of being on belay, resulting in multiple fractured ribs and other injuries.

location_name: Beacon Rock State Park, Beacon Rock
description: A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to an improperly rigged rappel, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber fell approximately 100 feet to his death due to an anchor failure caused by an unfinished knot in the webbing sling.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: Don Ivie fell while climbing the Owen-Spalding route on the Grand Teton, likely due to a combination of inexperience, poor judgment, and inadequate equipment.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell approximately 45 feet after the rope pulled through the belay device while being lowered, resulting in head and chest injuries.
Christian Steiner fell approximately 50 feet while leading a fifth class route, sustaining a fatal head injury after climbing well above his last protection placement.
Mark Gallagher fell while climbing Recompense, hit a ledge, and suffered a compound fracture of his lower left leg.

location_name: Crowder's Mountain State Park, Red Wall
description: A climber fell approximately eight feet while attempting to clip the third bolt on Opinionated, fracturing his nose and losing consciousness.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Bubba City climbing area
description: A climber fell approximately 10-12 feet while leading, hit his head, and was knocked unconscious; he was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet after being taken off belay prematurely due to miscommunication, but sustained only minor injuries.

location_name: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park, Sunset Rock
description: A climber fell while leading Friday the 13th at Sunset Rock, pulling two pieces of protection, and sustained a dislocated shoulder and shattered foot due to inexperience and exceeding their abilities.
A climber fell while leading on rock, strayed off route, and sustained abrasions and rock burn. He was able to walk with assistance and was helped to his vehicle.

location_name: Shenandoah National Park, Old Rag Mountain
description: Dave Rockwell fell fifty feet after a miscommunication with his belayer led him to believe he was on belay when he was not, resulting in fractures to his left ankle, pelvis, and elbow.

location_name: Looking Glass Rock, Looking Glass Rock, Invisible Airways
description: A climber fell while attempting a solo aid ascent after a cam hook blew while trying to clip a bolt, resulting in a fall onto a ledge and injuries.
A climber fell 25 feet after a stopper pulled out, and was rescued with the help of other climbers due to inadequate clothing and gear.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Fern Creek Party Wall
description: A climber fell about 15 feet when a cam placement failed, hitting the wall and losing consciousness briefly. She was lowered, treated, and released from the hospital.
A climber, Joshua Haddock, died after a rappel error at Rumbling Bald when he failed to ensure both strands of rope were on the ground and did not tie a knot at the end of the rope.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Guides Wall
description: A climber fell after the rope jammed, creating slack, and she failed to ensure the rope was snug before climbing; she sustained injuries and was evacuated.
A climber was knocked off their stance by a sliding sheet of ice on Mount Hood's Southside Route, resulting in a 300-foot fall and injuries.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Near Camp Muir, backside of McClure Rocks
description: A climber lost control while glissading down a steep slope with poor visibility, resulting in a broken ankle and dislocated shoulder.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton, Ellingwood Couloir
description: A ski mountaineer fell approximately 800 feet on steep, icy snow in the Ellingwood Couloir after losing control during his descent and being unable to self-arrest, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber descending the Lion Head Winter Route lost control while glissading, impacted trees, and came to rest wedged between two trees, sustaining injuries.

location_name: Gannet Peak, East face snowcap, near the summit
description: A climber fell on the east face snowcap of Gannet Peak, slid approximately 350 feet, and was found deceased.
A climber slipped and fell approximately 2,000 feet on the East Face route of Teewinot while attempting to ski the face, sustaining severe injuries.

location_name: North Cascades, Forbidden Peak, West Ridge
description: A climber sustained deep lacerations from rockfall triggered by a party above while descending the West Ridge of Forbidden Peak and required evacuation.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Bridge Buttress area
description: Charles G. Fredricks Jr. fell while free solo climbing Angel’s Arete after consuming a fifth of vodka and at least three beers, resulting in multisystem trauma.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber pulled a large loose block off while ascending the fourth-class approach slabs to the Buckingham Ridge on Middle Teton, resulting in a fall and injuries.
A woman fell into a moat and was swept under the snow while glissading down Aasgard Pass, resulting in her death. Another person sustained a shoulder injury from a previous out-of-control glissade.
A climber fell into a crevasse while glissading in poor visibility on Mount Baker and died.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber with little mountaineering experience fell while glissading down the Ellingwood Couloir on Middle Teton, sustaining critical injuries after losing control and tumbling approximately 1,200 feet.

location_name: New River Gorge area, Meadow River
description: A climber fell 8-10 feet and fractured his tibia when a protection bolt pulled out while he was lowering off a sport route.
Climber pulled off a loose block on the West Ridge of Mount Stuart and took a 60-foot fall, sustaining serious injuries.
Climber fell 30-40 feet after rappelling off the end of uneven ropes, resulting in a broken calcaneus and burst vertebra.
A climber was bitten on the finger by a Copperhead snake while climbing at Bird's Nest in Great Falls Park.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon NCA, Black Velvet Canyon
description: Two climbers became stranded when their rope got stuck in a crack, requiring a rescue.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore's Wall
description: A climber with limited experience rappelled to the end of his rope, which was too short, and required rescue.
Climbers triggered an avalanche while climbing a mixed route, resulting in one climber being caught in the slide and sustaining a shattered ankle.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: An assistant guide descending from fixed lines on Mt. McKinley experienced weakness, nausea, and ataxia, suspected as mild HACE, and was treated but required evacuation due to lack of improvement and suspicion of other neurological problems, eventually diagnosed as atypical HACE.
A party of two was climbing Central Gully when the leader was hit by a sluff avalanche, resulting in a fall and a fractured ankle for one climber.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress, 15,400-foot level
description: A four-person rope team triggered an avalanche on Denali's West Buttress and was swept a short distance. Four climbers sustained non-life-threatening injuries and were evacuated.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: A 68-year-old client with a known heart condition failed to inform the guide service and later experienced chest pain and fatigue at 14,200 feet, requiring evacuation. He died a month later from a heart attack.
A guided climbing trip on Mt. Shasta triggered a false alarm due to a SPOT device transmitting an incorrect pre-set message, leading to confusion and a potential SAR response.
A climber fell 60 feet while leading the second pitch of Bridal Veil Falls, breaking his hip and subsequently suffering a fatal cardiac arrest while awaiting rescue.
An inexperienced climber injured his ankle while seconding the First Flatiron and could not move, requiring rescue.
A climber untied after completing a climb, stepped backward at the belay area, and fell over a small cliff.
A climber fell 10-15 feet to the ground while being lowered due to the rope running through the belay device, resulting in a mild concussion and minor pelvic fracture.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, East Ledges Descent
description: A climber fell 30 feet while rappelling on the East Ledges of El Capitan due to a Munter hitch failure, resulting in an ankle injury and helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 35 feet while rappelling due to rappelling off the ends of the rope, resulting in a possible talus fracture and ankle sprain.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, Salathe Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 160 feet while practicing aid climbing and rigging on the Salathe Wall after unintentionally disconnecting from her safety system; she sustained serious but non-life-threatening injuries.
A rappel anchor failed, causing one climber to fall to the base with minor injuries, and another climber to be dragged off his stance, resulting in a concussion and laceration.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: A climber fell while being belayed, resulting in a 90-foot fall due to a compromised belay device; both climbers sustained injuries.
T.J. Brumme fell approximately 30 feet while downclimbing unroped on Cat Slab after a rock broke away, resulting in a concussion, facial lacerations, and a bruised foot.

location_name: Squaw Valley, Big Chief Access Road
description: Eric Johnson fell approximately 40 feet due to his climbing partner's inadequate belay, resulting in broken heels and a vertebra.
A climber fell 15-20 feet after the rope ran through the belay device due to the belayer not tying a knot in the end and lacking basic belay training.
A climber fell 30 feet at the crux move of Tigger (5.10a/b) due to inadequate belay and protection pulling out, resulting in a laceration and possible leg fractures.
A climber fell while attempting to clip the fourth bolt on Big Bad Wolf, resulting in a broken ankle and requiring helicopter rescue.
A woman fell 20 feet while trying to clip into a bolt, landing on a ledge 200 feet up the tower, sustaining rib, spine, and head injuries.

location_name: Prentice Cooper State Forest, Tennessee Wall
description: A leader fell on a cam placed behind a loose block, dislodging the block which fell and crushed the belayer, causing serious injuries.

location_name: Red Rock, Pine Creek Canyon, Cat in the Hat
description: A woman fell about 20 feet while being lowered on the first pitch of Cat in the Hat, sustaining a head injury. High winds were a contributing factor, and the couple was inexperienced.

A climber descending the gully behind Sentinel Rock after climbing the Steck-Salathé route dislodged a loose slab, which hit him and caused a tumbling fall resulting in a fractured lumbar spine and pneumothorax.
Treff Owen Carpenter fell 70 feet to his death while setting up a top-rope climb on the Boulderado crag.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, West Face
description: A climber leading pitch 16 of the West Face took a wrong crack, attempted a traverse, fell 25-30 feet, and dislocated his ankle.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: Adam Kimmerly fell while attempting a variation on the Grand Giraffe route due to inadequate protection, resulting in multiple leg fractures and other injuries.
Mike Drake fell 25 feet on the Nose after his top aid piece failed, striking ledges and sustaining serious injuries. He had back-cleaned a piece of protection, contributing to the length of the fall.
A woman fell approximately 100 feet while rappelling after becoming unclipped from a temporary anchor, resulting in serious leg injuries.
A climber fell 40 feet after the leader untied from the rope to find anchors and the second started climbing without a belay due to a lack of communication.
Two climbers simul-rappelling fell when one went off the end of the rope. One fell 10 feet with minor injuries, the other fell 40 feet and sustained more serious injuries.

location_name: Mt. Hood, South Side Ride, White River Glacier
description: A solo climber fell on the White River Glacier on Mt. Hood, suffering a fatal head injury; his ice axe and helmet were stowed in his pack.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Rib, Orient Express Couloir
description: A ski mountaineer fell while descending the Orient Express Couloir on Mt. McKinley, sliding over a rock band and into a crevasse, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. Mckinley, West Buttress
description: A climber fell to his death after detaching from a fixed line and attempting to stop his pack from rolling down a slope.
A man lost control while glissading down Avalanche Gulch due to firm snow and lack of crampons, sliding 1,500 feet and sustaining abrasions and cuts.
A highly experienced climber fell approximately 1,000 feet while soloing a South Side route variation on Mt. Hood and died from massive head trauma; icefall may have contributed to the fall.
A climber fell 300 feet on Mt. Hood due to inadequate equipment and inexperience, resulting in a concussion and hip/leg injuries.
A climber fell approximately 500 feet on the South Side Route of Mt. Hood after slipping while preparing to put on crampons and failing to self-arrest.
Meg Coker fell on snow while ascending the South Side Route, unable to self-arrest, and slid about 200 feet, sustaining multiple rib fractures and a collapsed lung.
A climber was injured when they pulled off a large piece of rock while bouldering and became pinned underneath it.
A female ice climber fell while rappelling, swinging into an ice formation and sustaining blunt-force trauma to her hip and lower back.
Two climbers attempting to rappel El Capitan got off route, cut a rope, and one climber was unable to reascend the rope, requiring rescue.

location_name: Mt. Adams, Spur Trail, Hincks Trail, King Ravine Trail, Lowes Path
description: A climber slipped on ice while descending Mt. Adams after removing crampons, resulting in a fractured fibula and a self-rescue.
A climber rope-soloing at Cookie Cliff became stranded after releasing the rope from his Mini Traxion without securing it, leaving it out of reach. He was rescued by park rangers after several hours.
Two climbers from Ohio got lost on the Epinephrine route in Black Velvet Canyon, ran out of water, and called for help after dark; they were rescued by helicopter and technical rescue team.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Middle Cathedral Rock Descent Gully
description: Climbers were caught in a thunderstorm with falling rocks during descent, leading to hypothermia and a difficult rappel, but they made it to their car.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: A five-member expedition triggered an avalanche on the West Buttress of Denali, and all five members were swept into a crevasse. Four members were missing and presumed dead, while one member survived.
A novice climber fell 200 feet while climbing unroped on an ice-covered slide on Nippletop Mountain, sustaining serious injuries.

location_name: Shenandoah National Park, Old Rag Mountain, Skyline Wall
description: Art Webb fell while climbing Piton Crack, striking a rock and breaking his leg.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Cory, Bumpers Buttress
description: A climber fell while leading the third pitch of Short Jerky Movements after a camming unit pulled out, resulting in a 35-meter fall and significant injuries.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Two-Pitch Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 40 feet after losing balance and pulling protection while clipping, resulting in severe head trauma and a shoulder injury.
A climber fell when a hold broke off while traversing, resulting in a minor ankle injury.

location_name: San Jacinto Wilderness, Idyllwild, Suicide Rock
description: A counselor fell 30 feet while demonstrating rappelling techniques after tripping over a fixed line, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber fell while attempting to clip the first bolt on a sport route, resulting in a fractured tibia and fibula.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Boneyard Wall
description: A woman fell approximately 20 feet while leading Tanduay Time, hitting a ledge and injuring her lower back due to excessive slack in the rope.
A 44-year-old man died of a massive coronary event while lead climbing in Muir Valley after running out of blood pressure medication and climbing in hot weather.

A climber fell to his death on the park side of Sawtooth Ridge after signing the Matterhorn summit register. The cause of the accident is unknown, but he may have been downclimbing to save rappel gear.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, Foreign Trade Zone/Bat Out of Hell area
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet and died; the cause is undetermined, but he was known to climb alone and be casual near cliff edges.
A climber fell after getting off route on Bunky's Rest Day, sustaining fractures in both feet and a back injury.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Breadloaves
description: A climber fell approximately 20 feet while downclimbing unroped after requesting to be taken off belay, resulting in a fractured spine, concussion, broken ribs, and fractured ankle.
A climber fell while self-belaying on Hominey at Vittles Wall due to a malfunctioning Petzl Basic device and failure to use backup knots, resulting in a broken tibial plateau and hospitalization.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Intersection Rock
description: A climber leading Left Ski Track (5.11a) at Intersection Rock in Joshua Tree took a ground fall when a cam placement failed, resulting in soft-tissue and cartilage damage.
Bill McAfee fell while climbing Good Samaritans due to inadequate protection and being run-out, resulting in fatal head trauma.

location_name: Camden Hills State Park, Mt. Megunticook, Maiden Cliff
description: Maria Millard fell approximately 65 feet while preparing to rappel from the top of a climb, after stating she was off belay.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, The Cyclops
description: A climber fell while leading Leader's Fright (5.8) after the top two pieces of protection popped, resulting in injuries but no fatalities.
Derek Kelley fell more than 600 feet to his death on North Maroon Peak after a boulder came loose.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Sunnyside Wall
description: A man fell from a belay ledge at the Sunnyside Wall in Muir Valley, sustaining a back injury after impacting the ground 15 feet below because he was not attached to the belay anchors.
A climber fell while leading a sport route after getting off-route and failing to secure a clipping hold, resulting in a lower back injury.
A climber fell eight feet due to inadequate protection, landing on a ledge and sustaining ankle fractures, requiring a rescue.
A climber fell when a cam placed in a pin scar pulled out, resulting in a minor hand burn from grabbing the rope; an old piton below held the fall.
Lyle Dale Hurd III died after falling over 40 feet while leading the fifth pitch of the Northeast Buttress on Angels Landing after his top piece of protection pulled out.
A climber fell 20 feet after protection pulled while leading Armbuster, resulting in a head laceration, concussion, and fractured foot.

location_name: No Man's Canyon, North Fork of No Man’s Canyon
description: A climber fell to his death during a rappel in No Man's Canyon due to uneven rope lengths caused by a misplaced tape marker on the rope.
A climber fell approximately 30 feet due to an unfinished figure eight knot because he was distracted while tying in.
A climber fell to the ground after a miscommunication with the belayer who added slack during the fall, exacerbated by the climber's exhaustion while attempting to fix a jammed rope.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Division Peak near the Lyell Icefields
description: A climber on Division Peak was hit by rockfall and sustained a compound fracture, requiring rescue.
While climbing the Directissima Route on Yamnuska, the leader pulled off a large block, hitting the belayer who sustained a laceration and a concussion.
A climber fell 20 feet and died after the anchor system failed while being lowered; the climber was not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Waterton Lakes National Park, Mt. Crandell, Tick Ridge
description: A scrambler dislocated his shoulder while climbing on Tick Ridge on Mt. Crandell and required rescue.
A climber fell 15-20 meters while off route on Yamnuska, sustaining a fracture; the fall was held by gear, and the climber was rescued.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mt. Temple, East Ridge
description: A lead climber fell approximately three to five meters on the East Ridge of Mt. Temple and broke his right ankle.

location_name: Alberta, Ha Ling Peak (Chinaman's Peak), Northeast Ridge
description: A leader fell 10 meters while climbing off route on Ha Ling Peak, pulling a cam and sustaining abrasions, lacerations, and a fracture.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore's Wall, Sentinel Buttress
description: A climber died after rappelling off Sentinel Buttress when the rope was improperly threaded through the rappel device and had no knot on the end, causing him to fall approximately 200 feet.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Castle Mountain
description: A climber rappelled off the ends of his rope while descending Castle Mountain, falling approximately 40 meters and dying on impact.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mt. Temple, Aemmer Couloir
description: A skier tumbled down the Aemmer Couloir on Mt. Temple after falling on his second turn, but sustained only minor injuries.
A climber slipped on a ledge while traversing the Direct East Ridge of Mt. Bancroft, causing a fall where a nut placement pulled. The climber sustained serious injuries and was rescued by helicopter.

location_name: British Columbia, Vancouver Island, Strathcona Park, Rambler Peak, El Piveto Mountain, and Wolf-Cervus Divide
description: JY slipped on snow while descending from Rambler Peak, fell 30-40 feet onto a rock bluff, and then fell another 30-40 feet, sustaining serious injuries including broken ribs and a punctured lung.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Lefroy
description: A climber slipped on ice while descending Mt. Lefroy without crampons, tumbling 100 meters and sustaining knee and heel injuries.

Two climbers descending Mt. Lefroy fell after one climber's crampon came off, triggering a small avalanche; one climber sustained a severe head injury and was unconscious, while the other had a minor knee injury.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Victoria, East Face
description: A climber fell and slid down the northeast face of Mt. Victoria, self-arrested, and was rescued due to inexperience and poor conditions.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Whyte
description: A climber became stranded on Mt. Whyte after failing to recognize the correct descent gully, becoming dehydrated and exhausted, requiring a helicopter rescue.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Bell
description: Two climbers on Mt. Bell's Northeast Ridge requested rescue due to slow progress and one climber's fear of the terrain; they were safely evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Tunnel Mountain
description: Two inexperienced climbers started late on a route they misidentified, got stranded in the dark, and were rescued by park specialists after being found on a different route.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Endless Wall
description: A climber fell while leading Totally-Clipse on Endless Wall, injuring her ankle, but her gear held and she was lowered to the ground and eventually rescued.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: A guided expedition was caught in a sudden storm near the summit of Denali, resulting in all seven members sustaining varying degrees of frostbite during the descent.

location_name: British Columbia, Mt. Robson Provincial Park, Mt. Geikie, south face, Rampart Mountains, Tonquin Valley
description: A lead climber fell 20 meters when a large block released, resulting in fatal injuries to the leader and injuries to two other climbers due to rockfall.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Dragon's Tail Spire
description: Two climbers triggered a wind-slab avalanche while ascending Enter the Dragon, and later one climber was caught in a naturally triggered avalanche while rappelling, sustaining minor injuries.

location_name: Mt. Washington, Huntington Ravine, Central Gully
description: A party of 12 ascending Central Gully triggered a soft slab avalanche that swept over other rope teams, carrying one team to the bottom of the gully and causing injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Ypsilon Mountain
description: Two climbers were caught in an avalanche while descending Ypsilon Mountain; one climber died from hypothermia and the other sustained serious injuries.
Seargent Ruiz injured his knee and fell into a crevasse after attempting to jump over it during a training exercise on Mt. Shasta.
A climber fell approximately 15 meters into a hidden crevasse while traveling unroped on a glacier, sustaining a fractured cheekbone.

location_name: Idyllwild, Tahquitz Rock, The Bat Crack
description: Lucas Dunn fell 300 feet to his death while rappelling from the top of the Bat Crack after encountering rockfall.
Scott Clark fell approximately 30 feet while climbing with friends and was transported to Boulder Community Hospital with minor injuries.
Two climbers fell after getting off route on Half Dome; the leader pulled a cam and both fell to the ground, sustaining injuries due to inadequate protection and lack of a belay anchor.
A climber fell while attempting to clip the first bolt, resulting in a fractured ankle.

A climber fell approximately 60 feet after his belayer, who he met online, improperly used a Grigri and lost control of the lower, paying out slack by pulling the lever while letting go of the brake hand.
A boulderer fell 10 feet onto a crash pad after intentionally letting go of the route, resulting in a badly broken ankle, possibly due to a rock under the pad.

location_name: Staunton State Park, Elk Creek Spires
description: A climber fell while leading an unnamed route when their camming device pulled out, resulting in loss of consciousness and a fractured arm.

location_name: Red River Gorge, The Flank Wall
description: A climber fell on Mercy the Huff when the bolt-side carabiner on the draw broke due to improper loading, but was not injured.
A mountaineer fell to his death while downclimbing Thunder Pyramid unroped; he was scouting a waterfall for a future ice climb.
A climber descended the north face of Capitol Peak instead of the standard route, without informing his partners, and fell to his death.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Christian Mason took a roped fall after being hit by falling rock while simul-climbing in the North Chimney, sustaining multiple injuries.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, Painted Wall, Serpent Point
description: A climber fell to his death while free soloing, likely after getting off route on the Southern Arête in the Black Canyon.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Leaning Tower, West Face
description: A climber fell 50 feet while soloing the West Face of Leaning Tower after a cam pulled, resulting in lumbar bruising.

location_name: Clear Creek Canyon, Canal Zone crag
description: A climber fell to his death while cleaning the anchor to rappel, apparently unroped, at the top of the route.
A lead climber fell 30 feet due to an inexperienced belayer's improper use of a Grigri, resulting in lacerations and a concussion; the climber was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell 25 feet while climbing Way of the Peaceful Warrior after a nut pulled out, resulting in a compression fracture.
Two climbers fell approximately 70 feet after the leader pulled a piece of protection and the unanchored belayer off a ledge, resulting in both tumbling into Boulder Creek.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge
description: A climber fell 30 feet while leading on Batman Pinnacle, some gear pulled out, and the belayer was pulled off the ledge; the climber died.
A woman fell 30-40 feet after a cam pulled while climbing, resulting in a broken neck and fractured skull. She was not wearing a helmet and was somewhat run-out.
A climber fell approximately 100 feet while rappelling on Mt. Emerson after a single nut/cam anchor failed, resulting in serious injuries.
A team of five Polish climbers fell while descending above Denali Pass, with two climbers sustaining injuries and requiring assistance to descend.
A climber fell while negotiating the bergschrund at the base of the fixed lines at 15,400 feet, resulting in distal radius and ulna fractures.
A climber was pulled off her feet by her rope team while descending, resulting in a knee injury and subsequent helicopter evacuation.
A guide was struck by a large ice boulder in the lower leg and knocked off his feet, resulting in a potential broken leg/ankle.
A climber was struck by a dislodged rock while gearing up at the base of a climb, resulting in a concussion.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, El Capitan, East Buttress
description: A climber dislodged a rock while leading, which struck and killed the belayer below.
A climber on Mt. McKinley experienced severe high-altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE), became unconscious, and was evacuated by helicopter after initial treatment by team members proved insufficient.
A mountaineer developed severe high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) at 13,200 feet and required rescue after descending to Elinore Lake.
Peter fell 20 feet on pitch six of the Regular Northwest Face after a piece of protection pulled, resulting in a sprained ankle. He and Alain rappelled to the base and were later assisted by SAR.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, El Capitan, Muir Wall
description: A climber fell while leading pitch 27 of the Muir Wall on El Capitan when a large block pulled out after he weighted a cam placed behind it, severing the rope and resulting in a fatal fall.
Climber fell while rappelling after the rappel anchor, a peanut-shaped boulder, failed, resulting in a broken clavicle.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Royal Arches, North Dome Gully
description: Two climbers finished Royal Arches late, became dehydrated and fatigued, and got lost on the North Dome Gully descent, requiring a SAR team to assist them.
A climber lost control while glissading on the Avalanche Gulch route and injured his shoulder.
A climber lost control during a glissade on Mt. Shasta, resulting in abrasions and rib pain; he became lost after separating from his partner but was rescued.
A climber rope-soloing on a route found that the rope was stuck, not fixed, and could have resulted in a free-solo of a difficult section if he had continued climbing.
A solo climber's leg punched through the snow into a hole, and the weight of his heavy pack caused a leg injury, preventing him from walking or descending.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope due to lack of knots and communication, resulting in a 60-foot fall and serious injuries.

location_name: San Juan Mountains, El Diente Peak
description: A climber was struck by a small rock and his partner had to jump off a cliff to avoid a rockfall on the El Diente–Wilson traverse.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: Three climbers became stranded on the fifth pitch of Yellow Spur due to darkness and rain, lacking headlamps. They were assisted to the ground with no injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Redgarden Wall
description: Two climbers became separated after dark; one was able to descend and summon help for the other, who was guided down uninjured.
Three climbers became stranded on the Third Flatiron after their rope got stuck during a rappel in deteriorating weather conditions and darkness, requiring rescue.
Three climbers got stranded on the first pitch of Fandango on the First Flatiron due to an intense storm, but were rescued without injury.
Climbers Ted and Stephanie got their rope stuck while rappelling Royal Arches after forgetting to untie a knot, and had to call for rescue after being unable to ascend the rope.

location_name: Mt. Washington, Huntington Ravine, Pinnacle Gully
description: A climber triggered a slab avalanche in Pinnacle Gully and died from internal injuries sustained in the fall.
Climber triggered a small avalanche while ascending Liberty Ridge, resulting in a fall and a broken ankle; a second climber was also pulled down the slope and injured before the fall was arrested.
A climber fell approximately 30 feet into a crevasse after a snow bridge collapsed while traversing the Whitewater Glacier unroped; he was rescued with injuries and hypothermia.
An older climber fell while solo ice climbing unroped on the first pitch of Standard Center, sustaining serious injuries.
A climber fell while traversing on Beckey's Wall after being unable to find adequate protection, resulting in a shattered talus bone and fractured calcaneus.

location_name: Sandstone ice cliff, Sandstone ice cliff
description: A climber rappelling to clean a route fell 30 feet when the rope was severed on a sharp edge, resulting in two stable fractures.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mt. Owen, Crescent Arête
description: A climber fell about 15 feet when a large handhold broke free while lead-climbing on the Crescent Arête of Mt. Owen, sustaining injuries to his left knee and right ankle.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet after a carabiner unclipped from a bolt, resulting in a broken hand and rope burn.

location_name: Sandia Mountains, Tridents, Upper La Cueva Canyon
description: A mountaineer fell to his death after likely dislodging unstable rock in the Sandia Mountains.

location_name: Humphrey's Ledge, Tree Keys, Geriatric Walls
description: A climber fell after the second bolt on Tree Keys, likely due to a loose rock. The belayer lost control of the rope due to rockfall and received rope burns, but attempted to cushion the leader's fall.
Michael Parker fell 30-40 feet from Practice Rock after failing to secure his anchor, resulting in a broken ankle, broken lumbar vertebrae, and a head injury.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Fern Buttress, Star Trek Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet due to a lowering error when the belayer's autoblock device inverted, causing a virtual free fall to the base of the climb.
Stephen Robinson fell while climbing off-route near Orangeaid after his top three pieces of gear pulled, resulting in a 40-foot fall and a broken wrist.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moores Wall
description: A climber fell after gear pulled out while attempting to retreat on Stab in the Dark, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber fell while leading Nutcracker, pulling protection and hitting his head before falling to the ground. He was not wearing a helmet and was rescued by Mountain Rescue Service.

location_name: Chickamauga & Chattanooga National Military Park, Sunset Rock, Celebrity Flake area on Lookout Mountain
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet after a nut pulled out and the rope detached from the carabiner, resulting in a head injury and hospitalization.
A climber fell while leading Old Town after a camming unit failed, resulting in head and spine injuries due to not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Wherever I May Roam
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet while rappelling on Wherever I May Roam and sustained fractures to her skull and right elbow, a concussion, and a spinal fluid leak.
A climber fell while rappelling Child's Play when the unknotted short end of the rope ran through his rappel device, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber jumped over a crevasse at 11,300 feet on the Emmons/Winthrop route and sustained a possible tibia-fibula fracture.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton
description: A climber descending the Grand Teton on snow fell after a footstep collapsed, resulting in a severe ankle sprain requiring surgical repair. Distraction while guiding and transitioning between sun and shade affected snow may have contributed.

location_name: Mt. Rainier, Emmons/Winthrop Glaciers route, Alpine Meadow on the Winthrop Glacier
description: A ski mountaineering team member fell while skiing on the descent from Mt. Rainier, sustaining multiple traumatic injuries and requiring rescue.

location_name: Mt. Hood, West Side, Sandy Glacier
description: A climber fell on Mt. Hood after getting off route and was found deceased after a long fall, possibly triggered by a slip or rockfall.
A novice climber fell approximately 1,000 feet on the north face of Mt. Hood after attempting a solo summit climb via the Cooper Spur route.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Forbidden Peak
description: A climber descending Forbidden Peak via the west ridge was struck by a falling rock and fell approximately 300 feet, resulting in a fatal accident.
A climber experienced snow blindness due to not wearing sunglasses during a hike to Camp Muir and required assistance to descend.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Mt. Goode, Southwest Couloir
description: A climber fell when the rappel anchor failed while descending Mt. Goode, resulting in an open elbow and arm fracture.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Hanging Canyon
description: Loren Hall injured his leg while sit-glissading on a snowfield above Lake of the Crags after a successful climb; his leg became stuck between snow and a rock.
Ronald Czajkowski fell 120 feet to his death at Thatcher Park due to a rappel error, likely caused by an improperly tied knot and inadequate protection, while climbing alone with little experience.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon, South Fork of Garnet Canyon, near Nez Perce Peak
description: A climber was seriously injured in a large rockslide in Garnet Canyon while attempting to reach the summit of Middle Teton. He was buried by rocks and dirt but rescued by his companions and others.

A 19-year-old client guiding with RMI experienced seizures at the top of Disappointment Cleaver, likely due to HACE and a pre-existing brain tumor condition, requiring short-haul and air ambulance transport.
A climber got his knee stuck in a crack while climbing Easy Jam and required rescue.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mt. Edith Cavell, East Ridge
description: Two climbers attempting the east ridge of Mt. Edith Cavell called for assistance due to worsening weather and slow progress, and were extracted by heli-sling.

location_name: Red Rock, Pine Creek Canyon, Cat In The Hat
description: A college couple got off route while climbing Cat in the Hat, became stranded due to their rope not reaching the ground during a rappel, and were rescued by other climbers.

location_name: Lake George, Rogers Rock, Little Finger
description: Climbers rappelling Little Finger route got their rope stuck and were unable to retrieve it, requiring rescue by park rangers.
Climbers were stranded on Mt. Eaton for eight days due to severe weather, relying on minimal rations and melting snow for water before being rescued by helicopter.
Two climbers on Liberty Ridge were benighted due to deteriorating weather and exceeding their abilities, requiring advice from a ranger and a delayed descent.
A party of five climbers was caught in high winds and low visibility while descending Mt. Rainier and sheltered in place, requiring rescue.
A skier triggered a size 2.5 slab avalanche on a southwest slope below Sifton Col and was buried under debris, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Wapta Icefields, Daly Glacier
description: A ski touring party of three was traversing the Wapta Icefields when one member fell into a crevasse and died. The other two members bivouacked and were rescued after activating their SPOT device.

location_name: Banff National Park, Tunnel Mountain, Gooseberry
description: A lead climber on Gooseberry dislodged a loose handhold, fell approximately 10 meters, and sustained injuries, requiring rescue.
A climber fell while rappelling after failing to tie stopper knots or use a backup, resulting in a fracture.

location_name: Jasper National Park, Mt. Redoubt, Northwest Ridge
description: An experienced solo climber died in a rappelling accident on Mt. Redoubt. The cause is unknown, but possible factors include anchor failure, equipment failure, or weather.
A climber rappelling alone fell about 15 meters when a locking carabiner on the ground anchor became detached, resulting in multiple injuries.
A party of three became stranded on Uto Peak due to inadequate equipment, inexperience, and deteriorating weather conditions, requiring a rescue.

location_name: Laurel Mountain, East Face, Mendenhall Couloir
description: A climber was caught in a wet-snow avalanche while climbing the Mendenhall Couloir on Laurel Mountain and slid approximately 1,000 feet, sustaining minor injuries.
Two climbers experienced vision impairment due to cold and high winds damaging their corneas while climbing Mt. Baker; they were guided back to camp and eventually recovered.
A climber fell while top-roping Gorilla (5.10) after her foot slipped, resulting in a hairline fracture of her radius.
A solo climber fell approximately 500 feet while attempting to link traverses in the Palisades region and sustained fatal injuries.
Christopher Spencer died after falling about 80 feet while scrambling unroped on the approach to Iron Messiah in Zion National Park.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Zebra Zion
description: A climber fell 30 feet after placing inadequate protection on a 5.10a route, resulting in a sprained ankle, minor concussion, and minor injuries.

location_name: Tuolumne Meadows, Lembert Dome, Northwest Books
description: A climber with limited trad experience fell 40 feet while attempting a 5.9 variation instead of the intended 5.6 pitch, sustaining injuries including a possible concussion, back pain, and a broken tailbone.

location_name: Roosevelt National Forest, Dream Canyon, Oceanic Wall
description: A climber fell while attempting a 5.11d route, swinging into the wall and shattering their patella due to inadequate belaying and miscommunication with the belayer.
A climber fell approximately 70 feet after his belay device allegedly failed, resulting in multiple broken bones.
A climber fell 40-50 feet on the route Ain't So Eazy after a cam placement failed, resulting in serious injuries including a fractured skull and vertebrae.
A climber fell near the top of the fifth pitch of Beast after not placing protection, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber broke her leg after taking a large, swinging top-rope fall from a sport climb due to inadequate protection and a top-roping error.
A climber took a large pendulum fall while attempting the King Swing on The Nose route, colliding with Boot Flake and sustaining injuries.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Fairview Dome
description: A climber fell 20-30 feet while leading the fourth pitch of the Regular Route on Fairview Dome, resulting in a ruptured Achilles tendon. They were lowered, rappelled, and hiked out before seeking medical attention.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet after running it out on an easy climb, resulting in a fractured ankle and other minor injuries.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Chouinard's Crack
description: A climber fell while climbing Chouinard's Crack after a hex placement failed, resulting in spinal fractures, rib fractures, a scapula fracture, lacerations, and pulmonary contusions.

location_name: Glen Canyon Recreational Area, Gregory Butte
description: A climber fell 30 feet after a piece of protection pulled out, causing a rock slab to break free and hit him in the head.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Hemingway Buttress, White Lightning
description: A climber fell while downclimbing White Lightning after being unable to place protection, resulting in hip and head injuries; she was rescued and airlifted to a hospital but sustained no serious injury.
A climber fell approximately 300 feet to his death while free soloing the Matthes Crest ridge traverse.
A climber fell while leading due to belayer inattention and improper belay technique, resulting in non-life-threatening injuries.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet while being lowered from the route Madness due to the rope being too short, resulting in a fractured back, broken arm, and chipped elbow.

location_name: Yosemite, El Capitan, North America Wall
description: Climber fell 12 feet when a beak placement pulled out, resulting in a broken ankle.
A climber fell while leading Diagonal (5.6) at Ragged Mountain after a nut placement pulled out, resulting in broken ribs and a head laceration.
A climber descending fixed ropes on Denali fell and injured her knee, requiring eventual evacuation.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, West Buttress, above Windy Corner
description: A climber triggered a small snow slide while unroped near the top of a ridge on Denali, resulting in a 50-meter fall and a broken leg.
A climber fell 700 feet to his death after traversing too far north from the summit rim, causing a cornice collapse on Mt. Hood.
Benjamin Newkirk fell to his death while descending the southeast ridge of Middle Sister in snowy and windy conditions after summiting. He was unroped and may have been unconscious before the fall.
A skier fell approximately 100 feet on Mt. Jefferson after losing an edge, sustaining a broken femur and head trauma.

route_name: Muldrow Glacier Route, West Buttress Route
description: Sylvia Montag fell to her death while descending unroped from Denali Pass after separating from her partner due to fatigue or bad weather; her partner suffered frostbite and required rescue.
A climber fell on the Autobahn traverse near Denali Pass after a long summit day, likely due to fatigue and insufficient protection, resulting in injury and a rescue.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, Denali Pass
description: Three climbers suffered frostbite, exposure, and minor injuries from falls while descending Denali Pass in poor weather; one climber fell twice and was assisted by others.
James Adams slipped on ice while descending Mt. Hood, was unable to self-arrest, and slid into a fumarole, sustaining multiple fractures, abrasions, and contusions.
A climbing team on Denali's West Buttress experienced altitude illness and frostbite, requiring medical assistance for two members after a summit attempt in high winds and cold temperatures.
While lowering a climber, the belayer's carabiner cross-loaded and the rope popped out, but the climber was held by friction and the belayer's brake hand.
Climbers were caught in a lightning storm near the summit of Bear Creek Spire while descending, one climber was struck by lightning and sustained a minor burn.
Belayer backed up to take a photo while belaying, and when the climber weighted the rope while clipping a directional, the belayer was pulled off a ramp and swung into the wall, fracturing his talus.

location_name: Mt. Shasta, Red Banks / Avalanche Gulch
description: A female climber summited Mt. Shasta, became separated from her party, got lost in poor visibility, and was later assisted by rangers to descend safely.
Brothers attempting the north ridge of Mt. Conness retreated due to a thunderstorm, chose a longer route back, bivied without gear, separated the next morning, and were found by NPS rescuers.

location_name: Arches National Park, Tower of Babel
description: A climber fell between 75 and 100 feet while rappelling after a possible equipment failure involving a broken carabiner.

location_name: Garden of the Gods, Kindergarten Rock
description: A climber rappelling from Kindergarten Rock fell approximately 40 feet due to uneven ropes and inattention, resulting in a gash to the bone on their elbow.

location_name: east of Salt Lake City, Mt. Olympus, West Slabs
description: Climbers were hit by rockfall while descending in near darkness, resulting in minor injuries to one climber.
A climber descending the Wintun Route was hit by rockfall, sustaining a fractured femur and arm.
A climber was struck in the lower right leg by a large falling block while climbing Missionary’s Crack.
Three climbers ascending Avalanche Gulch on Mt. Shasta suffered varying injuries from a natural rockfall event and required helicopter rescue.

location_name: San Bernadino Mountains, Lucerne Valley, Grapevine Road
description: A climber fell approximately 55-60 feet after losing footing due to intoxication and using an inappropriate anchor for rappelling, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Mt. Shasta, Avalanche Gulch / Heart Route
description: A climber fell on snow in Avalanche Gulch, lost control of their ice axe, and was unable to self-arrest, sliding until stopped by another climber; she sustained minor injuries.
A group of four climbers, inexperienced in multi-pitch climbing, got stranded on the summit of Half Dome after dark due to snow-covered cables and cold temperatures.
A climber was bitten by a bat while climbing a trad route and received post-exposure prophylaxis for rabies.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Loch Vale
description: Two climbers were free soloing when an avalanche swept one climber off the route, while the other managed to stay on the ice face; no serious injuries were reported.
A climber fell into a crevasse on the Muir Snowfield and was rescued by RMI guides with a possible shoulder dislocation.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, East McMillan Spire
route_name: west ridge of East McMillan Spire
description: A climber fell into a crevasse after the top of the bergschrund collapsed under his weight, resulting in injuries to his eye and face.
A climber fell 10 feet after a Silent Partner device failed while using a Tyrolean traverse, resulting in a shattered femur.
A lead climber fell about six meters while placing his first ice screw on Malignant Mushroom, resulting in back injuries and requiring rescue.

location_name: Canada, Alberta, Banff National Park, Louise Falls
description: A climber fell 12-15 meters on Louise Falls after his feet and tools blew out, pulling out the top ice screw, resulting in a broken leg.
A climber fell after an anchor failed while cleaning a top-rope on ice, resulting in serious injuries including a severed spinal cord.
A climber fell while ascending rappel lines to fix a rope jam, grabbing the ropes above the prusiks and not having backup knots, resulting in a fall to a ledge.
A guided climbing team was swept off Liberty Ridge, likely by an avalanche, icefall, or collapsing ice ledge, resulting in six fatalities.

location_name: Eleven Mile Canyon, Pine Cone Dome
description: A climber fell while leading on rock, resulting in a concussion, scalp lacerations, and other injuries after a foot popped near the top of the route.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet while leading Rye Crisp after his foot slipped, resulting in a severely broken elbow.
A 25-year-old climber died after falling while free soloing in Blodgett Canyon. His body was found at the base of a rock formation after he was reported missing.

location_name: Linville Gorge Wilderness Area, Shortoff Mountain
description: Jackson Depew fell about 35 feet after a hold broke while leading the third pitch of Maginot Line, sustaining multiple injuries including a concussion, broken leg, fractured pelvis, tailbone, three broken ribs, and a collapsed lung.
A climber dislodged a large block while leading, causing a 25-foot fall and injuries to her lower leg when the falling block struck her. The rope was also partially cut by the rockfall.

location_name: Shawangunks, The Trapps, Cascading Crystal Kaleidoscope
description: A climber fell 15-20 feet after a cam pulled out while retreating from a climb, resulting in a broken back and incomplete spinal cord injury.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet to the ground from Yellow Wall at the Trapps after not placing any protection and died from a broken neck.
A solo climber fell approximately 70 feet while rope-soloing on the Barber Wall at Cathedral Ledge, resulting in fatal injuries.

location_name: Crowder Mountain State Park, Middle Finger Wall
description: A climber died after a fall while rope solo climbing. The Soloist self-belay device failed to engage, likely due to an inverted fall, and a chest sling compromised his airway after a backup knot stopped the fall.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Junkyard Area
description: A climber fell 12-15 feet while leading a 5.7 route due to fixed gear failure, resulting in spinal injury and fractured ulna and radius; the climber was not wearing a helmet.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet while leading due to an inexperienced belayer who did not brake properly and was using an ATC. The leader knew the belayer was inexperienced.

A climber fell approximately 60 feet after clipping into the anchor with a single alpine draw and leaning back to test their weight. The climber was caught by another person, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber fell while leading the first pitch of the Lower Exum Ridge, pulling out a cam and breaking his leg; weather conditions and inexperience contributed to the accident.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, West Ridge
description: A climber fell approximately 60 feet after a miscommunication with his belayer led to him being taken off belay prematurely while expecting to be lowered.

location_name: Stone Mountain State Park, Stone Mountain, south face, Tree Ledge
description: Two climbers fell approximately 60 feet while preparing to rappel from the Tree Ledge, apparently without being anchored, resulting in life-threatening injuries.
Climber fell 15-20 feet after a cam and chockstone pulled out while attempting the second pitch of Friday's Folly, resulting in serious injuries including a broken back.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Lower Peanuts Wall
description: A climber fell to the ground after multiple pieces of protection pulled and two carabiners unclipped from their slings, resulting in a traumatic brain injury.
A climber fell while leading Diagonal (5.6) at Ragged Mountain after a nut pulled out, resulting in broken ribs and a head laceration. The climber was airlifted to a hospital.

location_name: Pisgah National Forest, Little Lost Cove Cliffs
description: A climber fell 70 feet while demonstrating a rappel due to unequal rope ends and lack of blocking knots, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Practice Wall
description: Ben Lee fell 15-20 feet while rappelling Burn Crack when one of the ropes pulled through his ATC due to uneven ropes and lack of knots, resulting in surgery.

location_name: Banff National Park, Moraine Lake, 3/3.5 Couloir
description: Two climbers fell several hundred meters while glissading down the 3/3.5 Couloir; one was uninjured and the other sustained unknown injuries.

location_name: Kluane National Park and Reserve, Mt. Logan, East Ridge
description: A climber on Mt. Logan experienced severe cramping, dizziness, and altered consciousness, requiring rescue due to medical distress; the patient was treated for dehydration, electrolyte imbalance, and exhaustion.
A climber rappelled off the end of his rope while off route at Skaha Bluffs, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber fell to his death while rappelling after failing to tie knots at the end of the rope and skipping a rappel station.
A rappel anchor failed during a rappelling practice session, causing multiple people to fall; two people died and one was injured.
A climber died after rappelling off the end of the rope due to only tying a knot on one end, likely due to fatigue.

location_name: Queen Creek Canyon, Upper Devils Canyon, Lost Wall
description: John Scott died after being struck in the head by a falling rock while belaying his partner at the base of the Projectiles route.
Two climbers were ascending Grassi Ridge on Wiwaxy Peak when light rain caused a rockfall; one climber was struck and injured, preventing movement, but they were rescued the next morning.
A climber was hit on the helmet by a baseball-size rock while leading a pitch on Prime Rib of Goat, resulting in a minor injury.
A climber was injured by a rockfall while descending Mt. Cory after getting off-route; he sustained multiple broken bones and a head injury.
A climber sustained severe foot injuries from a rockfall while climbing the Upper Exum Ridge after failing to test a large, loose boulder.

A climber fell while descending a snow slope on Disappointment Peak, sustaining a possible broken leg due to slipping on snow and being unable to self-arrest. The climber was not wearing crampons and admitted to climbing outside her abilities.
While ice climbing, a climber's crampon slipped and they fell, grabbing for their tool and lodging it into their helmet without injury.

location_name: Bow Valley Wildland Provincial Park, Cougar Creek Canyon, Casino Wall
description: A climber rappelled off the end of the rope due to miscommunication and not tying stopper knots, resulting in a fall and lower back fracture.

location_name: Alberta, Grassi Lakes, Golf Course crag
description: Two climbers were injured by rockfall while gearing up at the Golf Course crag; neither was wearing a helmet.
A guide was hit by a rock kicked off by a climber above on the Owen-Spalding route because the climber did not yell "Rock!".
Two climbers fell to their deaths after an old rappel anchor failed while they were descending the northeast face of Pingora Peak.

location_name: Denali National Park, Ruth Gorge, Mt. Dickey, 747 Pass (between Mt. Dickey and Mt. Bradley)
description: Two climbers triggered a large slab avalanche but were not caught. Unable to descend safely, they called for rescue and were airlifted to their campsite.
A climber triggered a loose-wet avalanche while glissading on Mt. Shasta, sustaining minor injuries and self-rescuing.

location_name: Banff National Park, Wapta Icefields, Balfour High Col
description: A skier broke through a cornice on the Wapta Icefields, falling 150-200 meters, but was uninjured and able to climb back up with the help of their group.
A climber fell into a crevasse on the Trident Glacier while unroped, sustaining minor injuries but self-rescued with the help of their partner.

A climber unprepared for winter conditions on Mt. Shasta was reported missing after failing to return; he was found in Cascade Gulch after descending the wrong drainage and was assisted to safety without injuries.

A climber fell 20 feet while approaching a route in Skunk Canyon, sustaining multiple fractures and a collapsed lung; the fall occurred while traversing a gully with loose rock and potentially wet conditions.
A climber fell while downclimbing near the top of a route, impacting a slab below and sustaining a spinal fracture and soft-tissue damage.
A scrambler slipped and fell 15-20 meters down a cliff band and then tumbled approximately 100 meters down a steep talus slope while descending Mt. Daly.
A climber with limited mountaineering experience fell while downclimbing on Cleaver Peak, sustaining a broken leg and other injuries, requiring rescue and hospitalization.
A climber fell approximately 25 feet after getting off-route and a handhold broke, resulting in spinal injuries and a concussion; the climber self-rescued.
A climber fell approximately 35 feet after a large block shifted while climbing the East Face of Temple Crag, resulting in a severely broken right ankle and a burst L2 vertebra.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Phoenix Buttress
description: A climber fell on Scary Llamas due to inadequate belay and possibly heat, resulting in an ankle injury.

A climber leading a 5.10a route fell 20 meters due to belayer error and inadequate belay technique, resulting in serious injuries including a broken calcaneus, facial lacerations, head trauma, and concussion.

location_name: Austin, Barton Creek Greenbelt, Gus Fruh Wall
description: A climber fell off the route Birdland (5.10+) after clipping the second bolt, hitting a ledge about 20 feet off the ground, suffering lacerations and a likely concussion.
A climber fell approximately 20 feet due to the rope being too short while being lowered, resulting in abrasions and lacerations.
A 32-year-old male climber fell while leading Agatha Christie, pulling out protection and falling 45 feet, sustaining broken bones and internal injuries.
A climber fell 20 feet on the first pitch of The Nose after leapfrogging cams that pulled out, resulting in a fall to the ledge below.
A climber fell while leading the second pitch of Calculus Direct after failing to place adequate protection, resulting in a broken ankle.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, Astro Dog
description: A climber broke their ankle in a lead fall on Astro Dog in the Black Canyon of the Gunnison due to inadequate protection and overconfidence.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Leaning Tower, West Face
description: A climber fell approximately 20 feet while leading on the West Face of Leaning Tower after a micro-cam pulled out. The climber was rescued and sustained minor injuries.
A climber fell after her figure 8 knot came undone due to insufficient rope and lack of a partner check, resulting in a fractured calcaneus and a laceration.

location_name: Boulder’s Open Space and Mountain Parks, Gregory Flatironette
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet while free-soloing the Gregory Flatironette and died.
A climber fell after being stung by wasps and stepping on a rocking block, resulting in a serious leg injury.
A climber fell while leading a sport route after the rope got behind her leg, causing her to flip and hit her head, resulting in a serious head injury.

location_name: Owens River Gorge, Silent Pillar Wall
description: Scott Sederstrom died after a bolt failed while rope soloing on Life in Electric Larvae Land at Silent Pillar Wall in Owens River Gorge; he fell 25-30 feet.

A climber fell on an ice sheet above 12,000 feet on Mt. Shasta, breaking his ankle; high winds hampered rescue efforts, but he was eventually evacuated and treated for potential vascular complications.
A climber tripped on his crampons while descending on firm snow and fell 2,000 feet, resulting in a fatality.
A climber glissading with crampons on Mt. Shasta caught her crampons in the snow, broke her ankles, and tumbled, requiring rescue.
A climber lost control while glissading on Mt. Whitney due to icy conditions, falling 750 feet and sustaining bruises and a cut.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: Two climbers glissading down the Southeast Couloir of Middle Teton lost control on a snowpatch, resulting in minor injuries for both. One climber fell further than the other, requiring a helicopter rescue.
Dasan Marshall fell 1,000 feet to his death on the north face of Mt. Yukla while scouting a route through a steep section of snow and ice. He slipped and was unable to stop his fall.
Two climbers suffered frostbite on their feet during a summit attempt on Denali's West Buttress, with one requiring air evacuation.
A climber suffered frostbite on all 10 fingers while setting up camp at 17,200 feet and was evacuated.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, West Buttress
description: A climber on Denali's West Buttress experienced respiratory distress after summiting and was diagnosed with mild HAPE; she was monitored and descended the next day without NPS assistance.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, West Buttress, 17,200-foot camp
description: A climber at 17,200-foot camp on Denali developed HAPE and HACE after several days at altitude and was left unattended by his teammate; he was evacuated and hospitalized.
A climber died from hypothermia and exposure after attempting to move to high camp in poor weather conditions on Denali's West Buttress.
An inexperienced solo climber got lost on Mt. Shasta after starting in the dark, leaving his pack, and becoming disoriented; he was eventually rescued by helicopter.

location_name: Tonto National Forest, Coon Bluff Recreation Area
