description: A climber died after falling 125-150 feet when the rope pulled free from the biner block rappel anchor, likely due to an improperly tied or incorrect hitch.

A climber died when the old piton anchor failed while rappelling from Monster Tower in Canyonlands National Park; heat and exhaustion likely contributed to the decision to rappel without testing or backing up the anchor.

location_name: Brooks Range, Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, Jago River
description: A group attempting Mt. Itso retreated due to poor weather. During a river crossing, Edward struggled in the current, became submerged, and drowned after his sling carabiner detached from the rope.
Climbers encountered a significant rock slide on the approach to the Grand Sentinel, narrowly avoiding being caught in the slide.
A rappeller was struck in the left knee and foot by a falling rock while approximately 20 feet above the canyon floor.
A solo climber was hit in the head by rockfall while rappelling the summit block, causing her to fall and injure her knee, requiring rescue.
Climbers were hit by rockfall while on the Standard Thumb route; one climber was injured and the anchor sling was partially severed.
A climber's rope sheath was cut by a fixed carabiner on a sport route, exposing the core, due to a burr on the carabiner.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Lumpy Ridge, Batman Rock
description: A 24-year-old man slipped and fell from the summit of Batman Rock while hiking and scouting climbing routes, sustaining non-life-threatening injuries.
Angela Uys fell approximately 500 feet to her death on Snake Dike after her tether system failed while preparing to rappel due to not being effectively clipped to the anchor.
A solo climber got disoriented while descending Mt. Shasta, spent the night in an open bivy, and was rescued by helicopter the next day with no injuries other than exhaustion.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Lower Gorge, Catwalk Cliff
description: A climber was bitten by a bat while climbing, resulting in bleeding wounds and requiring rabies post-exposure prophylaxis.
A climber was caught in an avalanche on Granite Mountain after summiting solo and was found deceased in the debris.
A mountaineer died of hypothermia after being caught in severe wind and freezing temperatures during a traverse of the northern Presidential Range.
A climbing guide took a fatal fall while free soloing alongside clients on an ice climb when a bulge of ice fractured unexpectedly.

location_name: Pisgah National Forest, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell after the overhand knot at the master point of their anchor failed while setting up a top-rope on Looking Glass Rock, resulting in leg fractures.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
description: A climber fell after the belayer mistakenly took them off belay due to miscommunication, resulting in injuries including muscle tears, a mild concussion, and bruised ribs.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Needle
description: A climber fell over 100 feet to his death while scrambling unroped on 3rd-class ledges after completing the initial roped section of the Ellingwood Arête on Crestone Needle.

location_name: Poudre Canyon, North of the Crystal Wall
description: A climber fell 40 feet after a hold broke while climbing unroped, resulting in a compound fracture, broken elbow, sprained wrist, and abrasions.
A climber fell 50-60 feet from the anchors after failing to retie the rope to her harness while transitioning from rappelling to lowering. She died from her injuries.

location_name: Echo Lake State Park, Whitehorse Ledge
description: A climber fell while aiding on the Standard Route of Whitehorse Ledge. The climber was not seriously injured but was rattled and refused to continue. The pair was rescued by Mountain Rescue Service.
A climber fell 15 meters on Lurking Fear after a micro-cam blew and pulled multiple pieces of protection, resulting in serious injuries including possible head trauma and a broken clavicle.
A climber fell on the first pitch of Bastille Crack due to inadequate protection, resulting in a head injury requiring stitches; the belayer's position also contributed to the severity of the fall.
A climber died after a long, swinging fall on the third pitch of the Mountaineers Route due to inadequate protection.

location_name: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Dark Shadows
description: A climber fell 20 feet after a nut placement pulled while leading the ninth pitch of Dark Shadows, resulting in broken ribs, scapula, and cracked vertebrae; the team self-rescued.
A climber fell while attempting the direct finish of Thin Slabs, resulting in a dislocated and fractured ankle due to inadequate protection.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Christian Brothers
description: Peter Kettering fell 12-15 feet while leading Irreverence (5.10a) after mistakenly thinking it was Revelations (5.9), resulting in injuries to both ankles.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Christian Brothers
description: A climber fell after a piece of protection pulled, and the rope was either not clipped to a lower cam or became detached, resulting in a long fall and serious injuries.
A 23-year-old male climber fell 60-80 feet while leading the second pitch of Diagonal on Wallface after a cam pulled out, likely hitting ledges and a tree island, resulting in injuries.
A climber fell about 30 feet after a tree used as an anchor came loose due to being too small and having a shallow root system; the climber sustained serious injuries.
A climber fell about 20 feet due to inexperience, inadequate belay, and poor judgment, resulting in a fractured talus. The belayer was also pulled off the ground.
A climber fell approximately 50 feet after a large flake he was holding for balance pulled out while descending unroped, sustaining minor injuries.
A climber fell after the belayer had difficulty releasing an autoblocking belay device while lowering, resulting in minor injuries.
Andrew Bower fell to his death while replacing bolts at a crag, likely after slipping while approaching the edge without a rope or harness.
A climber fell 15-20 feet after a nut pulled out while attempting to place it, resulting in bruising and abrasions.
A climber fell while attempting to clip the chains on Breakfast Burrito, fracturing their kneecap due to an inadequate belay and lack of a soft catch.
A climber slipped on soft snow in a couloir while unroped, sliding 600 feet and sustaining serious injuries including fractures and a concussion.
A 62-year-old climber fell approximately 200 feet on the South Side Route of Mt. Hood due to a loose crampon, resulting in a shoulder injury.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Deep Freeze
description: A climber fell after a snow mushroom collapsed beneath them on a low-angle snow slope, resulting in multiple injuries and requiring a rescue.

location_name: Pikes Peak, granite crag near the Crags Trailhead
description: A climber was injured while being lowered after top-roping a trad climb when she free-fell approximately eight feet, fracturing bones in her heel and ankle due to slack in the system and communication issues.
A climber fell due to a lowering error caused by miscommunication and inexperience, resulting in a fractured sacrum; the belayer arrested the fall bare-handed.
A climber rappelling to retrieve dropped gear fell to his death after unclipping from the anchor before being secured to the rappel device.
Suzanne Huffman fell 30 feet to the ground while rappelling due to the rappel device being unhinged, causing the rope to slip out, resulting in fatal injuries.
A climber, Ethan Gillett, rappelled off the end of a short, unknotted fixed rope in the dark on Washington Column, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber's hair got caught in her rappel device (ATC) while rappelling, causing her to dangle until rescued by her partner and others.
A climber died after rappelling with a rope too thin for his belay device and without a backup, resulting in uncontrolled descent and severe head trauma.
A climber was struck by a rock while climbing the north ridge of Pfeifferhorn, sustaining minor injuries including chipped teeth and a bitten tongue.

location_name: Smith Rock State Park, Picnic Lunch Wall
description: A climber following the third pitch of Voyage of the Cow Dog dislodged a microwave-size block, which fell and lacerated his right lower leg, requiring rescue assistance.
A solo climber on El Capitan's Tangerine Trip experienced partial loss of use of both hands and requested assistance after being on the wall for seven days.
A solo climber attempting an ice climb on the Second Flatiron found the route deteriorating due to warm weather and called for help after becoming stranded.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore's Wall
description: Climbers retreated from a climb due to darkness, then attempted to retrieve gear via rappel, but the rope was too short, stranding one climber who self-rescued.

location_name: Mt. Rainier National Park, Liberty Ridge, Liberty Cap, Liberty Saddle
description: A climber separated from his partners in whiteout conditions on Mt. Rainier while retrieving a stove and succumbed to exposure.
Climbers got lost after summiting Lumpe Tower in Eldorado Canyon due to a late start, darkness, and poor decision-making regarding the descent route, requiring a SAR rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mt. Moran, Sickle Couloir
description: Four ski mountaineers were caught in an avalanche in the Sickle Couloir. Three were carried in the slide, resulting in two fatalities and one injury.
British climbers were descending Mt. Wilson when a grizzly bear attacked one of them, causing serious leg injuries requiring stitches.
A climber fell 10-15 meters after a hold broke while attempting a new route on Chancellor Peak, sustaining injuries to his knee and leg, but was rescued.

location_name: New River Gorge National Park, Junkyard Wall
description: A climber fell 22 feet while leading Four Sheets to the Wind at night, sustaining a fractured heel that required surgery.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Sandstonia
description: A climber fell 15-20 feet while leading a sport route due to a combination of fatigue, poor timing, and excessive slack while attempting to clip the anchors, resulting in injuries to the buttocks, leg, and face.

location_name: Devil's Lake State Park, Rainy Wednesday Tower
description: A 9-year-old girl fell 10-20 feet while climbing at Devil's Lake State Park due to an improperly tied knot and not wearing a helmet, resulting in multiple skull fractures.

location_name: Bow Valley Wildland Provincial Park, Ha Ling Peak Boulders
description: A climber bouldering at the base of Ha Ling Peak was injured when a piece of the boulder detached and crushed her pelvis.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Castle Mountain, Goat Plateau
description: A climber took a 15-meter leader fall on Castle Mountain after getting off route and climbing more difficult terrain with loose rock and marginal protection, resulting in head and back injuries.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Mt. Whyte
description: A lone scrambler fell approximately 300 meters while traversing a ridge on Mt. Whyte, sustaining spinal trauma and hypothermia.
Three climbers ascended Teewinot Mountain, went off-route onto the Black Chimney, and two fell to their deaths after one climber fell and knocked the other off the mountain.

A climber fell on a steep snow slope while descending the Middle Teton after intentionally stepping onto it without appropriate equipment, resulting in a slide and tumble through boulders, causing serious injuries.
Three climbers fell approximately 600 meters while ascending the Central Couloir on Joffre Peak, likely due to inadequate protection or anchor failure, resulting in three fatalities.

location_name: Grand Teton, Middle Teton, near the Black Dike
description: A climber was struck by a large rockfall while on the Dike Route, sustaining a broken humerus and lacerations; his belayer lowered him to safety, and he was later evacuated by rescuers.
Two climbers got off-route while attempting the Dike Route on the Middle Teton and requested a rescue due to exhaustion and uncertainty about the terrain.

Six climbers became stranded in the Stettner Couloir after rappelling through waterfalls and getting their ropes stuck; they were delayed by other parties and made poor decisions regarding descent options, leading to a cold night and eventual rescue.

location_name: New River Gorge, Meadow River Gorge, Greatest Show area
description: A climber's foot slipped and contacted a carabiner, resulting in a puncture wound that arrested his fall.

location_name: Eastern Alaska Range, Canwell Glacier, McCallum Peak
description: A mountaineering class triggered a wind slab avalanche on a moraine slope while approaching McCallum Peak, resulting in partial or complete burial of several members and minor injuries.

location_name: North Cascades, North Twin Sister Mountain
description: Climber crashed their mountain bike during the descent after summiting North Twin Sister Mountain, resulting in broken ribs.
A climber was seriously injured when a loose boulder shifted, causing a fall and then rolling over him.
A climber sustained a severe arm fracture when a haul bag being rappelled by another party above was dropped and struck him.
Climber fell 15 feet after failing to tie into the rope, resulting in a compression fracture of the L5 vertebra and a chipped tooth.
A 44-year-old man fell approximately 125 feet from the summit pinnacle of Mt. Shasta, sustaining multiple injuries including spinal and rib fractures, and a traumatic liver injury.

location_name: Mexico, Veracruz, Pico de Orizaba, Jamapa Glacier
description: A climber fell 25 feet into a crevasse on the Jamapa Glacier after a snow bridge collapsed and was rescued the next day by a guide and other climbers.
A climber broke her leg after misjudging a jump on the North Face/West Crack route of Oak Creek Spire and striking the rock with her feet.
A climber fell on the Black Elk route due to fatigue and inadequate protection, resulting in a lacerated finger with tendon damage and metal fragments embedded.
Climber fell a few meters to the ground while being lowered due to a rope that was too short and belayer error, resulting in a compression fracture of two vertebrae.

location_name: Mt. Shasta, Avalanche Gulch, below Red Banks
description: Bryan Bridgefs slipped and fell on snow below Red Banks on Mt. Shasta, sustaining an arm injury and requiring a painful self-rescue due to helicopter limitations and rockfall risk.
A rope team fell while descending near Zebra Rocks on Denali after a climber lost footing; no one was able to self-arrest on the hard snow, resulting in head and chest injuries.
A climber fell to his death on the north ridge of Mt. Assiniboine after a handhold broke free while climbing unroped.
A climber fell approximately 100 feet in fourth-class terrain on Mt. Olympus while approaching the crux of Kamp's Ridge and died from head trauma.
An unroped climber on Mt. Tupper pulled on a loose block and fell down the south face, resulting in fatal injuries.

Two climbers sustained deep frostbite injuries during their ascent on Denali's West Buttress Route and requested a rescue due to their inability to safely navigate the terrain; they were later evacuated after a storm subsided.
A climber glissading with crampons on Mt. Shasta caught a crampon and twisted or broke her ankle, requiring rescue.
A climber fell while leading a finger crack route, and multiple pieces of protection pulled, resulting in a ground fall and serious injuries.
A climber on the West Buttress Route of Denali experienced high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) and required rescue and medical transport.
A climber slipped and fell approximately eight meters while descending unroped on an ice climb, sustaining a broken pelvis and vertebrae.
A climber sustained an open forearm fracture after a large boulder rolled over and caused him to fall while descending the boulder-strewn moraine of the lower Granite Glacier.
A climber fell approximately 30 meters while leading on Professor Falls after slipping on low-angle ice, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, West Ridge
description: A climber fell while projecting a route, the protection pulled, and the climber hit a ledge, resulting in an avulsion fracture and torn retinaculum requiring surgery.
A leader fell at the crux of a route, and their ankle snagged on a carabiner, resulting in a minor injury.
A leader fell after mistakenly clipping the trailing rope instead of the lead rope to the top two bolts, resulting in a fall and injuries.
A climber pulled multiple pieces of protection on Bishop's Terrace and fell approximately 25 feet, hitting his head and losing consciousness before being rescued and airlifted to a hospital.
A climber fell 25 meters on the approach pitch of Carlsberg Column after a tool placement failed, resulting in broken ankles and requiring helicopter rescue.
A climber leading the second pitch of Kemosabe took a 40-meter fall, pulling out two ice screws and sustaining life-threatening injuries.
A climber fell approximately 25-30 feet to the ground while being lowered due to the rope being too short, resulting in an injury to his lower extremities.
Climber 1 fell approximately 170 feet to the ground after incorrectly clipping the free-hanging tail of the rope into the fixed carabiners while cleaning the anchors, resulting in a fatal accident.
During a rappel retreat due to worsening weather, a climber pendulumed and sustained leg injuries when attempting to reach a rappel anchor.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Nez Perce
description: A climber fell while traversing on the Garnet Traverse face of Nez Perce after the leader got off route and was unable to protect the traverse, resulting in a swinging fall and foot injury.

location_name: Seneca Rocks, East Face, Bee Sting Corner
description: An inexperienced climber lost control while rappelling from Bee Sting Corner, sliding 100 feet and fracturing an ankle; an inadequate autoblock and lack of a fireman's belay contributed to the accident.

location_name: Yosemite, Yosemite Valley, Royal Arches Area
description: A climber sustained a broken leg and wrist during a rappelling accident while descending from Sons of Yesterday due to losing control and swinging into a wall.
A climber fell 35-40 meters after pulling on a loose block while scrambling up Sulzer Tower, sustaining serious injuries including a broken pelvis and back.
A climber fell approximately 40 meters while descending Mt. Haig after losing grip on their ice axe, resulting in a forced bivouac due to deteriorating weather and inadequate equipment.
A 26-year-old male climber on the West Buttress of Denali suffered from suspected HAPE and HACE and was evacuated from 14,200 feet to a local hospital.
During a simul-rappel, one climber fell approximately 70 feet after the end of the rope passed through his partner's ATC, resulting in a fatality and a broken leg for the other climber.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mons Icefield, west glacier
description: A skier was hit by a cornice-triggered avalanche while rappelling, resulting in minor injuries; the incident occurred during a ski traverse due to unstable conditions.
A solo climber on Mt. Hunter's west ridge was stranded due to avalanche conditions and low supplies, requiring a rescue.
Two climbers ascending Mt. Tupper's south buttress were slowed by wet, snowy conditions and lacked necessary equipment, leading to a rescue.
A climber fell while attempting a sport route, sustaining an ankle injury after his foot caught on the rock during a swinging fall; fatigue and route selection contributed to the accident.
A climber fell approximately 800 to 1,000 feet after a large portion of rock broke from under her feet while unroped near the summit of Bear Creek Spire.
A climber fell when a finger-size cam pulled out, resulting in an open fracture of the right foot and lower leg injuries.
A climber fell 20-25 feet after two cams pulled out while resting on gear, resulting in an ankle injury and a rescue.
A climber fell about 30 feet when the rock horn used as an anchor sheared off the wall, resulting in serious injuries.
Two climbers and three skiers were caught in an avalanche in Tuckerman Ravine; one climber and one skier sustained non-life-threatening injuries.

location_name: White Mountain National Forest, Cannon Cliff
description: Two climbers got benighted on Cannon Cliff and called for rescue due to difficult route finding and approaching bad weather; they were rescued by Mountain Rescue Service.
A climber fell when a handhold broke and a cam pulled out, resulting in a broken femur.
A climber fell approximately 55 feet while deep water soloing, resulting in a concussion and a broken tooth.
Two climbers were caught in a storm while descending Mt. Rainier; one climber died from hypothermia, and the other suffered from hypothermia but survived.

A climber fell while descending a steep, icy section of Haystack Mountain using microspikes instead of crampons, resulting in a broken fibula and dislocated ankle for another climber who attempted to stop the fall.
A roped pair fell on steep snow while descending the Old Chute on Mt. Hood, unable to arrest the fall, resulting in facial lacerations and bruised ribs for one climber.
A climber fell to his death while descending Mt. Washington without a rope or protection, wearing Converse Chuck Taylor shoes.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Ironclads
description: A 60-year-old climber died from internal injuries after falling while solo climbing at The Ironclads, likely while setting up or removing a self-belayed climbing system.
A climber fell to his death while rappelling after one strand of the rope was not threaded through his belay device and the rope ends did not reach the ground.

location_name: San de Cristo Mountains, Humboldt Peak
description: Two climbers glissading down Humboldt Peak without ice axes lost control on icy snow, resulting in injuries including a torn rotator cuff, broken arm, bruised ribs, a mild concussion, cuts, and abrasions.
A climber fell 10-15 feet to the ground before reaching the first piece of protection, sustaining a stress fracture in their foot.
A climber fell approximately 15 feet while leading Blood Clot, landing on his side and fracturing his arm.
A climber fell while leading Doritos and the belayer failed to arrest the fall, resulting in significant injuries to both individuals.
Josh fell approximately 20 feet to the ground after attempting to sling a chockstone due to inadequate gear, resulting in a broken ankle.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet after a hold broke off, and the belayer failed to maintain control of the rope, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet to the ground when a finger crack-size cam pulled out while leading Veg-O-Matic.
A climber fell after two micro-cams pulled out while leading a 5.8 trad route, resulting in lacerations, abrasions, strained groin muscles, and bruising.

location_name: Big Cottonwood Canyon, area near Lake Mary
description: A 30-year-old male fell 20-30 feet while highball bouldering, landed on pads at an odd angle, and rolled down a steep hillside, sustaining wrist, head, back, and lower leg injuries.

location_name: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Snowbird, Pipeline Bowl
description: A climber leading Rookie Party fell after a tool popped, resulting in a 30-foot fall and an ice tool puncture wound to the leg. The climber was rescued and flown off the mountain.
A climber fell 130 feet while leading an ice climb due to thin ice and inadequate protection, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Yosemite National Park, Tuolumne Meadows, Daff Dome
description: A leader fell 25 feet while attempting to replace a nut, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and a broken ankle; the belayer may have been slightly injured.
A climber leading Dopey Duck fell approximately 25 feet, landing feet-first and then striking his head, resulting in a lower leg fracture.
A leader fell approximately 15 feet while attempting the third pitch of La Selva (5.8), landing on a ledge and striking his right hip, resulting in a minor non-displaced pelvic fracture.

location_name: Indian Creek Canyon, Bridger Jack, Hummingbird Spire
description: A climber fell after dislodging a large rock while off-route, resulting in multiple fractures and a cut rope; he was rescued after a complex self-rescue and assistance from another party.
A climber fell approximately 35 feet while attempting to clip the anchors, resulting in a lost tooth and a fractured tooth.
A climber leading pitch two of the South Face route on Washington Column fell when a cam pulled out, resulting in injuries and a helicopter rescue.

location_name: Garden of the Gods, Red Twin Spire
description: A climber fell while leading Potholes, a 5.7 route, and dislocated their ankle after their foot caught behind the rope during the fall.
A climber fell 30-40 feet while being lowered when the rope ran through the belay device, resulting in a possible ankle injury.
A climber fell to his death while rappelling on Moonlight Buttress, likely due to rappelling off the end of the rope or making an error while transferring from the rappel rope to an anchor.
A climber rappelling a first ascent route in Dark Canyon fell when the flat figure-8 knot on his rappel anchor failed, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber rappelled off the end of one strand of rope due to uneven rope ends and lack of stopper knots, resulting in significant leg fractures and a shoulder injury.

location_name: Methow Valley, Goat Wall, Prime Rib of Goat
description: A climber died after a rappel knot failed while descending Prime Rib of Goat. The climber likely used an at figure-8 knot, which is prone to failure, and may not have backed it up. The climber's inexperience also contributed to the accident.
During rain, a student grabbed a rock for a pull-up; it broke, injuring him and another student, resulting in pelvic fractures and hand trauma requiring surgery.
A climber slipped on a snow slope while approaching a climb in Huntington Ravine, tumbling into rocks and sustaining non-life-threatening ankle and shoulder injuries.
A climber rappelled off the wrong side of Monkey Face and became stranded mid-air, requiring rescue.

Four climbers, inexperienced in multi-pitch trad climbing, became stranded on The Prow in the Amphitheater due to darkness, route-finding difficulties, and inadequate supplies; they were rescued without injuries.
Two climbers with limited alpine experience got lost on the Exum Ridge, became stranded, and required rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Ten soldiers became distressed, likely with altitude illness, while climbing Kiener's Route on Longs Peak and spent an unplanned night at 13,000 feet before being evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A 25-year-old female fell on snow while descending Middle Teton, slid into rocks, and sustained head and hip injuries after being unable to self-arrest with her ice axe.
An experienced climber fell 20 feet due to inadequate belay from an inexperienced partner while climbing Split Mountain. The climber sustained a laceration and was later rescued by helicopter.
An experienced climber died after falling from the anchor of a sport climb due to a tie-in error, likely failing to complete a figure-8 knot.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Crestone Needle
description: A 55-year-old mountaineer died in a 100-foot fall from Crestone Needle after getting off route during descent.

location_name: Wind Rivers, Cirque of the Towers, Sharks Nose
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet while free soloing on Sharks Nose, sustaining multiple injuries including a broken patella and facial fractures, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 70 feet after protection pulled, sustaining significant injuries.
Two climbers on the Petzoldt Ridge were stranded after a leader fall resulted in lost gear; they were rescued by helicopter after being unable to continue climbing or rappel.
A climber with limited experience fell while attempting a wide crack climb due to inadequate protection, resulting in minor lacerations and abrasions.
A climber rappelling the Durrance Route at Devils Tower fell approximately 20 feet due to a rope handling error while untangling coils, resulting in a fractured ankle.
A professional guide fell to his death during a rappel on the Owen-Spalding route after a water knot in his lanyard failed due to inadequate tail length and cyclic loading.

location_name: Mohonk Preserve, Madam G’s rappel stations
description: Two climbers sustained multiple systems trauma while attempting to simul-rappel from Madam G’s rappel stations when uneven ropes caused one climber to rappel off the rope, leading to a 20-foot fall.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mt. Moran, Falling Ice Glacier
description: A solo climber got stranded on the Falling Ice Glacier on Mt. Moran due to poor planning, inadequate equipment, and choosing a route beyond his abilities, requiring a helicopter rescue and resulting in a citation for creating a hazardous condition.

A 28-year-old male climber died from suspected high altitude pulmonary and cerebral edema (HAPE and HACE) at approximately 17,500 feet on Denali's West Buttress Route after continuing to ascend despite showing signs of altitude illness.
A 23-year-old male climber was assessed for stomach pain and suspected appendicitis, then transported to base camp and treated before being evacuated by air.

location_name: Northern Selkirks, Guardsman Glacier, Footstool adjacent to Mt. Sir Sandford
description: A size 3 slab avalanche caught three members of a group of six while ascending on the Guardsman Glacier, resulting in two injuries and one burial with a quick recovery.
A 28-year-old male triggered and was caught in an avalanche while skiing the Rescue Gully, below 17,200-foot camp on the West Buttress Route, resulting in a tumbling fall and knee injury.

location_name: Vancouver Island, Sunnyside climbing area, Lower Deck
description: A belayer was pulled into the wall and seriously injured her knee while belaying a climber at Sunnyside climbing area because she was not anchored.
An unroped climber fell approximately 60 feet into a crevasse on the West Buttress Route and was wedged, requiring a 15-hour rescue; he sustained hypothermia and a brachial plexus nerve injury.
A 33-year-old climber fell eight to ten meters into a crevasse on the Kahiltna Glacier and dislocated his left shoulder. He was extricated and flown to Talkeetna.
A climber fell into a crevasse while traveling unroped on Denali's West Buttress Route and was extracted by other climbers. The climber sustained injuries and was evacuated.
A series of rockfalls on El Capitan struck two climbers walking along the base of the cliff, killing one and seriously injuring the other. A later rockfall injured a driver.
A climber fell from the anchor after a miscommunication about rappelling or being lowered, resulting in serious injuries.

A climber fell twice while aiding a pitch on El Capitan after protection pulled, resulting in an avulsion fracture and other soft tissue injuries. Fatigue and inadequate protection placement were contributing factors.
A climber fell about 50 feet after inadequate protection pulled out, resulting in a serious concussion; he was rescued by helicopter.
A climber fell over 100 feet while speed climbing the Nose on El Capitan due to inadequate protection, resulting in serious injuries including paralysis.

location_name: Glacier National Park, Mt. Sir Donald
description: A climber slipped on a snow patch over ice while descending Mt. Sir Donald and fell 240 meters to their death; they were not wearing crampons or using an ice axe.

location_name: Lower West Bolton, Lower West Bolton climbing area
description: A climber fell to the ground after a miscommunication with the belayer about the descent method, resulting in a fatal accident.

location_name: Rock Rock National Conservation Area, Calico Basin
description: A climber fell while leading Guys and Ghouls after placing only one piece of protection, which then pulled out, resulting in a ground fall and serious injuries.
A climber fell after a cam pulled out while attempting the crux of a route, resulting in a ground fall and injuries including a shattered wrist, broken thumb, and concussion.

location_name: New River Gorge, Endless Wall, Fantasy Area
description: A climber fell while leading Mrs. Field's Follies, resulting in a comminuted fracture to the calcaneus and talus. The fall occurred after the climber struggled with the moves and became careless near the top of the route.
A climber fell above their last piece of gear on Ritz Cracker and impacted a ledge, injuring an ankle.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet to the ground while being lowered because the rope was too short, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Banff National Park, Lake Louise, Back of the Lake
description: A climber fell 12 meters after being lowered on a rope that was too short, without a stopper knot, and without a helmet, resulting in a concussion and minor scrapes.

A climber fell approximately 15 meters to the ground due to a lowering error during a mock multi-pitch climb. Climber 1 redirected the rope incorrectly, causing Climber 2 to fall and sustain a suspected spine injury and forearm fracture.
Two climbers attempting the Nose got off route while rappelling and became stranded, requiring rescue assistance to find a safe rappel route.
A climber was injured when a rappel anchor (rock horn) failed during descent, causing her to fall.
A climber fell approximately 40 feet when a fixed cam anchor failed during a rappel, resulting in bruising, whiplash, and rope burns.
A climber rappelled off the end of her rope while descending Harry Daley, resulting in major injuries including spinal and skull fractures.

location_name: New River Gorge, Endless Wall, Fern Point
description: A 22-year-old male climber rappelled off the end of his rope while descending, falling approximately 40 feet and suffering multiple injuries.
A climber rappelled off the end of one rope strand due to uneven ropes and lack of stopper knots, resulting in a 30-40 foot fall and serious injuries.

location_name: Banff National Park, Mt. St. Bride
description: A climber removing gloves during a rappel lost control, resulting in rope burns despite a fireman's belay attempt and a failed prusik backup.
A climber on Mt. Hungabee's west ridge was struck on the helmet by a rock during descent, resulting in a broken nose, but the team was able to descend and meet a rescue team.
A guided party was traversing the Fuhrmann Ledges route when a large rock fell, striking one member and causing a fractured humerus.

location_name: Denali, West Buttress, ridge above 16,200 feet
description: A climber injured his shoulder during a self-arrest to stop a roped teammate’s sliding fall on the ridge above 16,200 feet on the West Buttress Route.
A climber suffered snow blindness after summiting Denali via the Cassin Ridge in poor weather and losing his goggles, requiring helicopter evacuation.
Two climbers became stranded on Royal Arches after attempting to rappel with a single rope and finding themselves without fixed anchors due to an approaching storm.
Two climbers attempting the west ridge of Chancellor Peak got off route, encountered difficult climbing on poor rock, triggered a rockfall, and were unable to ascend or descend, requiring a rescue.
A belayer was injured when a washing machine-sized boulder dislodged and rolled over their arm and leg while belaying a climber on Boognish Tower in Day Canyon.
A climber fell after being taken off belay prematurely while setting up a top-rope, but was saved by a knot in the rope catching on a piece of protection.
A climber fell 40 feet while attempting to set up an anchor on the Bastille Crack after failing to clip his first piece, resulting in serious injuries.
Alex Doria fell on the third pitch of the Regular Northwest Face on Half Dome after a runout, resulting in a broken vertebra, foot, and wrist.
A climber fell to his death while establishing a new route, possibly due to a rappel rigging error or equipment failure.
A 27-year-old man with limited outdoor experience died after falling about 60 feet while rappelling at Shelf Road due to incorrectly threading or clipping his rappel device.
A climber fell 70 feet to the ground after multiple pieces of protection pulled out during a lead attempt on a single-pitch trad route, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber fell on Foxtrot (5.11d) on the West Ridge when a protection piece pulled out, resulting in a head laceration.
A novice leader fell 10-12 feet due to slack in the rope and a distracted belayer, resulting in a fractured talus requiring surgery.

location_name: Estes Park Area, The Crags, Sharksfin
description: A climber fell after traversing off-route and placing inadequate protection, resulting in a compound dislocation of the ankle and requiring helicopter rescue.
A belayer was pulled off balance while lowering a climber, hitting her head and sustaining injuries, due to unstable ground and a significant weight difference; she was not wearing a helmet.
A climber was lowered off the end of a rope that was shorter than expected, resulting in a 25-foot ground fall and significant injuries.

Two climbers descending Starlight Peak deviated from their planned route, leading to an anchor failure during a rappel. One climber died, and the other was rescued after spending the night on a ledge.

route_name: Tenaya Peak, Matthes Crest, and Cathedral Peak
description: A climber rappelled off the end of the rope due to rushing and not properly setting up the rappel in a storm, resulting in a 50-foot fall and minor injuries.
A climber was struck by a falling rock while climbing Cathedral Peak, resulting in a fatal head injury after a series of rescue attempts and anchor failures.
A roped-solo climber fell approximately 110 feet on El Capitan after multiple pieces of protection pulled out or failed, resulting in a small scratch on one ankle.

location_name: Lake Clark National Park, Hidden Mountains
description: A climber fell after dislodging loose rock while leading a pitch, sustaining serious injuries including fractured vertebrae, spinal cord injury, head injury, and a fractured arm.

location_name: Denali National Park, West Kahiltna Peak
description: A climber sustained an open lower leg fracture after a 10- to 15-meter fall on ice while leading the third pitch of a new route on West Kahiltna Peak.

location_name: Denali National Park, West Fork of Ruth Glacier, Reality Ridge
description: A ski mountaineer triggered an avalanche and was swept 1,800 feet down a couloir, sustaining significant injuries including a dislocated shoulder, fractured jaw, and lacerations.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, West Buttress Route
description: Two climbers fell on Denali's West Buttress due to inadequate protection on hard snow, sliding 1,000 feet into a crevasse. One climber sustained a knee injury and the other cervical spine fractures, requiring rescue.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. Hunter, Mini-Moonflower
description: Climbers were hit by an avalanche while rappelling the Mini-Moonflower route, resulting in a broken arm for one climber.
A 59-year-old male descended from 17,200-foot camp with high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) and self-evacuated after treatment.

A 40-year-old male continued ascending to 14,200-foot camp despite experiencing symptoms of severe altitude illness, including shortness of breath, cough, and headache, and was later evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Denali National Park, Denali, West Buttress Route, near Zebra Rocks
description: A climber suffered severe altitude illness (HAPE and HACE) near the summit ridge of Denali and was extracted by helicopter after attempts to descend were unsuccessful.
A climber fell while skiing with a loaded sled on the Kahiltna Glacier, injuring his knee and requiring helicopter evacuation.
Two climbers on a guided Denali summit expedition sustained deep frostbite injuries due to extreme cold and wind, requiring evacuation and subsequent amputations for one climber.
Two climbers suffered from carbon monoxide poisoning while cooking in their tent during a storm on Denali; one was found unresponsive and experiencing seizures. Both were treated and evacuated.
A climber was struck by a dislodged boulder while scrambling up Mt. Skarland, resulting in a severe hand injury and requiring a medevac.

location_name: Juneau Icefield, Mendenhall Towers, Main Tower
description: Two climbers fell down a gully and into a crevasse while descending the Mendenhall Towers after completing a first ascent; the cause of the fall is unknown but may have been rockfall or an avalanche.
A 23-year-old climber fell 30 feet while leading a 5.7 sport climb, failing to clip the third bolt and sustaining head, thoracic spine, and pelvic injuries.

A 12-year-old male took a 20-foot ground fall while lead climbing due to inadequate equipment (carabiners not rated for climbing) and inexperience, resulting in a fractured wrist and possible brain injury.
A climber took a 15- to 20-foot ground fall while rappelling at Oak Creek Canyon overlook due to uneven ropes and no stopper knots, sustaining a back injury.

location_name: Flagstaff Area, Oak Creek Overlook, Oak Creek Vista overlook
description: A climber fell 40-60 feet from the top of Oak Creek Vista overlook while preparing to rappel, likely due to the failure of a pre-existing rope anchor around a boulder.
A climber fell 30 feet after protection pulled while leading a trad route, resulting in injuries including a broken toe, bruised back, and head impact.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Avalanche Gulch
description: A climber fell and slid 1,000 feet in Avalanche Gulch after lunging for a dropped cell phone, resulting in a fractured ankle and other injuries.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Avalanche Gulch near the Heart
description: A 65-year-old male climber was struck in the head by rockfall while descending Avalanche Gulch. He had removed his helmet momentarily and suffered a two-inch scalp laceration but was able to self-rescue.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Avalanche Gulch, near the Heart
description: An 18-year-old male broke his ankle while glissading with crampons on Mt. Shasta when his crampons stuck in the snow.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Mt. Shasta, west face
description: A novice climber fell approximately 1,500 feet on Mt. Shasta's west face after slipping while off-route and failing to self-arrest, resulting in a broken heel, toe, sprained ankle, and knee injury.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Mt. Shasta
description: A climber on Mt. Shasta was struck in the ankle by a large rock, resulting in a likely ankle fracture and a self-rescue to Helen Lake, followed by helicopter evacuation.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Red Banks
description: A 49-year-old male climber slipped while downclimbing through Red Banks, fell approximately 200 feet, and sustained facial lacerations and abrasions but was able to continue his descent.
Hans Florine fell approximately 20 feet while speed climbing The Nose on El Capitan after a nut failed, resulting in leg injuries.
A climber was lowered on a single rope without a stopper knot and fell approximately 10 meters to the ground, suffering numerous serious injuries.
Climbers descending El Capitan via East Ledges got stranded after rappelling with a single rope on a descent requiring two ropes, leading to a YOSAR rescue.
Two climbers, inexperienced with the descent, got stranded on the East Ledges rappels after rappelling off-route due to fatigue and haste. They were rescued the next morning by SAR.
Two climbers fell approximately 1,000 feet to the base of El Capitan after a rope was severed; no protection was found placed in the rock leading to Mammoth Terraces.
A climber leading the Kor Roof fell after back-cleaning and a quickdraw unclipped or was never clipped, resulting in a fall to Dinner Ledge and head injuries.

Three climbers were involved in a sliding fall on Mt. Whitney's "The Chute" snowfield; two sustained major injuries due to lack of crampons and ice axe, while the third suffered a spinal injury attempting to stop them.
A climber was trapped by a shifting talus boulder on Mt. Conness, resulting in a crushing injury to his leg and requiring amputation.

location_name: Sierra Nevada, Palisades, Thunderbolt Peak, North Couloir
description: A climber fell approximately 300 feet while downclimbing loose 4th-class terrain in the North Couloir of Thunderbolt Peak, suffering major trauma. His partner activated a PLB, and he was rescued the next day.

location_name: Bishop, Pine Creek Canyon, Gateway Slabs
description: An experienced climber took a long ground fall after a miscommunication with the belayer who took him off belay when the climber expected to be lowered.
A climber fell after a hold broke while leading a first ascent, resulting in fractured calcaneus bones in both feet due to impact with a small ledge.
A climber fell into the river after the belayer lowered him off the end of the rope, failing to tie a stopper knot; the climber sustained a collapsed lung and broken ribs.
Climbers rappelled from a non-rappel anchor, resulting in ropes getting stuck and requiring rescue. They ignored warning tags and lacked situational awareness.

A climber fell 30-40 feet while leading the fifth pitch of Yellow Spur after getting off route and attempting a difficult move without protection, resulting in a concussion, intracranial hemorrhage, laceration, and puncture wound.
A climber fell while leading Tower Crack, pulling out a cam and hitting a ledge, resulting in a sprained ankle.
A climber fell after an anchor broke, triggering an avalanche and resulting in injuries and a rescue.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Sunnyside
description: A climber fell approximately 50 feet after incorrectly setting up a rappel to clean a route, sustaining a broken back, broken neck, and head laceration.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Miller Fork, Camelot
description: A climber cleaning a route pulled off a large block, causing him to invert and sustain a rock rash; the block shattered near his partner.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Bruise Brothers
description: A climber was bitten by a copperhead snake while climbing at Bruise Brothers wall in Muir Valley and was transported to a local hospital.
A 23-year-old man scouting for new climbs at Taylor's Falls slipped and fell about 50 feet, sustaining fractured vertebrae, ribs, skull, and other injuries.
A 13-year-old girl got her knee stuck in a wide crack while climbing at Robinson Park and had to be rescued.
Parker Kempf dislodged a large sandstone flake while climbing, resulting in a ground fall and injuries to his legs.
A climbing guide fell 40 feet while leading an ice climb due to inadequate protection and fatigue, resulting in a fractured femur and broken elbow.

location_name: Mt. Washington, Tuckerman Ravine, Right Gully
description: A climber fell approximately 300 feet while ascending near the top of Right Gully in Tuckerman Ravine due to icy conditions and inability to self-arrest, resulting in presumed bruised or fractured ribs.
A climber fell while skiing on icy terrain, failed to self-arrest, and dislocated their shoulder after falling off a rock while stopping.

location_name: Mount Washington, Tuckerman Ravine, Hillman’s Highway, Lobster Claw, Little Headwall, Left Gully, Chute
description: Seven human-triggered avalanches occurred in Tuckerman Ravine on April 7, with at least five people caught in one avalanche in Hillman's Highway, resulting in two injuries. The avalanches were triggered by a combination of weather conditions and human actions.

location_name: Organ Mountains, Pyramid of the South Rabbit Ear
description: A climber rappelling in the Organ Mountains was struck by a 50-60 pound rockfall, resulting in a shattered thumb, but was able to self-rescue with his partner.
A climber fell while leading an ice climb due to poor ice conditions and inadequate protection, resulting in serious injuries including fractures and a puncture wound.

A climber nearly unclipped from the anchor while setting up a rappel, due to deviating from his usual routine and not noticing the rope was his personal anchor. The team was on a ledge and corrected the issue.
A top-rope anchor system failed due to hardware store webbing and clothesline, causing a climber to fall 20 feet and injure themselves and another person.
A climber fell while leading Nice 5.9 in the Trapps after a piece of protection pulled, resulting in a traumatic brain injury.

A climber fell approximately 80 feet from Grand Traverse Ledge while preparing an anchor after completing the first pitch of Arrow, resulting in death. The partner sustained burns attempting to arrest the fall.
A climber fell in the High Exposure area of the Trapps while free soloing; the exact route and cause are unknown.

location_name: Shawangunks, Peters Kill area, Bunk Bed Wall
description: A climber suffered a traumatic open fracture of the right ankle after falling 15 feet during a top-rope lower when the belayer fed rope out before ensuring the climber's weight was on the system.
A climber fell 20 feet on the third pitch of Anguish, swung into the cliff face, and suffered a traumatic brain injury.
A climber leading the second pitch of Modern Times (5.8+) in the Trapps fell approximately 20 feet above their last protection, resulting in a pendulum swing and rib cage injuries.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, The Parking Lot
description: A climber fell to the ground after incorrectly clipping a sling and the belayer failed to arrest the fall in time, resulting in a bruised tailbone.

location_name: Pilot Mountain State Park, Black Rain Wall
description: An inexperienced climber fell while attempting to clip the fourth bolt on Black Rain, hitting a ledge and sustaining a severe head laceration because they were not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Pisgah National Forest, Looking Glass Rock
description: A climber fell 12-15 feet when their foot slipped and two cams pulled, impacting a ledge and injuring their ankle; they were lowered and hiked out.

location_name: Hanging Rock State Park, Moore’s Wall
route_name: Breaking Rocks Is Hard to Do
description: A climber fell approximately 30 feet while leading Breaking Rocks Is Hard to Do, resulting in a ground fall and fractured ribs.
A climber fell while leading the first pitch of The Daddy (5.6) due to inexperience and not placing protection, resulting in an open fracture of the lower leg and requiring a helicopter rescue.
A climber lost footing while descending Mt. Hood and fell 700 feet due to inadequate equipment for self-arrest, resulting in a fatality.

An experienced skier fell approximately 400 feet after losing control on hard frozen corn snow while attempting a ski descent of the Mazama Chute on Mt. Hood, resulting in extensive injuries and a complex rescue.
A roped party of three climbers fell on Mt. Hood while descending the Pearly Gates due to inexperience and inadequate equipment, resulting in injuries and a helicopter rescue.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Mount Shuksan
description: A climber descending Mount Shuksan on the Fisher Chimney route fell after a "snap" was heard, possibly due to snow buildup in crampons, resulting in a fractured fibula.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: Andrew Baldyga fell approximately 600 feet on the East Face of Mount Teewinot while descending a snowfield, after losing control during a voluntary glissade and likely catching a crampon; he died from massive trauma.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: A climber fell on snow, lost self arrest, and fell into a moat, sustaining a basal skull fracture and facial fractures.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area, Mount Minsi, Mount Tammany
description: A climber, Dan O'Malley, fell after a large rock broke off the route, severing his rope and causing fatal injuries.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area, Mount Tammany
description: Laura Glockeler was ascending a fixed rope when she reached for a large rock that broke off, crushing her left arm.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area, Mount Minsi
description: A climber fell 20 feet after a foothold broke loose, sustaining serious injuries. During the rescue, a ledge gave way, injuring a rescuer.

location_name: Mount Whitney, Giant Staircase of the East Face route
description: Graeme Taylor fell 40 feet when a snow mushroom collapsed while leading on Mt. Whitney, sustaining injuries that prevented him from climbing further.
A 64-year-old man lost control while glissading with crampons, resulting in a fractured fibula when his crampon caught on a hard patch of snow.
Lev Sarkisov fell 400 feet while descending unroped from Denali Pass, sustaining numerous broken ribs and requiring rescue.

location_name: Yoho National Park, Mount Stephen, China Wall
description: A climber leading an A3 pitch on Mount Stephen fell 20 meters when a hook hold broke, pulling out two bolts, and sustained deep lacerations to his knee.
Chris Chesnutt fell 80 feet while setting up a rappel after climbing Ironic (5.11) in Prentice Cooper State Park, sustaining multiple injuries due to low light, exhaustion, and not being tied in.
A climber fell on hard snow and water ice on the Hotlum/Bolam Ridge of Mount Shasta, sustaining fatal injuries after being unable to self-arrest.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison, North Chasm wall
description: Zach Alberts fell while leading the Cruise route, sustaining possible fractures to both ankles, and was rescued from the North Chasm wall.

location_name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison, Cruise Gully
description: Martha Moses fell 80 feet while lead-climbing Cruise Gully in intermittent rain, sustaining severe head injuries and requiring a nighttime rescue.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak
description: Two climbers were reported overdue on Kiener's Route due to early winter conditions, resulting in a 40-hour climb and descent; they were found exhausted but uninjured.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Transformer Wall
description: Daniel Hansen fell while attempting Dynamo Hum, missing the start and landing on an erosion control retaining wall, fracturing and dislocating his ankle.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Crack House at Castle Rocks
description: Jamie Aghain fell head first into a crevice while scrambling down from the Crack House, sustaining a subdural hematoma.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, North Twin Sister
description: Robert Laymon fell while climbing unroped on North Twin Sister, possibly due to distraction from a nearby wildfire and the area being closed to the public, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber fell about 30 feet after an old sling broke while attempting to aid through a move, resulting in a fractured pelvis and fibula, and a laceration to the knee.
A 66-year-old climber fell 20 feet after his protection pulled out, resulting in a crushed pelvis.

Caroline Brugvin fell 40-50 feet while leading the 20th pitch of Mescalito on El Capitan, sustaining minor injuries and a shoulder injury due to pulled protection and inadequate food, leading to a rescue.
A climber fell approximately 30 feet after catching a crampon on his pant leg, resulting in a sprained ankle and bruised hip; he was rescued by helicopter.
Marc Springer ascended from 7,200 feet to 14,200 feet in four days and developed HACE/HAPE, requiring air evacuation along with another climber, Borja, who had a bruised hip and sprained ankle.
A solo climber fell approximately 600 feet on Sargents Ridge after slipping on ice while not wearing crampons, sustaining multiple serious injuries.
A climber leading the third pitch of Ottawa Route at Bon Echo was struck by a dislodged granite block, causing a deep gash to her leg, requiring a rescue and hospitalization.
An inexperienced climber fell 30 feet after failing to follow the route and inadequately placing protection, which pulled out during the fall.

location_name: Broken Top, Broken Top mountain summit
description: A hiker with little mountaineering experience disappeared while climbing Broken Top in late afternoon with inadequate gear; search efforts were unsuccessful.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle and South Tetons, South Fork of Cascade Canyon
description: A 14-year-old boy scout developed HAPE after climbing the Middle and South Tetons and was rescued by a ranger who recognized the symptoms and helped him descend to a lower elevation.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Upper Saddle
description: Two brothers experienced altitude sickness (AMS, HAPE, HACE) while climbing the Grand Teton and were assisted by rangers.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Hanging Canyon
description: A woman backpacking in Hanging Canyon developed HAPE and nearly died, complicated by hypothermia from sitting in a creek.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, East Ridge of the Grand Teton, above the Second Tower
description: A climber attempting a "light and fast" ascent of the East Ridge of the Grand Teton developed HAPE and other altitude-related symptoms, requiring a rescue and hospitalization.

A climber fell approximately 35 feet while being lowered on Darkness ’til Dawn because the rope was too short and the end slipped through the belay device. The climber sustained serious head injuries and was not wearing a helmet.
A NOLS expedition was hit by high wind or possible avalanche debris on the Upper Harper Glacier, resulting in lost gear and mild frostbite, but no serious injuries.

Two climbers, Benjamin Hernstedt and Jeffrey Dupuis, fell to their deaths on the Ingraham Glacier after a suspected slip and fall above an ice cliff. They were found entangled in rope at the base of the cliff.

A rope team of three fell into a crevasse on the Ingraham Glacier after a wind gust knocked one climber off her feet, pulling the others along. One climber broke an ankle, and the other two sustained minor head injuries.
A climber fell 35-40 feet after a handhold pulled out while leading the first pitch of Warpy Moople, resulting in a severe concussion and hospitalization.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Liberty Ridge and Kautz Glacier
description: The Quillen party of two was rescued from a summit crevasse bivouac on Mount Rainier after being overdue due to a significant storm and slow climbing pace on Liberty Ridge.

location_name: Mount Rainier, Liberty Ridge and Kautz Glacier
description: Climber Yong Phan broke his lower leg/ankle while sliding with crampons on the approach to Camp Hazard and was rescued.
Lee Jung Park injured her ankle while descending the West Buttress route on Mt. McKinley and was lowered by teammates and another team before being evacuated by helicopter.
A guide was diagnosed with High Altitude Pulmonary Edema (HAPE) and evacuated by helicopter.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Grand Teton, Eye of the Needle
description: Joe Hestick fell 30-60 feet near the Eye of the Needle while descending the Grand Teton after being caught in a severe storm, resulting in a possible dislocated hip.
A climber was injured when a loose block dislodged while following a route near Blockbuster, striking his knee.
A 44-year-old experienced climber fell while leading Strictly from Nowhere (5.7) and struck his head, resulting in a fatality; he was not wearing a helmet and did not protect the traversing moves.
A guide fell 20 feet to the ground after a piece of protection pulled while leading a 5.10 route, resulting in fused vertebrae and broken ribs.

location_name: Kluane National Park Reserve, Mount Logan
description: A climber fell on Mount Logan's East Ridge while taking a photo during stormy weather and high altitude conditions, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Yukon Territory, Kluane National Park Reserve, Mount Caubvick
description: Two climbers died on Mount Caubvick after a rappel anchor pulled, causing one climber to fall and sustain leg injuries; the other climber was unable to descend and both perished from exposure due to inadequate clothing and a wicked snowstorm.
A climber fell while traversing a wet slab due to inadequate protection and inexperience, resulting in a head injury and other minor injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mount McKinley, West Buttress
description: Climbers descending the West Buttress route on Mount McKinley were struck by falling rocks; one climber died and two were seriously injured.
Jason Harper was dropped off at Windy Ridge for an attempt on Mount Sanford and was not found after 12 days of searching, presumed perished.
Two climbers fell about 100 feet into a crevasse on the Sandy Glacier after slipping and failing to place protection. One climber died from back injuries, and the other suffered a broken arm.
Beau Clark died from a heart attack while climbing with friends on Broughton's Bluff; he was found hanging 30 feet above the ground.
A climber drowned while attempting to retrieve a climbing shoe from the ocean after it was washed away by high tide.
A climber fell approximately 10 feet while soloing The Fireman's Ladder due to wet rock, resulting in soft tissue tears and snapped ligaments in their left ankle and foot.

location_name: Big Cottonwood Canyon, upper S-Curves area of Big Cottonwood Canyon
description: A climber fell 60 feet while being lowered after cleaning a route due to communication problems and slack in the rope; he sustained a fractured sacrum and other injuries.
Robert Moor fell 100 feet to his death when the ice he was attached to broke off while ice climbing in Maple Canyon.

location_name: Various Locations, Moss Ledges picnic area
description: A 21-year-old man free-soloing at Moss Ledges slipped on a wet rock and fell approximately 15 feet, landing on his head and died at the scene.
Tim Roberts fell 20 feet after his climbing rope slipped and his partner was unable to regain control, resulting in several broken vertebrae.

location_name: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Coal Pit Gulch
description: A 25-year-old man free-soloing in Coal Pit Gulch fell when a handhold pulled out, resulting in facial lacerations and a possible broken ankle.
Patrick Desisto was rescued after being stranded on a ledge for 19 hours near Bridal Veil Falls after a large boulder fell on his hands, causing lacerations and broken bones.
A 50-year-old man rappelled off the end of his rope in Pine Creek Canyon, falling 15 feet and sustaining fractures to his ribs and femur.
A solo climber fell approximately 400 feet while climbing near Malan's Peak in Ogden Canyon, Utah and died.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton and Disappointment Peak
description: A climber was injured by falling rocks while climbing the Chouinard Ridge on the Middle Teton and required rescue.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak, Spoon Couloir
description: Elizabeth Messaros dislocated her shoulder after slipping on hard-packed snow on Disappointment Peak and sliding about 150 feet into rocks due to inadequate clothing, equipment, and inexperience.

location_name: Kluane National Park, Mount Logan, East Ridge
description: A climber was swept off her feet by a small avalanche on the East Ridge of Mount Logan and fell 1,500 feet, resulting in fatal head injuries.

location_name: Mount Whitney, Snowfield between the summit and the notch
description: A climber fell to his death after losing control while glissading on a steep, icy snowfield during the descent of Mount Whitney.
A climber fell over 1,000 feet on a steep slope while putting on skis after descending from the summit, sustaining serious injuries.
A climber was hit by a falling rock while descending the Disappointment Cleaver on Mount Rainier and sustained injuries.
A climber fell ten feet into a crevasse on the Ingraham Glacier, injuring his shoulder. His partners arrested the fall, and rangers assisted him in descending.
A 62-year-old college professor died after a large piece of rock broke free while he was climbing, causing him to fall about 38 meters.
A climber fell 30-40 feet on Turner's Flake after a cam failed, resulting in a broken wrist and head injury due to not wearing a helmet.

location_name: North Cascades, Mt. Baker, Spider/Formidable Couloir
description: A climber with limited rock experience dislocated his knee, then later fell on snow and tumbled over rocks, sustaining further injuries due to communication breakdown and exceeding his comfort level.

location_name: Cannon Cliff, Cannon Cliff, Moby Grape
description: A climber leading the first pitch of Moby Grape had a large piece of rock give way under his weight, resulting in a fall and a leg injury from rock fragments.

location_name: Crowders Mountain State Park, Red Wall
description: A climber fell approximately 20 feet while attempting a rock climb, sustaining injuries to her left leg and arm.
An experienced climber fell to his death after rappelling off the end of his rope on Poke-O-Moonshine; he was not using an autoblock and the rope was not knotted.

location_name: Mount Shasta, Hotlum Glacier and in Camp
description: A climber jumped into a shallow crevasse and broke his tibia. Later, while urinating in camp, he fell and dislocated his shoulder. He was evacuated the next day.

location_name: Cathedral Ledges, Cathedral Ledges, upper left wall
description: A leader fell when a TCU and a nut pulled out while attempting Double Vee, resulting in a broken wrist and compressed thoracic vertebrae.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Symmetry Spire
description: A climber dislocated his shoulder after a short pendulum fall while climbing a 5.7 section of rock on Symmetry Spire.
While pulling a stuck rope, climbers dislodged rocks, one of which hit a climber in the head, causing injury despite wearing a helmet.
Claude Ratté, climbing solo on Mount McKinley's West Buttress, fell between 16,200 and 17,200 feet, sustaining injuries to his left eye and ankle, requiring a technical rope rescue.
A 35-year-old woman died on Mt. Shasta after falling and being unable to self-arrest; she and her two companions were not wearing helmets.
A climber fell while leading on Tahquitz Rock after a nut pulled out, resulting in a fall off a ledge and injuries to both the climber and belayer.
A climber fell 45 feet at Foothill Crag when the rope burned through a webbing anchor during lowering, resulting in serious injuries.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Taylor Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Thatchtop Mountain due to darkness and inadequate planning after climbing Taylor Glacier on Taylor Peak.
An experienced climber fell past their belayer to the ground, resulting in a fatality. The climber was either setting protection or the protection pulled out.
A climber with 36 years of experience rappelled off one end of the rope due to an incorrectly marked mid-point, falling ten feet.
A climber fell on Mount Yamnuska after a handhold broke, resulting in a broken ankle and requiring rescue.

location_name: Mount McKinley, Southeast Ridge of Mount Foraker
description: Four climbers on Mount Foraker triggered a large slab avalanche, resulting in injuries including pneumothorax, dislocated shoulder, and fractured humerus; they self-evacuated and were flown out.
Three climbers attempting the Lost Arrow Spire got benighted due to a late start, miscommunication, and rope drag, leading to being stranded and abandoning gear.
Two scramblers started late on Mount Norquay, were caught in worsening weather, and became benighted. They were rescued by a Parks Mountain Rescue Specialist.
A 61-year-old climber collapsed and died at 13,500 feet on Mount McKinley, likely due to a medical problem exacerbated by fatigue and elevation.
A climber fell 40-50 feet on "Calling Wolfgang" due to two bolt hanger failures, resulting in scrapes and bruises.
A climber fell on a snow/ice patch while descending the Northwest Ridge of Capitol Peak and sustained fatal injuries.
A free-solo climber was found dead at the bottom of Highlander Crag in Clear Creek Canyon after falling while climbing Lovers Leap.
A climber was lowered off the end of a rope that was too short for the route, resulting in a 20-25 foot fall and injuries to his back/pelvis/hip.
A climber fell while being belayed, possibly due to the rope being too short and running through the belay device; the climber died.
A climbing party of three was overdue on Mount Hood; one member was found dead after a fall, and the other two are missing and presumed injured or dead due to a fall and subsequent hypothermia.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Longs Peak, The Diamond
description: A climber fell to his death on Longs Peak after pulling a loose rock while attempting to solo the Dunn-Westbay route on The Diamond.
Tim Reid fell approximately 40 feet while rappelling due to a miscommunication with his belayer about whether the rope was anchored.

location_name: Mount Shasta Wilderness, Mount Shasta, Bolam Glacier, Whitney
description: Two climbers summited Mount Shasta late and experienced high winds. One climber, Tom Bennett, developed HACE and died despite CPR attempts. The other climber, Mr. Thomas, descended and was rescued.
A climber slipped and tumbled on rock and snow while descending the Disappointment Cleaver route, sustaining head and neck injuries, including a fractured C-7 vertebra.
A climber at Camp Muir experienced difficulty breathing and was diagnosed with high altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) after a summit attempt, requiring airlift evacuation.

A climber experienced severe high altitude cerebral edema (HACE) and was evacuated from Mount Rainier. The patient's condition was recognized by other climbers and guides, highlighting a potential reliance on others' expertise rather than self-assessment.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Twist and Crawl
description: The belayer failed to tie the end of the rope, resulting in the leader falling to the ground when being lowered.

location_name: City of Rocks National Reserve, Sturs Chimney on Mount Heyburn in the Sawtooth Wilderness area
description: Two climbers were off-route when one fell about 50 feet, resulting in a sprain and fracture, but they were able to self-rescue.
James Murphy fell over 100 feet when his rappel anchor came loose from the tree around which it had been placed due to improper anchor replacement and inexperience.

location_name: Devils Tower National Monument, Devils Tower
description: Five climbers became stranded on Devils Tower due to a stuck rope, lack of headlamps and cold weather clothing, requiring a rescue. All climbers returned safely with minor signs of hypothermia.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, high camp
description: Brian Young, 52, suffered cardiac arrest at high camp on Mount McKinley after summiting, following symptoms of altitude illness; he was pronounced dead after failed CPR.

location_name: Red River Gorge, Muir Valley, Practice Wall
description: A climber fell on a trad route when their protection pulled out, resulting in a crushed vertebra.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Saddle Rock
description: Dave Pinegar fell to his death while rappelling after failing to clip into the anchor; the rope may have been too short for the rappel.
Two climbers ascended from Browne Tower, one developed HAPE/HACE, and required a helicopter evacuation after his condition worsened despite treatment and deteriorating weather conditions.

location_name: Beacon Rock State Park, Beacon Rocks State Park
description: A climber fell to his death during a rappel after a miscommunication with his partner led to a failure to tie a backup knot and a misjudgment of the rope's midpoint, resulting in rappelling off the end of the rope.
A climber experienced extreme abdominal and back pain on the summit of Mount Rainier and required helicopter evacuation.
A climber suffered from frostbite at 10,800 feet on the Disappointment Cleaver and required helicopter extrication.
A solo climber was stranded on Mt. Hood due to a storm and whiteout conditions, requiring rescue. Cell phone use was both helpful and problematic due to battery drain.
A 23-year-old woman with no climbing experience fell 30-35 feet while solo bouldering at Monument Cove and sustained extensive injuries.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: Three mountaineers triggered an avalanche on Mt. McKinley while attempting a non-standard route, resulting in injuries to two members who were later evacuated.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: A climber on the West Buttress of Mt. McKinley experienced HAPE and was treated at the 14,200-foot camp before being walked down the mountain with supplemental oxygen.

location_name: Denali National Park, Mt. McKinley, West Buttress
description: A guided climber descending from the summit of Denali experienced HAPE and was evacuated by helicopter after medical care at 17,200 feet failed to improve his condition.
Kim Hongbim became seriously ill with AMS and HAPE at Denali Pass, requiring rescue and suffering severe frostbite; his rapid ascent and failure to descend contributed to the incident.
Geo Bong Kim developed high altitude cerebral edema and pulmonary edema at 17,200 feet on Mount McKinley and was airlifted from 14,200 feet after his condition remained critical.
A climber took a long lead fall while reaching for a bolt and impacted a tree, resulting in broken ribs, a punctured lung, and a broken scapula.
Two climbers got stranded on slabs during descent after climbing Northwest Books due to one climber's fear of crossing the terrain, requiring SAR assistance.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Garnet Canyon, Petzoldt Caves
description: Edward Tom fell 80-100 feet to his death while scrambling near the Petzoldt Caves Camping Zone after encountering wet, lichen-covered rock and searching for an alternate campsite due to overcrowding.

location_name: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Wheels of Fire Direct
description: A climber fell on Wheels of Fire Direct, pulled a piece, and sustained hip and ankle injuries after hitting the wall. He was lowered to the ground and rescued.
A climber fell approximately 60 feet while free soloing Crazy River (5.9) at Black Fork in Pisgah National Forest, sustaining serious injuries.
John Ridenour fell 35-40 feet while rock climbing at Practice Rock in Hyalite Canyon due to inadequate protection and died.

location_name: Acadia National Park, The Precipice, South Wall of Champlain Mountain
description: A guide fell approximately 30 feet due to a lowering error when the end of the rope slipped through the belayer's device, resulting in significant injuries.
John Andrews fell more than 200 feet near the Hogsback area and was rescued by multiple teams and transported to a hospital.

A climbing team of three fell into a crevasse on the Emmons Glacier after one climber slipped and was unable to self-arrest, pulling the others in. They sustained multiple injuries and were rescued by helicopter.
A climber rappelled off the short end of his rope due to uneven ropes and lack of end knots, resulting in a fall and injuries.

location_name: New River Gorge National River, Star Trek Wall
description: A climber rappelled off the end of his rope at Star Trek Wall and fell about 35 feet, sustaining lower limb and back injuries.

location_name: North Cascades National Park, Black Peak
description: Two climbers became stranded on Black Peak after exceeding their abilities, requiring a helicopter rescue; they were uninjured.
A climber dislodged a rock on pitch four, striking his belayer on the ankle and causing a fracture. The party self-rescued and rappelled while KPS responded.
A climber got stuck during a rappel on the First Flatiron due to a rope snag and lack of equipment to ascend the rope; the party was rescued without injuries.
A soloist fell about 40 feet from the 5.6 friction-slab crux of the direct east face of the First Flatiron and suffered serious injuries.
A solo climber sustained life-threatening injuries after a suspected rockfall caused him to fall approximately 100 feet on the Upper Exum Ridge.
Two climbers attempted Mt. Sifton, decided to descend a snow slope, and the lead climber fell after the snow gave way, resulting in soft tissue injuries and bruising.
A rescuer stumbled on loose talus during a late-night descent after a body recovery, resulting in a fall and a concussion.
A climber fell and tumbled down the Bell Cord Couloir on the Maroon Bells, resulting in a fatality.
A climber was pulled off the wall by a falling haul bag, fell about 20 meters, pulled one piece of protection, and was held by a Tri-cam, resulting in a foot injury.

location_name: Delaware Water Gap NRA, Mount Tammany
description: Mike Morlock fell 45-60 feet after an old, rusted piton broke while he was downclimbing, but he sustained only minor injuries.
A climber sustained fractures to the lumbar spine while rappelling off Horseman due to uneven rope ends, falling approximately 15 feet.
A 46-year-old experienced climber fell 50 feet or more while soloing Cascading Crystal Kaleidoscope (5.7) in the Trapps and died.
A 28-year-old climber fell approximately 10 feet while leading the start of CCK Direct, sustaining an open lower leg fracture.
A climber fell approximately 500 feet into a crevasse while downclimbing on hard ice, suffering fatal injuries.

location_name: Mt. Jefferson, Jefferson Park Glacier, Three Fingered Jack
description: A 22-year-old man fell approximately 700 feet after unroping atop the summit pinnacle of Three Fingered Jack.

location_name: Cathedral Ledge State Park, Barber Wall
description: A climber fell 40 feet on Double Vee after multiple pieces of protection ripped out, resulting in a ground fall and serious injuries.

location_name: Cathedral Ledge State Park, Barber Wall, Cathedral Ledge
description: A climber fell due to inadequate protection.

location_name: Mt. Hood, South Side, Mazama Chute
description: A roped team of two fell on snow while descending the Mazama Chute, resulting in ankle and lower leg fractures after failing to self-arrest; the slide ended in the Hot Rocks area.

location_name: Mt. Hood, South Side, Mazama Chute
description: A solo climber fell approximately 450 feet after a crampon malfunction and inability to self-arrest, ending his slide in a fumarole with minor injuries.
Two climbers fell 800-1000 feet on the Ice Cliff Glacier after a snow step collapsed and their protection failed, resulting in serious injuries.
