location_name: Red Rock National Conservation Area, Oak Creek Canyon
description: A climber died in Red Rock while rappelling due to uneven rope lengths, causing him to fall to the ground.

location_name: Red Rock National Conservation Area, Oak Creek Canyon
description: A climber fell approximately 100 feet while rappelling in Red Rock after an apparent error in setting up a biner block rappel anchor, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Mt. Rainier National Park, Sluiskin Mountain
description: Timothy Hagan died after a rappel anchor failed on Sluiskin Mountain; the anchor had a compromised knot and was not adequately inspected.
A 66-year-old climber slipped and fell about 400 feet on the South Side Route, resulting in fatal injuries; a medical incident may have contributed to the fall.

location_name: Mt. Hood, South Side, chute below the summit
description: A climber was struck by a microwave-size boulder while descending a chute below the summit, fracturing her lower leg.

location_name: Banff National Park, Polar Circus, Mt. Cirrus
description: A climber was caught in an avalanche while crossing a snow slope on the Polar Circus ice climb and died as a result of trauma sustained in the avalanche.

location_name: Devil's Lake State Park, West Bluff
description: A climber fell approximately 25 feet after protection pulled out, resulting in injuries to his wrist, hip, and possible back injury.

location_name: Devil's Lake State Park, West Bluff
description: A climber fell while bouldering at Devil's Lake, West Bluff.
A climber fell while leading, skipping protection, and struck a boulder, resulting in multiple broken bones and head injuries.
A climber was struck by falling ice while ascending the Sorcerer route, sustaining head and neck injuries including a concussion and sprain, and was subsequently rescued.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Peak, Red Gully
description: A climber slipped on an icy patch while descending Crestone Peak and fell approximately 150 feet, sustaining serious injuries including a collapsed lung.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Peak, Red Gully
description: Anika Jimenez fell in the Red Gully on Crestone Peak and sustained an ankle injury while descending.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Peak, Red Gully
description: Christopher Kiryluk died from a fall in the Red Gully on Crestone Peak after slipping on snow while descending without crampons or Micro Spikes.

location_name: Sangre de Cristo Range, Crestone Peak, Red Gully
description: Bruce Owen suffered a broken ankle from a slip and fall in the Red Gully on Crestone Peak.
A 38-year-old male leader fell 30-40 feet while off route on the first pitch of the Southeast Buttress Route on Cathedral Peak, resulting in a broken ankle and a pendulum across the face.
A climber fell on the fourth pitch of the Southeast Buttress Route when her protection pulled, resulting in ankle injuries. She and her partner self-rescued and were then extracted by helicopter.

location_name: Mt. Shasta, Avalanche Gulch, Red Banks
description: A father fell approximately 500 feet while climbing a difficult route on Red Banks in Avalanche Gulch and died from his injuries.
A 76-year-old man fell on the Clear Creek Route at approximately 9,600 feet, failed to self-arrest, and slid into a rock, resulting in fatal injuries.
A 66-year-old climber on Denali's West Buttress developed high altitude cerebral edema (HACE) while descending from the summit and died despite rescue efforts.
A climber at 14,200 feet on the West Buttress Route developed High Altitude Cerebral Edema (HACE) and was evacuated by helicopter.
A climber broke a hold on a 5.10d route, fell 15 meters, and hit a ledge, resulting in a fractured hip and minor head injury.
A leader fell 10 meters on Forbidden Corner after a hold broke and protection pulled, resulting in a compound fracture of the lower right leg.

location_name: Angeles National Forest, Mt. San Antonio (a.k.a. Mt. Baldy)
description: Three people fatally fell on Mt. San Antonio (Mt. Baldy) due to unusually icy conditions; one person fell 1,500 feet from the Devil’s Backbone Trail.

location_name: Angeles National Forest, Mt. San Antonio (a.k.a. Mt. Baldy)
description: Three people died and one was seriously injured after falling on icy chutes on Mt. San Antonio (Mt. Baldy) in February.

location_name: Angeles National Forest, Mt. San Antonio (Mt. Baldy), Mt. Harwood, Devil’s Backbone Trail
description: Three people died in falls on Mt. San Antonio (Mt. Baldy) and Mt. Harwood due to icy conditions; one fell 1500 feet while wearing crampons, and two others fell while hiking the Devil's Backbone Trail.
A climber leading pitch two of Skylight (WI4+) was hit by an unknown falling object and fell approximately 35 feet, sustaining fractured ribs and a hemopneumothorax.

location_name: Ouray, Camp Bird Road, Lincoln Falls
description: An ice climber leading Scottish Gully fell 40 feet when a large sheet of ice broke loose, but was stopped by a screw placement.
A climber leading the second pitch of Still in Saigon fell at the crux, sailed past her gear, and broke her foot upon impacting the rock.

A climber fell 60 feet after dislodging a loose rock on Temple Crag, sustaining a broken toe, sprained ankle, broken finger, and lacerations. The fall was arrested by a cam, and the climber completed the route.
A climber became lost during descent in high winds and cold temperatures on Mt. Hood, developing hypothermia and frostbite.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, El Capitan, East Ledges Descent
description: A climber rappelling the East Ledges on El Capitan at night mistakenly used a garbage rope, which dislodged when weighted, resulting in a fatal fall.
A climber became separated from their group on the descent from Mt. Rainier in high winds and cold temperatures, leading to frostbite and hypothermia, but was rescued after calling 911.

location_name: Mt. Rainier National Park, Emmons Glacier
description: A climber became ill with altitude sickness at 11,500 feet on the Emmons Glacier route and was unable to descend, requiring a helicopter rescue.
A climber fell while attempting to clip a quickdraw, resulting in the amputation of his thumb by the rope. The thumb was successfully reattached after rapid evacuation and surgery.
A climber fell after his rope was likely cut over a sharp edge while climbing on Matthes Crest, resulting in a fatality.
A solo climber sustained frostbite injuries to all ten fingers while ascending from the 14,200-foot camp toward the 17,200-foot camp on the West Buttress and required rescue and medical treatment.

location_name: Owens River Gorge, Joe’s Garage area
description: A climber fell 20 feet when fixed quickdraws broke at two bolts, resulting in minor injuries.
A climber leading a sport route fell after a hold came loose, striking his head on a tree and the wall, resulting in a mild traumatic brain injury and lacerations.

location_name: New River Gorge, Bubba City, Tattoo Wall
description: A relatively new climber fell onto a ledge while leading Mrs. Field’s Follies, resulting in a comminuted fracture to the calcaneus and talus.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Swan Slab and Church Bowl
description: A climber fell approximately 25 feet after the rope was too short while being lowered, resulting in back and hip pain; the climber was not wearing a helmet.

location_name: Yosemite Valley, Swan Slab and Church Bowl
description: A climber fell approximately 20 feet to the ground due to the belayer using a rope that was too short while lowering him from a tree anchor at Church Bowl; the rope had been intentionally cut shorter.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Mt. Shasta
description: A climber separated from his party on Mt. Shasta after descending from Red Banks and spent the night out with minimal gear before being assisted down the next morning, uninjured.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Mt. Shasta
description: A climber sustained mild frostbite on her toes during a summit attempt on Mt. Shasta due to wet boots and cold temperatures.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Avalanche Gulch below the Red Banks
description: A climber was struck on the head by rockfall, resulting in a 100-foot fall and unconsciousness; he was rescued and transported to the hospital.

location_name: Mt. Shasta and Castle Crags Wilderness, Mt. Shasta
description: A climber separated from her partner on Mt. Shasta and called for help due to being inadequately prepared; she was found uninjured after a search and rescue operation.
A climber on the East Ridge of Mt. Temple was struck by rock dislodged by a climber above, sustaining a shoulder injury and requiring evacuation.
A climber dislodged a rock while rappelling off-route, striking another climber's head and causing a concussion.
A climber was injured by a rock dislodged by another party rappelling above on the Takakkaw Falls route.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Loft
description: A 39-year-old man died while descending from The Loft in Rocky Mountain National Park after abandoning an attempt on Longs Peak; the cause of death was likely a fall from snow or ice.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Mt. Lady Washington
description: A 31-year-old woman suffered life-threatening injuries from rockfall on Martha, a mixed couloir on Mt. Lady Washington.
A 51-year-old male climber was found dead at the base of The Trough route; it is unknown if he was soloing or scrambling when he fell.
A climber was killed and his brother seriously injured by rockfall in the Larks area on Tahquitz’s north face.
A woman was lowered off the end of her rope, resulting in a tumbling fall and head laceration.
A 29-year-old woman fell from the first pitch of Cosmosis when a nut and small cam pulled out, hitting the belay ledge and breaking an ankle and possibly vertebrae.
Climbers went off route, were benighted, and the leader fell approximately 30 feet while attempting to continue climbing the next morning, resulting in fractures to the lower tibula.

location_name: Flagstaff, Priest Draw, Canyon Spring Wall, De Grazia
description: Robert Drysdale was killed when a large block was dislodged from the top of a boulder problem and hit him in the back of the head.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, Flattop Mountain
description: Two climbers are believed dead after being caught in an avalanche caused by a cornice breaking on Flattop Mountain in Rocky Mountain National Park.
Robert Moore died after losing control while rappelling down El Capitan, likely due to a combination of improper technique, inadequate safety measures, and a casual attitude towards safety.
A climber fell on the top pitch of Diedre at Cathedral Ledge when a #1 cam pulled out, resulting in a fractured tibia requiring surgery.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed frostbite due to inadequate hand protection while ascending the West Buttress route.
Ian Rea experienced frostbite on Mount McKinley due to inadequate foot protection. Both Rea and Holmes were treated for mild to moderate frostbite and released.
Andrew Lainias fell approximately 30 feet after the rope passed through Glenda Lainias' belay device due to inattention and inadequate rope length, resulting in lacerations and contusions.
A climber rapidly ascended Mount McKinley and developed Pulmonary and Cerebral Edema, exacerbated by cooking in a tent without ventilation, requiring evacuation.
A 17-year-old fell 80 feet when the rappel anchor system he and his friends installed came out, resulting in massive head injury and several broken bones.

location_name: Cathedral Ledges and Cannon Cliffs, Cathedral Ledge
description: Two climbers fell on a wet slab, suffering abrasions and bruises. Three years prior, a climber died in a similar accident at the same location while trying to find a path to the top of the Practice Slab.

location_name: Cathedral Ledges and Cannon Cliffs, Cathedral
description: A climber fell near the top of the first lead of Standard Route on Cathedral, sustaining fatal head injuries due to lack of a helmet and inadequate protection in the off-width chimney.

location_name: Cathedral Ledges and Cannon Cliffs, Cannon, Lakeview
description: A climber got stuck on a crux, the leader left for help, and the second climber became hypothermic while waiting in rain and wind.

location_name: New River Gorge and Cooper's Rock
description: A lead climber being lowered was dropped 15-20 feet by the belayer due to running out of rope, resulting in a shattered ankle and helicopter evacuation.

location_name: New River Gorge and Cooper’s Rock
description: An inexperienced 13-year-old climber fell about 30 feet while downclimbing without a rope, resulting in paralysis due to a spinal injury.

location_name: New River Gorge and Cooper’s Rock
description: A climber fell 25 feet after deciding to free climb in a no climbing area and being blown off by the wind, landing on a tree root.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Moran
description: Two climbers died and one was injured when a rappel anchor failed while descending the Direct South Buttress route on Mount Moran.
A 34-year-old male fell approximately 50 feet while climbing Gelsa (5.4) at night in the Shawangunks, resulting in a fatality.

location_name: Rocky Mountain National Park, The Book of Lumpy Ridge
description: Laura Grignon fell 20 feet while leading off-route on The Book, sustaining a compressed T-12 vertebrae.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Red Garden Wall
description: A climber fell 30 feet while leading, pulling out their only piece of protection and hitting their head on a rock, sustaining serious injuries.

Climbers were caught in an avalanche due to unstable snow conditions caused by warm weather and being in a poor position at the bottom of a couloir; they used cellular telephones to call in the accident.

location_name: San Juan Mountains, near County Road 361
description: A climber being top-roped on ice dislodged a log used as directional protection; the log fell and hit him on the head, causing lacerations and a concussion.
A 19-year-old climber with extensive experience climbing without a rope fell and died at Devil's Lake State Park.
A 47-year-old man fell 60 feet to the road while setting up a top rope, resulting in a fatality.
A climber fell approximately 240 feet after a rappel anchor failed due to an improperly tied knot on a sling.

location_name: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Little Cottonwood Canyon
description: A climber fell while solo climbing due to a self-belaying device failing when he turned upside down, resulting in a fractured arm and dislocated shoulder.
Cameron Burns fell from the third bolt on Praise the Lunge and his foot got caught in the quickdraw on the second bolt, causing a sprained ankle.
A climber fell 400-500 feet while descending a frozen snow slope after unclipping from an anchor and losing his footing, resulting in serious injuries.
A climber experienced a slide/fall on ice at Lamarck Col in the Eastern Sierras.
A climber experienced a slide/fall on ice due to inadequate protection.

location_name: Ralph Stover State Park, practice wall
description: Phillipp Grout fell six meters while leading the center crack after being distracted by another climber's rope, resulting in a fractured left heel.
A climber fell 30-45 feet on thin, brittle ice while leading the second pitch of Mummy II, sustaining a bruised elbow.
A climber fell when a block of rock came off, causing placed protection to pull out, resulting in a dislocated shoulder and scalp laceration.

location_name: Eldorado Canyon State Park, Wind Tower
description: Two men and a woman became stranded on the East Face of Wind Tower after climbing about 250 feet and being unable to continue up or climb down.
Two climbers got lost on Cannon Cliff, could not find the exit, and called 911 due to rain and lateness; they were rescued.
Three climbers fell 2,400 feet on the upper Emmons Glacier after summiting Mount Rainier; two died and one was injured.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Middle Teton
description: A climber became lost on the Glacier Route of Middle Teton, got stranded on a ledge in severe winter conditions, and was rescued after two days, suffering from hypothermia, frostbite, and exhaustion.
A climber died after becoming altitude sick and being separated from his partner during a snowstorm on Mount Shasta.

location_name: Joshua Tree National Park, Indian Cove, Willit Slab
description: While leading an A1 bolt ladder, a bolt pulled out under body weight, causing a fall and a traumatic inversion injury to the climber's foot.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, The Autobahn
description: Chihiro Sakamaki fell approximately 1000 feet while descending from 19,000 feet on Mount McKinley, sustaining broken ribs but was able to descend to his camp and was later evacuated.
Debbie Sherman developed severe headache and odd behavior at 19,000 feet, later diagnosed with high altitude pulmonary and cerebral edema, and was evacuated after her condition worsened.
Two climbers were climbing without ropes when one dislodged a rock, causing both to fall and sustain significant injuries.
A climber fell while climbing unroped at Devil's Lake State Park.
A climber fell on a snowfield while descending the Southwest Couloir of Middle Teton, was unable to self-arrest, and slid into talus, sustaining multiple injuries.

location_name: Frankenstein Cliff and Gulf of Slides, Frankenstein Cliff
description: A woman glissading from below Standard Route on Frankenstein Cliff caught a crampon, flipped face down, and injured her ankle.

location_name: Gulf of Slides, Frankenstein Cliff and Gulf of Slides
description: A man glissading in the Gulf of Slides caught a crampon, flipped, and impaled himself on his ice ax; he walked out with the ax still through his abdomen.
A climber attempting Mount Hood via the Sandy Glacier Headwall got off route, became stranded due to deteriorating snow conditions, and required an Air Force helicopter rescue.
A climber fell 160 feet while soloing and died.
A climber allergic to bee stings was stung by hornets on the first pitch of Le Teton and required an epi-pen and hospital visit. Her partner was also stung multiple times while assisting.
Two climbers on El Capitan were caught in a severe rain and sleet storm, became soaked and cold, signaled for rescue, but ultimately rappelled to safety after abandoning their haul bag.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Mount Teewinot
description: Larry L. Fahlberg died while solo climbing the East Face Route on Mount Teewinot after falling approximately 30 feet into a moat and succumbing to injuries and hypothermia.
A climber unfamiliar with the mountain fell to his death after venturing onto a snow patch and sliding into a couloir with his ice ax strapped to his pack.

location_name: Red Rocks Canyon NCA, Rainbow Wall
description: A climber dislodged a large rock that fell and struck his partner, causing head and back injuries including a tension pneumothorax; they rappelled to the base and were rescued.
A climber rappelling the West Ridge of Mount Thompson fell 200 feet when a chockstone anchor failed, resulting in fractures and hypothermia.

location_name: Grand Teton National Park, Disappointment Peak
description: A novice climber fell approximately 150 feet to his death while climbing Disappointment Peak without proper equipment or experience.

location_name: Mount Deception, Eldridge Glacier, southeast spur
description: A climber fell after a cornice collapsed while leading on Mount Deception; his partner jumped off the opposite side to avoid being pulled down, then belayed the injured climber back to basecamp and sought rescue.

location_name: Mount McKinley, West Buttress, Rescue Gully
description: A climber fell 300 feet on snow into a crevasse while descending Rescue Gully on Denali, requiring rescue and hospitalization for a pneumothorax and hypothermia.
A climber on Mount McKinley developed severe High Altitude Pulmonary Edema due to rapid ascent and dehydration, requiring helicopter evacuation.
A climber fell on ice while descending Mount Shasta after separating from his son during a snowstorm and died from hypothermia.
A climber descending the Summit Cone by glissading with crampons snagged a crampon and broke his ankle.
A climber with crampons and no ice ax tripped and slid 300 feet, dislocating his ankle after attempting a voluntary glissade.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Cascade Waterfall
description: A beginner ice climber fell 100 meters after detaching from a rappel and walking unroped on low-angle ice, followed by an avalanche that injured several climbers and caused additional fatalities.

location_name: Alberta, Banff National Park, Cascade Waterfall
description: A climber was swept down the mountain by an avalanche while his partner was rappelling, resulting in a fatal fall. The avalanche occurred after the first climber had detached from the rope.
Ian Bailey suffered snow blindness while descending from Mount McKinley's summit and was treated at the 17,200-foot camp before descending further.

Two expeditions experienced difficulty descending from Mount McKinley's summit, with members suffering from acute mountain sickness, exhaustion, and snow blindness, requiring assistance and treatment.
Three climbers became stranded on Lost Arrow Spire after their fixed rope was missing, and they ran out of water, leading to dehydration and fatigue, requiring a rescue.
